Santa's sack
Christmas Miracle
Christmas has arrived in the city, and you know what that means… presents! Login to see what we've gotten for you!
The house is fully decorated
A great start! One look at your living room and you know that the holidays are coming!
The living room looks so festive now!
Let's open a few more presents, there might be tree decorations inside!
Look at the snow! It's hard to believe that the Baker made it out of flour and starch – it looks just like the real thing.
It's so beautiful! And we've only opened half of the presents: the best is yet to come!
The tree topper looks amazing! It looks like the kids from the Sepat made it themselves. That's so touching!
The tree and the living room look magical! There's no harm in a few little things to make the room look cozy.
I'm sure the citizens have taken care of this as well. Let's open the rest of the presents.
Now the living room is just bursting with festive spirit! The citizens have done so well – they've thought of every little thing.
I thank them for such generous gifts… Oh, I almost forgot, there's one more present to give. Just from me.
Merry Christmas and happy New Year!
Keep playing to unlock all the story pages!
You successfully completed the genie story!|December 15, 2019
Djinn Day
Nimiru's tale reminds us that if at first you don't succeed, keep trying!
Exactly, Sherity. After all, even Ezzai struggled to deliver all the gifts on his first Djinn Day.
Yes he did, and if you hope to get better at decorating packages, perhaps there’s someone who could teach you.
Splendid idea, child. The Lady is a wonderful teacher. I wish you all the luck in the world.
So what you’re saying is, it’s okay to not be good at something right away?
But the genie had help from the little girl…
You’re right! I’ll ask the Lady for help! She has a wonderful eye for design!
Help Ezzai save Djinn Day as you complete new puzzles and earn rewards!

␣The main square in the City of Genies was bustling beneath a bright blue sky, as the spirits who lived there prepared for the annual Djinn Day celebration. During the holiday, each genie was assigned to visit a city, delivering gifts to the children who live there, and the excitement of the city’s magical residents was palpable.|␣Zebba, the Grand Genie, descended a golden staircase into the crowd where genies were busy packing their magic bags with the toys and sweets they’d be handing out. Whereas all the other genies had checked in and were working diligently to prepare for Djinn Day, one name on Zebba’s list had a question mark beside it.|␣“Where is Ezzai?” Zebba asked the crowd, scratching his head with his pencil.|␣Several genies glanced in the Grand Genie’s direction, offering up shrugs of confusion.|␣Zebba huffed at the response. The Grand Genie believed that Ezzai had potential, but unlike the other genies, he was lazy. This would be Ezzai’s first Djinn Day, and he hoped to see the young genie prove himself.|␣The other genies, with their bags full, were leaving for their designated towns and worry crept into Zebba’s mind. After all, the thought of a city missing out on Djinn Day was unacceptable. Circling the city’s main square, the Grand Genie soon found Ezzai asleep on a sack of flour.|␣Zebba tapped the young genie on the shoulder, but Ezzai only mumbled and turned over, quickly resuming his snoring.|␣“Wake up!” Zebba yelled, causing Ezzai to sit upright on the sack.|␣“What is it?” Ezzai asked, rubbing the sleep from his eyes.|␣“On your feet, Ezzai!” Zebba ordered. “It’s Djinn Day, and all the other genies are ready to deliver their gifts. Meanwhile, you’re still asleep!”|␣Ezzai rolled his eyes, lying back down. “I have plenty of time,” he said with a yawn. “Give me ten more minutes.”|␣Annoyed, Zebba knew exactly how to get the young genie moving. He wiggled his fingers, conjuring a spell…

␣A cup of water materialized in Zebba’s hands, which he splashed on Ezzai, causing the sleeping genie to spring to his feet. “It’s time you prove you have what it takes to be a true genie. Now come on, you’re late!”|␣The young genie gasped, running to collect his magic bag from a nearby table before heading to the portal that would take him to the human world.|␣“Remember, Ezzai,” Zebba began, “each gift must be placed inside the child’s home where they will see it when they wake. And you must visit every house in your city before the sun comes up.”|␣“I understand, Grand Genie,” Ezzai promised, taking another step toward the portal.|␣“But more importantly of all,” Zebba called, “do not let any children see you. If you fail in this endeavor, you’ll never grant humans three wishes.”|␣Zebba’s warning echoed in Ezzai’s ears as he stepped through the portal. After all, the genie had always looked forward to the day when he could finally grant human wishes. Despite getting a late start, Ezzai would show Zebba that he was just as capable as any other spirit on Djinn Day.|␣Leaving the City of Genies behind him, Ezzai exited into the outskirts of a quiet city bathed in moonlight. Hefting the magic bag up on his shoulder, Ezzai sprinted toward the closest house, eager to begin his deliveries.|␣Tiptoeing to the front of the dark house, Ezzai found the door locked.He’d been practicing using his magic to open his bedroom door, and realized he’d found the perfect opportunity to put his new talent to use. Small sparks of light danced around the tip of his finger as the genie conjured a spell.|␣“Open sesame!” Ezzai smiled, pointing his finger at the door.|␣Energy flowed from the genie’s finger to the side of the house, but then something happened that Ezzai didn’t expect.

␣Instead of the door opening, the side of the house exploded. Ezzai’s eyes widened in horror as pieces of rock and clay rained down around him. Frozen with fear, the genie silently prayed that no one had been injured. He also reminded himself to continue practicing the opening of doors when he returned home.|␣When the smoke cleared, Ezzai spied a hole—much smaller than he anticipated—in the side of the house. Seeing his opportunity, he quickly ducked inside.|␣Reaching into his magic bag, he pulled out a gift for the child living in the house, but as he went to place it on the table, a voice broke the peacefulness of the night.|␣“What are you doing?” said a voice behind the genie.|␣Spinning around, Ezzai found himself face to face with a young girl, no older than eight.|␣“What happened to the wall?” she asked.|␣“It…uh…well…hmm,” Ezzai stammered, searching for the right words. “It…was…it was like that when I came in.”|␣“Are you a thief?” the girl asked with a glare.|␣“Me? A thief?” the genie laughed. “Of course not!”|␣“Then what are you doing in my house,” questioned the girl.|␣It was then that Ezzai realized how the situation must have looked. “Um…you see, I’m…” he stuttered.|␣“Wait, I know,” the girl said, her eyes brightening. “You’re a genie!”|␣The genie gasped, realizing he’d broken the Grand Genie’s cardinal rule. He had just been seen by a child.

␣Ezzai stowed the toy in his bag as he ran outside, exiting through the hole he’d made. The girl followed him, undeterred.|␣“Me? A genie?” Ezzai said, forcing a laugh .”Of course not…I’m with the circus!”|␣“What circus?” the girl asked, putting her hands on her hips.|␣The genie snapped his fingers, turning himself into a large giraffe. “Why yes, the circus is just passing by! There’s nothing to see here!”|␣“You’re a genie and you’re here for Djinn Day!” said the girl.|␣Fearing himself caught, Ezzai snapped his hoof, resuming his normal appearance. “Okay, okay. I am a genie,” he admitted, letting out a sigh. “I’m supposed to deliver gifts to all of the city’s children before the sun comes up, but it turns out I’m not very good at it.”|␣“I could help you!” the girl said, smiling. “My name’s Layla, and I know every house in the city!”|␣“That’s kind of you to offer,” Ezzai said, “but I have to deliver these gifts alone in order to prove to the Grand Genie that I’m capable of granting wishes one day.”|␣Layla smirked. “By blowing holes in the side of houses?”|␣Ezzai attempted to cover his face — which flushed red with embarrassment — by hefting his magic bag over his shoulder. “You should be asleep anyway,” he grumbled. “Oh, and don’t tell anyone you saw me!”|␣Not waiting for the girl to respond, the genie hurried off toward a house in the distance. He approached quietly, but as soon as Ezzai stepped onto the path leading to the front door, a pack of dogs rounded the corner. Spotting the genie, the canines galloped toward him, barking and gnashing their teeth.|␣The genie screamed.

␣The dogs were only feet away as Ezzai waved his hands and magical energy danced around his fingertips. A glow formed around each of the dogs, transforming the angry mutts into peaceful camels.|␣Breathing a sigh of relief, Ezzai hurried to the front door of the home to find it also locked. Not keen on destroying more property, the genie circled the home and spotted an open window in the back. Tossing his magic bag through the window, Ezzai hoisted himself up and attempted to crawl through. He got his genie body halfway in before realizing the horrible truth: he was stuck.|␣Pushing, pulling, and grunting, Ezzai tried to squeeze through the window, all the while praying to the gods that Zebba wasn’t looking down on him from the genie city. Finally squeezing through the window, Ezzai fell into the home, accidentally flattening a table and pulling the curtains from the walls.|␣The genie barely looked at the gifts and he pulled them from his magic sack, dropping them onto the floor where he believed the children would see them in the morning. Looking to make a quick exit, Ezzai navigated the dark house and let himself out through the front door.|␣“That wasn’t exactly a graceful entrance either,” Layla said, riding one of the camels around the yard.|␣Frustrated, Ezzai ran over and pulled her off the animal, setting her on the ground. “You can’t be here!” he said.|␣“Between you and me, you’re having a rough Djinn Day,” Layla said. “You’ve only visited two homes, and the sun will be rising soon. Let me help!”|␣Ignoring the girl, Ezzai scanned the horizon for the next home.|␣“If you don’t let me help you,” Layla began, “I might accidentally tell my best friend Panya that I saw a genie.”|␣Ezzai gasped.|␣“And Panya…well, she can’t keep a secret.”

␣Ezzai couldn’t let Layla tell her friend that she’d seen him. The genie knew immediately that Layla had the upper hand. “Okay, okay,” said the genie, “you can help me.”|␣The young girl jumped up and down before grabbing Ezzai’s hand and leading him through the darkness toward the next house. “This is where Anit lives,” Layla said. “You have to leave her something good! Of course, you have to get inside first.”|␣The genie examined the house wondering how best to gain entrance. “Maybe I should go down the chimney?” Ezzai wondered aloud.|␣“Surely there’s something else you can do with you magic,” the girl giggled.|␣Ezzai thought a moment. “Well, I’ve only started learning. Right now I can kind of open doors. Oh, and I can shrink myself down to the size of an insect, or make myself as large as a tree!”|␣With a snap of his fingers, Ezzai shrunk to a size too small for Layla to see, and in the next moment, he became a giant. The girl considered the genie, once more putting her hands on her hips.|␣“Not impressed?” he asked.|␣“Why didn’t you just do that to get through the window of the last house?” Layla mused.|␣The genie hoped that in the darkness, Layla couldn’t see his cheeks become bright red.|␣“I have an idea!” Layla said, running toward the door of the home.|␣When Ezzai caught up with her, Layla was pointing excitedly to lock’s keyhole.|␣“You could shrink down and go through the lock, return to your normal size to leave the gifts, and then shrink down to exit again,” she suggested.|␣“That’s brilliant!” Ezzai said.|␣Following Layla’s instructions, Ezzai shrunk himself down to the size of a ladybug and climbed through the keyhole. Inside the house, he quickly left a gift for Anit, and exited the house without damaging a thing.|␣“I did it!” Ezzai exclaimed, growing back to his normal size outside the house.|␣Layla didn’t join in on the celebration. Her attention was focused on something else entirely. “Oh no,” she whispered.|␣Glancing past the girl, Ezzai knew exactly what she was looking at. Out on the horizon, the sun was about to rise.

␣Ezzai sat on the ground, putting his head in his hands.|␣“Why are you sitting?” Layla asked. “There are more homes left to visit!”|␣While Ezzai appreciated the girl’s optimism, he knew he was destined to fail. “Now Zebba will never bless me with the ability to grant human wishes,” Ezzai sighed. “The only way we could hope to make it all the homes is if we had some kind of… chariot.”|␣“Then conjure us a chariot, Genie,” Layla said, pulling Ezzai to his feet.|␣“Impossible!” Ezzai said. “Something will go terribly wrong!”|␣“It’s about time you started believing in yourself,” the girl said. “You want to show Zebba that you’re a capable genie? This is your chance!”|␣Layla was right. There was still time to pull off a miracle. Taking a deep breath, the genie waved his hands, and magical energy formed at the ends of his fingers. “Show me…a chariot!”|␣Ezzai extended his arms as energy burst forth from his hands. But nothing happened. In the darkness a cricket chirped.|␣“Maybe you should try again?” Layla suggested, shrugging.|␣Repeating the process, a smile appeared on Ezzai’s face as a sleek chariot with ornate wheels appeared on the ground between them. Suddenly, out of the darkness emerged the camels from the second house. One by one they stood in front of the chariot and the genie used his magic to hook up the harnesses.|␣Conjuring a spell upon the animals, the genie and Layla whisked off at incredible speeds, allowing the visit each of the city’s remaining houses. Soon, the genie’s bag felt empty, and as the sun broke the horizon, Ezzai knew he’d accomplished his mission. His enthusiasm didn’t last long.|␣“Wait!” Layla cried out. “We missed a house!”

␣In a single moment, Ezzai went from feeling elated to deflated. Bringing the chariot to a halt, the genie wondered how he and Layla could have missed a single house in their flurry of gift deliveries.|␣“Whose house did we miss?” Ezzai asked, his voice full of shock.|␣“Mine,” Layla said quietly. “But to be honest, Genie, delivering toys and sweets with you was better than any gift I could have possibly received.”|␣“Thank you for your help, Layla,” Ezzai said, lifting the child out of the chariot. “I couldn’t have done this without you.”|␣The chariot faded from view as Layla’s feet touched the ground, leaving the camels to begin grazing. Layla quickly wrapped her arms around the genie, giving him a hug. “I hope the Grand Genie sees how good of a heart you have,” she whispered.|␣Ezzai was thankful for the girl’s compliment, but he knew that by missing his delivery at Layla’s house, Zebba would surely see the evening as a failure.|␣Layla took several several steps before turning to look at the genie. “You should turn those camels back to their natural state.”|␣“Why?” asked the genie. “Camels are far more useful than dogs!”|␣The girl gave the genie a frown, and Ezzai waved his hands. The dogs reverted to their natural state, and with a look of confusion on their faces, they raced off to find their home.|␣“See you next year on Djinn Day!” Layla said, running off the opposite direction.|␣Ezzai prepared to return to the City of Genies, but as he turned to head home, he was shocked to see Zebba standing several feet away in the morning sun, a disappointed look upon his face.|␣“I’ve been looking for you, Ezzai,” Zebba said.

␣“I’ve been watching your Djinn Day progress,” the Grand Genie said. “I saw everything.”|␣“Everything?” Ezzai asked, his eyes widening.|␣“Everything,” Zebba echoed. “I saw the hole you made in the side of that house. I saw you turn a man’s dogs into camels. I saw you fail to visit all houses in the city before dawn. And I even saw you reveal yourself to a human child, for goodness sake!”|␣“I’m…I’m sorry, Zebba!” Ezzai stammered. “I…I can explain everything!”|␣“There’s no need,” Zebba said, a smile appearing on his face. “Your methods may have been a bit unorthodox, but everything you did was to ensure you completed your task. Such behavior is to be rewarded!”|␣Before Ezzai could say another word, Zebba placed his hands on the genie’s shoulders and a warm glow enveloped them. “What…what did you do?” Ezzai asked.|␣“You now have the ability to grant humans wishes,” Zebba said, smiling. “You’ve proven yourself worthy of such a responsibility. Now, let us return to the City of Genies for the festivities…”|␣Before Zebba could finish speaking, Ezzai was already running in the opposite direction. He had one more thing to do before he allowed himself to partake in any celebrations.|␣Layla yawned as she opened her bedroom door. Having spent all night touring the city with Ezzai, exhaustion was quickly creeping in. However, the girl jolted awake when she saw Ezzai floating above her bed. “Is everything okay, Genie?” she asked.|␣“I feel just terrible that you didn’t receive a Djinn Day gift and I’d like to make it up to you,” the genie said.|␣“How will you do that?” Layla asked, puzzled.|␣Ezzai’s mouth widened into a smile. “How does three wishes sound?”
Why the sad face, Sherity? Surely a girl as beautiful as yourself has much to be happy about.
That’s nothing to be sad about, child. Perhaps if you keep trying…
You know, I have just the story that might change how you see things…
I was trying to decorate a present for the Wintertide festival, but no matter how hard I try, I can’t make it look as wonderful as it does in my mind!
I’ll never decorate another present again! I’ll never be good at it!
Christmas 2019

News:

What’s a birthday without a cake? A new and unique event is waiting for you in the game! Help the Baker make an extraordinary birthday cake! Complete 40 captivating levels and the incredible rewards are yours! There are treats enough for everyone!
We’ve added new options to make your gameplay even better. Additional options can be found in the new and improved settings dialog.

Got questions about the game? You can now access technical support directly in the game! The new support system in the settings dialog will show you the answer to any question. Check it out for yourself – it’s convenient and easy to use!
We’ve prepared fun contests on our Facebook page! Check the News tab in the game options to enter contests each week and win crystals!
160 new quests for high-level players have already been added to the game!

New building – the Confectionery! Love sweet things? Have a great time with the new Donut mechanic! Activate it on a match-3 level and tear the whole board into pieces! The building is available from glory level 54.
New building – the Zoo! Here you can have a great time in pleasant company! Breed crocodiles in match-3 levels. The building is available from glory level 56.
60 quests will tell you exciting tales and help you get used to the new buildings!
6 new collections are already available! How quickly can you assemble them?
August with the Genie! Meet your old friend on August 10 and 17.
Check out the Portal of Worlds at the end of the hot summer. 20 refreshing levels will help you have a good time. The portal opens on August 21.
A new building has appeared in the city: the Spinnery! Are you ready to make the best items of clothing for the city belles for the upcoming celebration? The building can be upgraded to level 3.
Help the Tradeswoman master weaving by completing exciting quests! 30 unique quests and 3 new collections already await you in the game!
Meet the new obstacles: the Button and the Basket of Wool. Overcome all the obstacles found in the exciting Spinnery levels!

The Beauty Week will take place in the city in September. The awesome Genie will visit the city on September 7, and you will be able to collect the wonderful holiday collections starting from September 11!
The Portal of Worlds will take you to the wondrous Autumn forest! The adventure will start on September 18. Don't miss your chance to get the rewards!
A new building has appeared in the city – the Fisherman's Hut! Want to find out which fish live in the local waters? You can upgrade the building to level 3!
The Zoo, Confectionery and Spinnery can be updated to level 4! Your empire will be bigger and more beautiful!
The Ship, Cave, Pyramid and Sphinx all have updated chips. The match-3 levels are now prettier than ever!
Missing the Sphinx? 20 new levels that you simply have to try are already in the game!
The interfaces have been adapted for iPhone X.
Uncover the secrets of fishing mastery! 40 unique quests and 4 new collections are waiting for you in the game!
Meet a new mechanic: Float! You can find a float on the exciting levels in the Fisherman's Hut. Have fun fishing!
Where did that magical light come from? Fireflies are flying around the city! Hurry and catch them in a jar and make a wish! The new event will be available on October 24.
The city is being decorated for Halloween – the citizens are preparing to celebrate with you!
Can you plant pumpkins? The Genie has prepared a new challenge for you! Don't miss its appearance on October 5!
Help the heroes assemble unique recipes from 3 holiday collections and get a generous reward! The event starts on October 9, don't miss it!
The Portal of Worlds will send you on a terrifyingly exciting adventure! Are you ready for dangerous challenges? Can you see your journey through to the very end? The portal opens on October 16.

Trick or treat? Nimiru is getting visitors for Halloween. Complete the levels and decorate the house for the holiday. Don't forget about your holiday costume! The event begins on October 27. Don't miss it, it'll be fun!
Don't miss the brand new Treasures of the Ancients event! You will come across mysterious chests while traversing Ship, Cave, and Pyramid levels. Keep track of the event calendar in the game options.
Ship, Cave, and Pyramid levels can now be unlocked instantaneously! You won't have to wait anymore!
Help the heroes gather unique recipes for Thanksgiving Day!
The Portal of Worlds will take you to a Native American village! Complete 20 exciting levels with new obstacles and get an amazing reward!
Theater ruins have been discovered in the North!
New ruins have been discovered in the North! Restore and upgrade the Ancient theater to level 3!
Don't miss the brand new Treasures of the Ancients event!
Learn the specifics of the theater arts! 40 theme quests and 4 collections already await you in the game!
200 quests and 20 collections have been added.
A new obstacle has been added to the game – the Curtain! Lift the curtain and begin the show! You will find levels with this obstacle in the Theater!
The Zoo, Confectionery, and Spinning House can be upgraded to level 5!
The Zoo, Confectionery, and Spinning House can be upgraded to level 5!
Break tiles without chips by using bonuses.
160 quests and 16 collections have been added for high-level players.
Ship, Cave, and Pyramid levels can now be unlocked instantaneously!
Enhanced bonuses! You can now break puzzle tiles without chips!
The limit for purchasing additional moves upon losing has been removed. From now on, the level won't be over if you are prepared to spare no effort in order to win!
The order in which the spells are displayed in the inventory has been changed. Now the most useful spells are located at the top of the list!
The holidays are coming! The city is going to be decorated so we can celebrate Christmas and New Year in style.
The Genie is going to visit the city again. Chilly challenges and a warming reward await you on December 4th.
Miracles do happen! There will be 20 new levels in the holiday portal starting on December 8th.
Don't miss out on three original Christmas recipes on December 15th!
Let's continue the Christmas festivities! Decorate the living room for the holiday in 40 exciting levels.

A new event will be available in January! Fulfill Tabia the Jeweler's request. Make a wonderful adornment and you’ll get an equally wonderful reward. Players with glory level 20 or above will be able to participate.
Now you can purchase dice for changing the game mode in the store. They will be placed in your inventory. Buy dice or get them as a reward.
The Sphinx can be upgraded to level 11. New challenges await the bravest players!
The Portal of Worlds will send you on a new adventure on January 2.
On February 1, the city will embrace the holiday spirit of love and romance. Its streets will be filled with rose petals, floral arrangements, and couples in love. You don't want to miss this!
Strawberry puree, whipped cream, and mint leaves are just a few of the ingredients for holiday recipes! This year, the citizens have decided to prepare something special to surprise you!

Rumor has it that Menes is going to ruin the holiday! His flunkies – hyena, cat, and vulture – have already been seen about the city! Be ready to face the challenge and don't let Menes accomplish his devious plans!
New special event: Tale of Three Wishes. In anticipation of Valentine's Day, Nimiru will tell you a thrilling story about jealousy, love, and magic.
The Treasures of the Ancients event is back! Step into the shoes of a real treasure hunter!
Love has no boundaries! Visit the Portal of Worlds and see for yourself!
The Genie will pay you a visit once again. From now on, you will not use up any of your sparks if you manage to complete the level!
New event: Jeweler's Dream. It looks like Tabia has been once again struck with inspiration. What kind of adornment did she come up this time?
A new Sphinx upgrade has been added – dozens of new levels await!
Spring has come to the city, and flowers have bloomed not just in the meadows but on the trees as well! Do not miss this truly magical time!

Nimiru has decided to hold the Spring Festival in the city! Complete 40 levels and help her get the garden ready for the occasion. You will receive awesome gifts at the end of each stage! The event will start on March 5.
The Genie won't keep you waiting for long and will make two appearances in our city! His challenges will begin on March 16 and 29.
Are you ready to embrace a new adventure? The Portal of Worlds will present you with such an opportunity on March 21!
Do you enjoy gathering fireflies? What about treasure hunting? Good news: the Firefly Dance and Treasures of the Ancients events will start soon, and you'll be able to take part in both!
Improved in-game dialogues. Don’t miss important information about new mechanics and obstacles!
Optimized the gifting dialogue. Your friends will always be in touch!
Fixed bugs and made improvements. Your game will play even more smoothly.

The city has transformed to celebrate Easter! The citizens are preparing gifts and baking delicious pies, while the children are gathering Easter eggs and taking their bunnies for a walk. Do not miss this truly magical time!
Nimiru will tell you the legend of the Easter bunny, which will be revealed over the course of 40 levels. Unlock the new pages of the Magic Book on April 13.
Where did that magical light come from? Fireflies have returned to the city! Hurry and catch them in a jar to make a wish! The new event will be available on April 15!

A new unique mechanic will allow you to step into the shoes of a real wood carver! Make combos next to the wood workpieces and carve ancient idol figurines out of them! You must upgrade Sphinx to level 13 to unlock this feature.
The entrance to the portal will open on April 22, ready to take you to the most exciting worlds! A chest containing a reward awaits those who manage to complete every level!
Tabia isn't sitting around – she is coming up with new jewelry design ideas all the time. What does she want to make this time? Find out on April 8!
The Genie will return with new trials to the city on April 10. Get ready to take on his new challenges and don't let him outfox you!
We can't wait to tell you about the events in the new Easter update! Here's what it will contain:

Using his dark magic, Menes has pulled the stars from the sky and even the powerful Bastet can't stop him alone! It's time to leap into action and help gather the fallen stars before their light goes out. The event starts April 22!
On May 16 and 30, the portal will take you to the Entertainment World! Only 20 levels separate you from unique rewards. Complete all levels to collect it!
Cradle of Empires is 5 years old! Celebrate the birthday of your favorite game with us! Incredible gifts and surprises await you.
No birthday is complete without cake! Complete 40 levels while helping the Baker prepare a birthday cake, and earn valuable prizes for your help. The event begins April 29!
We've updated our Friends dialogue to make it even easier to play. Inside the "Recently Helped" tab you'll find those friends who sent you gifts in the last 24 hours.
Unleash your inner treasure hunter by locating ancient treasures inside unique buildings! These events will be held May 8 and 14!
Don't miss the weekend with the Genie! Overcome all of his obstacles and get a well-deserved prize. The Genie will visit the city on May 10.
Where's that magical light coming from? Fireflies are entering the city! Catch them inside jars and make a wish! The event will be available starting May 6 and 12.
Make sure you visit the City museum! There you will find the new Profile tab, where you'll be able to set your avatar and change your username.
The portal will take you to the World of Excitement on June 20! You're only 20 levels away from a unique reward! Complete them all and the reward is yours!
This time Nimiru will tell you the legend of the Blue Lotus. Complete 40 levels to learn the details of this exciting story. The Magic Book will open its pages on June 9.
Tabia isn't sitting around – she is coming up with new jewelry design ideas all the time. What does she want to make this time? Find out on June 17!
Step into the shoes of a real treasure hunter! Find the Treasures of the Ancients in unique buildings! The event starts on June 16!
The Genie will return to the city on June 5 with new trials. Get ready to take on his new challenges and don't let him outfox you!
What is the source of this magic light? Fireflies are swarming to the city! Catch them in a jar as soon as you can and make a wish! The event will be available on June 3!
Jump head first into adventure! The portal of worlds opens on July 4th and 25th! Rewards await those brave enough to complete all levels!
The Genie returns on July 9th. Prepare yourself for new challenges!
Do you enjoy collecting fireflies? Good news! The Firefly Dance kicks off on July 12th.
Start collecting sapphires on July 22th and help Tabia create a truly unique piece of jewelry!
Don't miss out on the Treasures of the Ancients event! Your hunt for hidden treasure chests begins on July 29th.
16 new collections will help you earn more exciting rewards. Assemble them all!
Sacred cats have escaped the Temple of Bastet, and the priestess Sity must find them! Can Sity locate all the cats and return them to the temple? Find out in the new event, Meows & Paws!
It is possible to collect items and gain experience even faster! Enter the game often to take advantage of the Lucky Hours event.
Connect to Facebook from the starting screen to instantly download your game progress to a new device. It is rather convenient, isn't it?
We've improved the sounds on your favorite game. Now, completing levels will bring even more melodic fun!
The Genie will return to the city on August 16. Prepare yourself for exciting new challenges!
Collect treats for the sacred cats of Bastet to earn prizes and raise your standings! The Meows & Paws event begins August 8.
If you like to collect fireflies, then you're in luck! The Firefly Dance will begin on August 12.
Collect sapphires to help the talented jeweler Tabia create unique and beautiful decorations. The hunt begins on August 19!
The next Treasures of the Ancients events will take place on August 15 and 27. Search the city for hidden treasure chests and unlock the riches within!
The Portal of Worlds will open on August 8, inviting you to a world of grand adventure!
Sacred cats have escaped the Temple of Bastet, and the priestess Sity must find them! Can Sity locate all the cats and return them to the temple? Find out in the new event, Meows & Paws!
New avatars have been added, available at the 12th, 14th, and 16th glory levels!
The story continues! Players with a glory level of 232 can enjoy 80 new quests and 8 exciting collections.
Upgrade the Theater and Fisherman's Hut to level 4, and your city will be even more beautiful!
Brave adventurers can upgrade the Sphinx to level 15, and try their luck at 40 new levels!
Don’t miss the Lucky Hours events! Enter the game often throughout September to take advantage of these special opportunities!
The Genie will return to the city on September 13, bringing with him new challenges!
Do you enjoy collecting fireflies? You're in luck! The Dance of the Fireflies returns on September 23.
Collect treats for the sacred cats to earn prizes and increase your standings! The Meows and Paws tournament starts on September 13 and 20.
Don't miss the Treasures of the Ancients events. The search for treasure chests begins on October 1!
Collect Sapphires starting September 16 to assist the talented Tabia in creating a unique and beautiful piece of jewelry!
Prepare yourself for adventure! The Portal of Worlds will open once again on September 26.
Now it’s much easier to earn the achievements “Master of the Seas,” “Brave Treasure Hunter,” and “Keeper of keys.”
Infinite energy has been added as a reward in the Wheel of Fortune!
Stay tuned for the next Meows & Paws event. Collect treats for the sacred cats, raise your standings and earn great rewards!
Don't miss the Treasures of the Ancients events. The search for treasure chests begins on October 1 and 20!
Prepare yourself for adventure! The Portal of Worlds will open once again on October 3.
Collect Sapphires starting October 6 and 22 to assist the talented Tabia in creating a unique and beautiful piece of jewelry!
Listen to Nimiru’s tale of human greed and the mysterious Ferryman. Complete 40 levels while hearing her fascinating story. The magic book will open on October 8th!
Do you enjoy collecting fireflies? You're in luck! The Dance of the Fireflies returns on October 15.
The Genie returns on October 18. Prepare yourself for new challenges!
Nimiru is welcoming Halloween guests! Complete levels and decorate the city for the holiday! Don’t miss the event, beginning on October 26th. It will be… terribly fun!
We hope you will enjoy the updated interface, making your favorite game even more of a pleasure to play!
Stay tuned for the next Meows & Paws event. Collect treats for the sacred cats, raise your standings and earn great rewards!
Do you enjoy collecting fireflies? You're in luck! The Dance of the Fireflies returns on November 12 and 25.
Prepare yourself for adventure! The Portal of Worlds will open once again on November 28.
Don't miss the Treasures of the Ancients events. The search for treasure chests begins on November 21!
The Genie will return on November 15 and, along with his usual rewards, will bring with him a new avatar for those who complete the second chain of levels!
Help Tabia create a unique piece of jewelry and get a special avatar as a reward! Collect sapphires beginning November 18th.
Stay tuned for the next Meows & Paws event. Collect treats for the sacred cats, raise your standings and earn great rewards!
Help Tabia create a unique piece of jewelry and get a special avatar as a reward! Collect sapphires beginning December 24.
The Genie will soon return to the city. Challenges and rewards await you on December 3.
Eager for a Christmas miracle? Nimiru will share the story of a young Genie in over his head. Make a wish! This magic book will open on December 7.
Don't miss the Treasures of the Ancients events. The search for treasure chests begins on December 11 and 30!
Do you enjoy collecting fireflies? You're in luck! The Dance of the Fireflies returns on December 16.
Prepare yourself for adventure! The Portal of Worlds will open once again on December 19.

You asked for it – you got it! From now on, the explosions at the end of a level will earn you extra resources! The more moves you've got left upon completing a level, the more resources you will get!
Cracking can be heard from the forest – the Portal is opening! You will find 20 levels and cool rewards inside!
Fixed bugs and added improvements.
Help the Genie prepare Easter gifts for the entire city. Five puzzles and a generous reward await you!
Can you hear the rustling of leaves in the distance? The portal is about to open, and only you will know what's inside!
Get the last laugh over the Genie! Complete all the levels and join the party!
Don't miss holidays with the Genie! Complete exciting levels with sweet obstacles and get your well-earned reward!
You can never have too much candy! Why not spend another holiday in the Genie's pleasant company?
What's a holiday without the Genie? Find all the tree decorations in 5 exciting levels.
This time the Genie’s traveling companion will visit the city. Go in search of treasure this weekend. Have fun playing!
Know how to plant pumpkins? The Genie has a new challenge ready for the eve of Halloween to test your skills!
If you hear firecrackers and loud laughter, that means the Genie is in the city again. And that means another celebration!
Look – all the Garden pumpkins have turned towards the island! The Portal is opening! Hurry and play to earn some rewards!
News
The portal will open an entrance to the World of Excitement! 15 levels will bring you to a desired reward. It'll be fun!
The Portal of Worlds will send you on a terrifyingly exciting adventure! Can you see your journey through to the very end?
Portal of Worlds
Help Sheriti find a gift for Parents' Day! Maybe you should look through the portal? Where will it lead this time?
Halloween approaches, and we plan to have a good time. Help the residents of the city prepare a few unusual things!
Rumor has it that Menes plans to ruin the holiday. Nimiru is counting on your help! Exchange 3 stolen collections at Menes’s servants and get a valuable reward!
Menes's servants
Conquer all the Icy Isles to get a coveted reward. 20 refreshing levels will help you have a fun time.
Хочешь испытать удачу? Погрузись в праздничную атмосферу Дня Святого Патрика вместе с Джинном! Пять новых увлекательных уровней уже ждут тебя в игре!
Полный головоломок, великолепных наград и зелени Портал ко Дню Святого Патрика уже ждет отважных искателей приключений!
Celebrate Chocolate Day with the city residents. Nimiru and the Mistress will reveal secrets of beauty and cooking. Assemble all 3 collections and get a valuable reward!
Getting ready to celebrate Christmas in style? Try to prepare something unusual. Assemble 3 holiday collections and get a worthy reward.
Valentine’s Day is approaching. It’s a great occasion to cook something unusual. Collect all the recipes and get a delicious reward!
Valentine’s Day
The portal will take you to a winter fairytale. The road won't be easy – this time, you'll have to beat 20 levels.
The Portal of Love can help anyone find their significant other! But it’s not easy: 20 levels await you full of incredible adventures!
A happy Genie with new spring levels is coming to the city! Get ready!
Our old friend the Genie has invited you to take part in another new adventure! Can you complete 10 new levels?
Веселый Джинн с новыми уровнями вскоре появится в Городe! Готовься!
The Spring Portal has a challenge for brave adventurers! 20 awesome levels await you inside!

I always get inspired by celebrations! I want every day to be like Easter – full of joy and happiness!
How about filling every day of our lives with thrilling adventures? Let's go!
The Easter holiday that the citizens love so much is approaching! The grown-ups are preparing gifts, while the children have readied their baskets for collecting Easter eggs.
The cutest addition, however, is the bunnies that have appeared in our city! Want to try to count them all?
Hurray! Holiday Week is starting in our city today. In honor of the start of the holiday, take this useful gift!

Unlock all the pages of the story about the magic bunny.
You have successfully completed the unique Magic Bunny event!|April 21, 2019
Tale of the Magic Bunny
Nimiru's story has reached its conclusion, but her message will be in our hearts forever – always do the right thing, no matter the cost.
You are a quick learner, my little Sheriti. I didn't doubt for a second that you'd make the right decision.
It's up to you to decide. But I believe that every person who listens to their heart and does the right thing will always be rewarded.
I think I understand now… If I don't tell the truth and it gets out one day, things will only get worse. I must confess right now, while there's still a chance to make things right!
Thank you for your advice, Nimiru. By the way, why did the rabbit in your story change his mind and decide to thank the citizens with a bountiful harvest? Was it the boy's honesty that won him over?
Complete the event levels and immerse yourself in an exciting story about a magic bunny. Fun experiences and valuable prizes await!

␣Once upon a time a young boy, Anebi, was tasked with taking care of a magic rabbit, whose black fur was decorated in ornate jewelry and adornments. Each year on Easter, the priest let the rabbit hop across the fields outside the city’s temple, and according to the stories, if the rabbit was happy and well-fed throughout the year, it would reward the city with a lush harvest.|␣However, in all the years Anebi attended the ceremony, the rabbit had never once granted as much. The night before Easter, as Anebi fed the rabbit a handful of wilted greens, his own stomach rumbled, reminding him that his father’s field had been barren for many months. Suddenly, Anebi had an idea.

␣Anebi would borrow the rabbit to let it run across his father’s field in hopes a bountiful harvest would follow. The boy could return the rabbit to the temple the following morning before the Easter ceremony, and no one would know the animal had been missing.|␣Tucking the rabbit into his robes, Anebi left the temple and headed home under the shadow of night. Petting the rabbit rhythmically, he walked toward the edge of the city, praying that this time, the animal’s magic would finally be revealed.|␣Finally arriving at his family’s farm, Anebi gently lowered the rabbit onto the soil, which was still firm from the last of the winter frost. The animal gave the boy a curious look and began hopping around the small field.|␣After several minutes, the boy scooped up the rabbit and watched the field with bated breath. Unfortunately, just like every year before, nothing happened. The boy’s stomach rumbled once more. In defeat, he carried the animal inside and went to sleep.

␣Hours later, a frantic knock at the front door woke Anebi. With candle in hand, the boy opened the entryway and saw the temple’s priest standing in the dark. “The magic rabbit is missing!” the priest said. “Have you seen it?”|␣Fetching the animal from his bedroom, Anebi returned the rabbit to the priest. “I don’t think this creature is magical,” the boy said with a sigh. “I think it’s just a normal rabbit.”|␣“How can you be sure?” the priest asked, raising an eyebrow at the boy. “Is that why the animal is here? Did you ask it to bless that barren field outside your home?” Anebi opened his mouth to answer, but the priest continued on.|␣“According to the stories, the magic rabbit will only bless one field each year. It was a hard winter and the townspeople are counting on the rabbit to show its magic at tomorrow’s ceremony.”|␣Scared he’d be responsible for the city’s fields not flourishing, Anebi lied to the priest. “The rabbit isn’t here to bless our field,” he said. “I just… wanted him to be warm.” The priest tucked the rabbit under his robes. “I’ll pray that’s true,” he said. “After all, lying only makes things worse. Always remember that.” Before Anebi could say another word, the priest had disappeared into the night.

␣Anebi woke the next morning fearing he’d missed the Easter celebration. Pulling on his boots, The boy opened the door and stepped outside. He took five steps and gasped. His father’s field, barren just hours prior, was now lush with vegetation. Corn stalks rose six feet into the sky, golden wheat grew in thick batches, and bright red tomatoes dotted the field. Anebi was happy to learn the rabbit’s magic had worked, but if the priest was correct, the boy had used up the rabbit's magic for the year. Arriving in the city, Anebi saw the Easter crowd already gathered at the field outside the temple. Through the throng, Anebi could see the priest holding the rabbit over a patch of soil.|␣“Let us see if we are worthy of receiving gifts from the gods,” the priest said, lowering the animal to the ground. “Please bless us with a rich harvest.” The boy held his breath as the rabbit hopped in a small circle, but like every year prior, nothing happened. Anebi left the celebration and headed home. Only he knew that the rabbit with the strange markings was actually magical, but unfortunately, he couldn’t tell a soul without upsetting the entire city.

␣When Anebi arrived home, he was shocked to see his neighbors standing outside his house. The husband and wife pointed angrily at his father’s field, while his mother stood at the door, her face heavy with confusion.|␣“Tell us your secret!” the man said angrily.|␣“Did the rabbit do this?” demanded the woman.|␣Spotting Anebi approaching the house, his mother pushed past the angry neighbors and ran to the boy. “What’s happened here, Anebi?” she asked, tears welling in her eyes. “Our field is prospering, but soon the entire city will turn against us! You’re the keeper of the magic rabbit… is there something you need to tell me?”|␣Wracked with guilt, Anebi turned away from his mother and ran down the path back toward the city.|␣By the time he reached the temple, the Easter crowd had disappeared and the field remained barren. Anebi needed the priest’s help to solve his problem, but to get it he’d have to tell the truth.|␣Anebi pushed open the temple doors and glanced toward the pen where the magic rabbit was kept. He let out a cry when he saw that the animal’s pen was empty.

␣Finding the priest seated in his study, Anebi alerted him to the fact that the rabbit had gone missing.|␣“I let him go,” the priest said, taking a deep breath. “In all my years, it never once blessed our harvest. I fear it was just a normal rabbit after all.”|␣“He is magical!” Anebi countered. “Last night I let the rabbit hop across my father’s field, and this morning our crops are taller than me!”|␣The priest’s eyes widened in shock.|␣“Come see for yourself,” Anebi said, pointing toward the door.|␣The priest remained seated. “I’m not surprised that your father’s field is growing, young one,” he began. “I’m surprised because you lied to me.”|␣Anebi’s head dropped in shame. He apologized for hiding the truth, explaining his desire to feed his family, and how his neighbors were now upset.|␣“We have to find the rabbit!” Anebi pleaded. “Maybe he can bless all the fields in the city!”

␣As the priest opened the temple doors to begin his search for the rabbit, he found himself face-to-face with an angry crowd of townspeople.|␣“There's a field on the hill lush with fresh crops," yelled a man. “Someone must have stolen the rabbit and used up all its magic!”|␣The priest leaned over and whispered in Anebi’s ear. “If that rabbit is truly magical, you must find it immediately. I shall address the townspeople, but I urge you not to return empty handed.”|␣The angry citizens were so busy voicing their frustrations about the field on the hill, they didn’t notice Anebi slip off into an alley. The boy hurried through the city, looking everywhere for the rabbit. He searched the bazaar, investigated the sepat, and even explored the potter’s hut, but try as he might, Anebi couldn’t locate the animal anywhere.|␣Slumping over in an abandoned alleyway, tears flowed from Anebi’s eyes. He only wanted to help his family, and never meant to cheat the entire city out of crops until spring. Instead, he would return to the temple without the rabbit and accept responsibility for his selfish actions.|␣Just then, Anebi noticed movement out of the corner of his eye and saw a rabbit adorned with gold and jewels sitting at the mouth of the alley.

␣Anebi returned to the temple to face the angry crowd. As he climbed the stairs to the temple’s dais, the boy held up the rabbit in his arms, catching the attention of the townspeople.|␣“I’m sorry I used the rabbit to bless my father’s field,” the boy said loudly. “I just wanted to feed my family. I didn't think the rabbit was truly magical, but I see now that I was wrong.”|␣“That doesn’t do us any good!” came a man’s angry voice from somewhere in the crowd. “You’re family may eat well, but the rest of us will starve before spring arrives!”|␣The priest appeared next to Anebi. “Do you not hear the boy?” asked the priest. “He just wanted to feed his family. If you were in his shoes, would you have not have placed the rabbit upon your own fields?”|␣The crowd’s fervor only increased and Anebi worried his family might soon be run out of the city entirely.

␣As the angry crowd reached for the rabbit, Anebi knew he needed to protect the animal, no matter the cost. After all, he’d seen it’s magic first hand.|␣“I’m sorry I wronged you,” Anebi said. “Everyone may take food from my family’s farm. We are no more deserving of it than any of you!”|␣Suddenly, the sound of a woman’s voice caught his attention. “Look!” said the voice. “The field is growing!”|␣Calls of anger and frustration turned to shock and awe as right before their very eyes, vegetation sprang up from the temple’s field. Up leapt shocks of corn, rows of fresh vegetables, wheats, barleys, and countless other crops, growing both high and wide.|␣“It seems the only story that was false was that the rabbit could bless only one field each year,” laughed the priest.|␣Anebi smiled as he watched his fellow citizens pull vegetables from the vines, silently vowing to never lie again. Holding as much food as they could carry, the once-angry townspeople left the temple and returned home.|␣That night, after feeding the rabbit freshly grown greens from the garden, Anebi thanked the decorated animal for blessing both his family and the city, and apologized for doubting its magical abilities. The boy knew that next year’s Easter celebration was sure to be a special one.
Don't worry. We'll definitely figure something out. Please tell me what is bothering you, my dear Sheriti.
Well, well… You've certainly found yourself in one tough predicament… However, I am going to tell you a story that should give you a hint as to how you could resolve it.
Nimiru, I need your advice on something. I think I'm being unfair to someone, and it's making me feel guilty. But I just can't seem to work up the courage to tell the truth.

I lied to my mom. If I confess to her, she will punish me… And if I don't, she will never know. I can leave things as they are now, but the feeling of guilt welling up inside is weighing really heavily on me!

␣Clean a banana, removing the outer layer of flesh with a knife, otherwise it will roll up into clumps during washing. Grind the resulting banana flesh into a smooth pulp using a strainer.| | Add some lemon juice, 10 drops of sea buckthorn extract, 20 drops of vitamin B6 and B12 each and mix. Add an egg yolk and mix again. Place the resulting mixture in a jar and store it in a cool place for 2-3 days.| | Before using the shampoo, ensure that you are not allergic to the ingredients!| | Lather the shampoo on wet hair, massage and wash off with water. Use conditioner if necessary.
1 banana
1 egg yolk
1 lemon
sea buckthorn extract
vitamins B6 and B12
Natural Shampoo recipe

␣Mix cane sugar and olive oil together. Add 10 drops of vanilla extract and lemon balm tincture and 1 tsp cinnamon oil. Mix thoroughly. Place the resulting mixture in a jar and store for 2-3 days in a cool place.| | Before using the scrub, ensure that you are not allergic to the ingredients! Apply the scrub to moist skin to avoid injury!| | Apply the scrub to moist skin with light massaging motions, then wash off with water. Apply moisturizer afterwards if necessary.
2 tbsp cane sugar
1-2 tbsp olive oil
vanilla extract
melissa tincture
cinnamon oil
Body Scrub recipe

␣Pare some apples and kiwis, chop them finely and place them in a cup. Add finely chopped celery and grapefruit to taste. Mash up thoroughly into a smooth paste.| | Take 5 sprigs of fresh fennel each and 5 spinach leaves. Chop them finely and add them to the paste. Mix it all up thoroughly, add 1 pint of purified water and mix again.| | Pour the resulting mixture into a jug, decorate with berries and store in a cool place for no longer than 24 hours.| | The healthy smoothy is ready! Bon appetit!
1-2 kiwis
1-2 apples
grapefruit
fresh greens
spinach
1 stalk celery
fresh berries
1 pint purified water
Healthy Smoothie recipe

Pour the milk into the pan, heat it over a low flame, and gradually introduce the sugar and cocoa powder. Melt the butter in the bain-marie and pour into the resulting mixture. While continually mixing, bring the chocolate mixture to a boil and take it off the heat. Add sieved flour, mix thoroughly and heat for 2 more minutes.| | Put the somewhat cooled mixture in a mold greased with butter. Decorate top with candied peel and leave in a cold place for 3-4 hours.| | The chocolate is ready. Bon appetit!
milk – 5 tbsp
butter – 70 g
cocoa powder – 150 g
sugar – 100 g
flour – 1-2 tbsp
candied peel – 100 g
Homemade Chocolate recipe

Heat the dark chocolate in a bain-marie until it melts. Add a little almond oil, sea buckthorn and jojoba oil, a few drops of essential oil (sandalwood, ylang-ylang or other to preference) and 0.5 tbsp liquid vitamin E. Mix it all thoroughly.| | Before putting the mask on, ensure that you are not allergic to any of the ingredients!| | Wear the mask on a clean face. After 10-15 minutes, wash off with warm water. Apply cream if necessary. For a long-term effect, wear the mask 1-2 times per week.
dark chocolate
sea buckthorn oil
almond oil
jojoba oil
vitamin E – 0.5 tspn
essential oil
Chocolate Face Mask recipe

Cut the onion into small pieces and sear it with flour in butter until golden brown. Add 250 ml water and mix. Then add wine, ground chocolate, cloves, cinnamon, salt and pepper to taste. Mix again. The sauce is ready.| | Fry the boiled mushrooms in butter.| | Place butter and fish fillets on a heated plate, cover in sauce. Stew over a low flame for 30 min. Then add mushrooms. Stew for another 10 min.| | The dish is ready to be served!
fish fillet – 0.5 kg
white wine – half a cup
champignon mushrooms – half a cup
1 whole onion
butter
chocolate
spices

scissors

Halloween Costume instructions

␣Choose a fresh pumpkin in any shape you like. Cut off the top at such an angle so it doesn't fall inside.| | Using a big spoon, clear out the pulp and seeds from the inside. Draw a face on the pumpkin with a marker, then cut it out with a knife along the drawn lines.| | Place a candle inside the pumpkin and light it.| | Your Halloween Jack-o'-lantern is ready!
1 fresh pumpkin
knife with fine blade
big spoon
marker
black paint
1 candle
Jack-o'-lantern instructions

␣Smear your face with oily cream. Stick some polyethylene film on it and make a hole for breathing around your nostrils.| | Place the first 3 layers of napkins moistened in water on the film and let them dry. Then make 10 more layers of small pieces of newspaper smeared with glue. Don't cut the napkins or the newspaper, just tear them with your hands.| | After the papier-mâché dries, take the mask off your face, remove the film, cut the edges and make holes for your eyes. Decorate the mask with paint and glue on some feathers.| | The holiday mask is ready!
newspapers and napkins
1 cling film roll
glue
feathers
paints and brush

␣Rub salt, pepper and spices onto the turkey inside and out. Marinade the turkey for at least five hours in orange juice. Place inside the turkey 1 lemon, 1 orange (cut in half), a sprig of fresh rosemary and some thyme. Pin the edges of the hole with a toothpick.| |␣Place it on the pan breast up. Bake at a temperature of at least 180 degrees Celsius. Cooking time depends on the bird's weight: 6-7 kilograms takes 3.5-4 hours, 8-10 kilograms – 5-6 hours.| |␣The turkey is traditionally served with mashed potatoes, Indian corn and cranberry sauce.
turkey
salt, pepper – to taste
orange juice
rosemary and thyme
cranberry sauce
potato, corn
Stuffed Turkey recipe

␣Take a pumpkin, paint its stalk orange (this will eventually become the turkey's neck eventually). Attach some plasticine to the pumpkin's stalk, molding it into a bird's head with a beak and beard. You can also make the turkey's legs out of plasticine.| |␣Insert long feathers into the pumpkin in such a way that they form a fanned tail. To make the bird's wings, use autumn leaves (glue them on top of each other on both sides of the pumpkin). You can also glue small plumes of feathers all around the pumpkin.| |␣The symbol of Thanksgiving is done!
pumpkin with stalk
long feathers
plasticine
autumn leaves
orange paint
glue
Holiday Symbol recipe

␣Roll out the shortcrust pastry in a baking tray and crimp it at the edges. Cut the pumpkin into slices and cook it in a steamer for 30 minutes. Let it cool.| |␣Using a blender, turn the steamed pumpkin into a purée. Mix all the ingredients in a bowl. The filling should be smooth and consistent. Pour the filling into the base to the edges of the pastry.| |␣After baking for 30 minutes, switch off the oven and leave the pie in it for another 15 minutes. Then take it out of the oven and let it fully cool. The pie will be at its tastiest after a night in the refrigerator.| |␣Bon appetit!
shortcrust pastry
pumpkin pieces
yogurt
eggs
sugar
starch
ground cinnamon

Terrifying the House
Final Preparations
Finish all the preparations for Halloween.
You celebrated Halloween 2018 in style.
The holiday has come to an end. It was so fun to scare people and be scared alongside you!
Complete 40 levels to decorate the house for Halloween! Finish the preparation stages and get valuable prizes. The most active event participants will get a final reward and a unique achievement!
Complete 40 exciting levels to decorate the house for Halloween!
Halloween is approaching! The people of the city will dress up in terrifying costumes and host all kinds of parties.
Halloween is just around the corner. And it'll be visitors that wander the streets first of all! We've got so many things to do!
I need to completely decorate the house and prepare a costume. And I'm going to need your help to do it!
Halloween is soon! Let's prepare some terrifying fun for our guests!
Trick or Treat?

All Hallow's Eve eve is on its way, bringing with it beautiful autumn colors and cool, refreshing weather. As you celebrate, we hope you get many more treats than tricks. In fact, here's a treat from us to you!
Happy Halloween!
The house is now completely spooked up!
Are you getting scared yet? Not even a little bit?!
Alright, we've only just begun! Let's keep up the good work!
I think it's starting to look very nice! But there's something special missing.
We need pumpkins! Lots and lots of pumpkins. A pile of huge orange pumpkins. No less!
Great job! I never would have thought you could cut so many different decorations from pumpkins!
But there's still a couple of empty corners in our house. Got any more ideas? The guests will be coming soon!
The main preparations are done. We were just in time, it's getting dark!
We're missing a few parts. I'll entrust this to you while I go get my costume ready!
Gaze and tremble! Nimiru is accepting guests!
As you can see, I'm not alone. We already have our first guest! Meet Sheriti's cat, Ember. She finishes off my look nicely, don't you think?
A great party awaits us, with lots of scaaaary fun! And if Menes tries to mess up our holiday, we'll turn him into a pumpkin!
Of course, I didn't forget – you deserve a worthy reward for your help. I couldn't have done it without you!
Hocus pocus!
Unlock all the pages of the story about The Ferryman
You have successfully completed the unique Legend of The Ferryman event!|October 13, 2019
Legend of The Ferryman
Nimiru’s tale is over, but her message remains: greed and selfishness will never lead us to anything good.
It’s not greedy to enjoy some of the sweets, however, we must ensure there are plenty for all.
Of course, Child.
Fear not, Sherity, but as long as you keep the story’s message in mind, we won’t have to worry about him.
Oh my gosh… I’ve been as greedy as Markata! I have to take these sweets back to the Lady right now!
Can… can I ask you a question before I go, Nimiru?
The Ferryman… is he real?
Immerse yourself in the exciting story of the mysterious Ferryman! Navigate new puzzles and enjoy a fun event with big rewards!

␣The merchant, Markata, was preparing a journey to the nearby city of Tanusa to sell his wares.|␣As he went to step through the doorway, his wife burst into the room, grabbing his arm. “Don’t go!” Zali pleaded. “You can’t travel tonight! Not during the Dark Moon!”|␣Markata pulled his arm away. “The Dark Moon isn’t real,” he said, rolling his eyes. “All those stories about evil coming out to walk the earth are just nonsense made to frighten children.”|␣As Markata turned to the door once more, Zali grabbed his wrist. “I wouldn’t expect you to listen,” she said. “You’ve become so selfish and greedy when it comes to your riches!”|␣“What are you talking about?” Markata asked.|␣The woman gestured to the merchant’s fine clothes and excessive jewelry. “All you seem to care about anymore is money!” she exclaimed.|␣Markata hefted the burlap sack containing the jewelry and spices he planned to resell in Tanusa, slinging it over his shoulder. With a grunt, Markata exited the house.|␣It was already twilight when Markata set out on his journey. He’d planned to walk through the night in order to arrive in Tanusa in time for the morning bazaar. Within an hour, the merchant felt the weight of his goods, and the sun had fully set. On this night, the moon was eclipsed, leaving little light by which to navigate.|␣Markata grunted once more, this time at the Dark Moon.|␣Doing his best to follow the dirt path in the dim light, the merchant soon felt water creep into his shoes. Squinting through the darkness, he realized the path had brought him to the bank of a river… a river he didn’t remember seeing on the map.|␣The river was covered in a thick mist, which rolled across the surface of the water. The dense fog blocked Markata’s view of the opposite riverbank making it impossible to cross safely. Markata dropped the bag onto the damp rocks of the riverbank as he considered returning home. Just as he was preparing to admit defeat, a boat broke through the fog, silently coming ashore mere feet away.|␣Hefting his bag, Markata cautiously approached the captain.

␣“You there!” Markata called to the boat’s captain, carefully making his way across the dark and rocky riverbank. “I must cross the river!”|␣As the captain turned toward him, Markata froze in place. The captain’s features were hidden in the depths of a robe. Due to the Dark Moon, the merchant could make out no details of the captain’s face.|␣“I am the Ferryman,” said the sailor, his voice little more than a whisper. “I’ll take you across the river… provided you can pay.”|␣“Of course I can pay!” Markata said. “Money is no object.”|␣The Ferryman nodded and the merchant heaved his goods into the rear of the boat where it landed with a thud. Markata climbed aboard and soon the boat was skimming across the surface of the fog-covered water.|␣“I’ve never seen fog this dense before,” Markata said nervously. “Does this happen every time there is a Dark Moon?”|␣“Every time,” the Ferryman answered in his hushed voice.|␣Soon, the boat was engulfed in the mist. Markata glanced to both port and starboard, but the fog was so thick, the merchant could barely see his hand in front of his face.|␣“I’m headed to Tanusa to sell my wares,” Markata offered, patting the burlap sack at his feet. “I hear there’s good money to be made there. What is your price for this trip, Ferryman?”|␣“The price can be discussed once we reach our destination,” the Ferryman responded. “It’s a good thing you saw my boat, I’m sure your wife is praying for a safe journey.”|␣Markata’s brow broke out in a cold sweat. He hadn’t mentioned his wife to the Ferryman. Suddenly, the merchant wished he’d heeded his wife’s warnings about traveling during the Dark Moon.|␣The merchant’s thoughts were interrupted as the mist to the right side of the boat began to swirl. As Markata stared into the churning fog, shapes formed in front of his very eyes.|␣The merchant gasped at what he saw.

␣Markata watched as the mist shifted to show a city street. People formed from the fog, looking just as real as if the merchant was actually standing on the road within his home city.|␣“What is this?” Markata gasped.|␣The Ferryman gave no response.|␣Suddenly, a man dressed in expensive linens strolled into the scene displayed within the mist. As the wealthy man walked down the sandy street, beggars appeared, raising their hands toward him in hopes of a handout.|␣In front of Markata, the Ferryman scoffed. “Can you believe the nerve of those beggars?” the hooded figure asked. “Why would someone ever give handouts to those who aren’t willing to work for their own coin?”|␣The man in the mist made Markata’s hair stand on end. The stranger’s clothes reminded the merchant of something he himself might wear. The merchant, still engrossed in the visage before him, nervously fingered the golden bracelet dangling from his wrist.|␣“That man seems well-off,” Markata said, dabbing the sweat from his brow with his silk sleeve. “Surely he could spare a few coins to help feed those hungry men, right?”|␣Markata leaned over the side of the boat, struggling to see the face of the well-off man in the mist, but regardless of how hard he tried, the details remained obscured. The Ferryman let out an annoyed grunt, and the scene disappeared entirely.|␣As the merchant sat back in the boat, he wished he’d never climbed aboard in the first place. Something about the Ferryman made him more uncomfortable than he’d ever felt in his entire life. Before the merchant could make sense of the vision, the mist on the opposite side of the boat swirled, forming something even stranger.

␣Markata watched as the fog swirled again, showing several lush pomegranate trees. Beneath the trees were a woman and two children — covered in dirt, and dressed in little more than rags — picking bruised fruits from the ground.|␣Suddenly, a well-dressed man appeared next to the trees. A cascade of gold bracelets rattled on the man’s wrist as he yelled and pointed at the fruit pickers, causing them to flee.|␣Markata jumped when the Ferryman’s voice broke his concentration.|␣“It makes me ill that people would trespass on a man’s property to steal fruit,” whispered the Ferryman incredulously.|␣“I’ve chased people from my own garden before,” Markata admitted, his heart beating rapidly. “But, that woman and her children were clearly poor.”|␣As the Ferryman turned to look at Markata, the merchant’s heart beat rapidly.|␣“T-those pomegranates were b-bruised and would never be eaten by a man dressed as finely as that one,” Markata stammered. “He’s being s-selfish!”|␣Once more, Markata leaned toward the vision, attempting to get a look at the man’s face. Before he could do so, the scene disappeared as the mist rolled across the river’s sleek surface. Markata’s eyes dashed back and forth looking for any way off the Ferryman’s boat, but the mist closed in on him, making the merchant feel claustrophobic.|␣The merchant rubbed his shoulders as a chill came over him. He could no longer tell if the boat had been sailing for five minutes or five hours. Suddenly, the mist swirled again, and when the next scene formed, the merchant stifled a shriek.

␣This time, the mist revealed a figure leaned over a table. The man sat alone, smiling as he counted endless gold coins, looking almost possessed as he reveled in his wealth. Markata wanted to avert his eyes, feeling uncomfortable by the scene before him.|␣“How refreshing to see a man so dedicated to his vocation,” the Ferryman whispered. “This man clearly understands the merits of hard work.”|␣The vision was all too familiar to Markata. He himself had spent countless nights counting his own money as he bought and resold precious jewelry and spices around the region.|␣Markata’s gut tightened and he forced his eyes closed. “That man is clearly hoarding wealth, yet you celebrate such behavior?” he asked. “A man like that needs to learn that there’s more to life than one’s work! Where is his family? His friends? Is this how it ends for someone who abandons everything else to maintain their wealth…?”|␣The merchant, realizing he was hyperventilating, forced himself to take a breath. In response, the Ferryman let out another frustrated grunt.|␣“Why am I being subjected to these horrible visions?” Markata demanded, his voice rife with panic. “Who are these terrible men that I bear witness to?”|␣The Ferryman raised a robed hand softly snapped his fingers. As he did so, the mist swirled again, bringing the men from all Markata’s visions into view. This time, the merchant could clearly see their faces. His eyes widened and bile rose in his throat.

␣Markata’s mouth hung agape as he stared wide-eyed into the mist, recognizing the faces that hung before him.|␣All of the men were Markata.|␣The first was the selfish man who had ignored the hungry beggars. The second was the angry stranger that chased the woman and her children from the pomegranate trees. The third was the greedy man that coveted his wealth above all else.|␣“He looks familiar,” mused the Ferryman.|␣Markata leapt to his feet. The sudden motion set the boat rocking beneath him. “What sort of vileness are you conjuring?!”|␣“It’s your vileness, Markata,” the Ferryman whispered, “and if I’m being completely honest… I like it.”|␣Markata fell to his knees, his entire body shaken to its core. “Surely I haven’t become so greedy, angry, and selfish that there’s no chance of redemption. I’ll change my ways! I refuse to become that which I’ve seen in the mist!”|␣“Why change?” asked the Ferryman. “Where we’re going, you’ll fit right in.”|␣“I knew you weren’t delivering me to the opposite bank!” screamed Markata, tearing at his hair. “Stop this boat right now! I wish to get off!”|␣The Ferryman turned to Markata. Through the shadow, the merchant thought he saw the boat captain smiling. “It’s too late. You’re mine, now.”

␣Grabbing his bag of goods, Markata hoisted the sack over his shoulder.|␣“I won’t go anywhere with you!” the merchant screamed, his voice echoing in the darkness. Markata threw the bag over the side of the boat, where it splashed into the dark, mist-covered waters, sinking out of view. “I thought my work and my wealth was the most important thing in life, but now I see how wrong I have been!”|␣The Ferryman gasped.|␣“Ferryman, I beg you to turn this boat around!” Markata said, as tears streamed down his cheeks. “I will pay double your price for the inconvenience. Just name it!”|␣“You really want to know my price?” the Ferryman whispered.|␣The Ferryman’s serious tone sent a chill down the merchant’s spine. “Tell me,” Markata sobbed quietly.|␣“I find the most selfish, greedy, and polluted souls I can and take them to my domain,” hissed the Ferryman. “You pay with your life.”|␣“But I’m not the man I was when I stepped foot onto your boat!” Markata gasped. “I’ve seen the horror of my ways and have vowed to change! My soul is of no use to you or your masters!”|␣“You’re absolutely right,” said the Ferryman, turning toward Markata. “If you’ve changed, then you’re of no further use to me.”|␣The merchant screamed as the Ferryman shoved him over the side of the boat.

␣Markata gasped for air as his head appeared above the water. Splashing wildly, the merchant spied the Ferryman’s vessel several yards away, nearly enveloped by the mist that still rolled over the water.|␣Despite the darkness of the night, Markata could make out the riverbank from which he’d started. The merchant was puzzled to see it was so close, as though the ferry had barely moved in his time aboard. Desperate to return home, Markata turned away from the Ferryman and swam toward the shore. But just as he was about to step onto dry land, something caught his eye.|␣What little light the Dark Moon provided glinted off several objects beneath the water’s surface. The merchant squinted, making out a large stack of gold coins and jewelry. Markata froze in place, considering that his time aboard the Ferryman’s boat may not have been wasted after all. The treasure seemed to cover the entire bottom of the river, and if he collected it, he could return home with a fortune.|␣The visions Markata had seen on the boat flashed in his memory. The merchant claimed himself a changed man, but deep down, he knew the treasures hidden beneath his feet could change his entire life. Not giving it a second thought, Markata thrust his hands beneath the surface of the dark water.

␣Markata’s hands stopped short of the treasure.|␣“It’s a trick,” Markata said softly. “The Ferryman wants me to take this treasure. He wants me to be greedy. To be selfish. As soon as I put these coins in my pocket, he’ll come for me.”|␣Glancing over his shoulder toward the river, Markata could see the Ferryman watching him intently from the boat.|␣Leaving the treasure behind, the merchant climbed onto the riverbank. An angry howl emanated from in the mist behind him. The horrible screech sent another chill up Markata’s spine, forcing his legs to move faster. Locating the path that had brought him to the river in the first place, Markata set off for home.When Markata reached his house, his clothes and hair were still damp from the river. Zali, who sat at a table sewing by candlelight, jumped when her husband tumbled through the door, her eyes full of fear.“There was a Ferryman at the river!” Markata stammered, barely keeping his balance. “He showed me horrible things! Things that I would do if I don’t change!”|␣“Calm down, my husband!” Zali said, her eyes full of concern. “You’re not making any sense! What river?”|␣Zali tried to stand, but Markata fell to his knees, pinning her in the chair.|␣“I’m not that man in the visions!” Markata said, speaking rapidly. “I will never be that man! You have to believe me!”|␣“I believe you,” Zali said, stroking her husband’s head. “Are you okay? Where are your wares?”|␣“It’s all gone,” Markata sighed, shrugging.|␣“Don’t worry,” Zali smiled. “You have something better. A loving wife.”|␣Markata raised his head, managing a weak smile at his wife. “Then that is all I need,” he said.|␣Outside the house, sunlight broke the horizon and chased the Dark Moon in hiding. For Markata, a new day had begun, in more ways than one.
Hello, Sherity. My, that's a lot of sweets for one young woman…
I should hope you left some for the other children. Do you really think you can eat all those?
We must never be greedy, child. Nothing good ever comes of it.
In fact, this reminds me of a story that may help to emphasize my point…
The Lady was giving away sweets to everyone!
Well… maybe my eyes were bigger than my stomach.
