There's a type of fishing where the fishing rod catches everything itself while you just sit on the shore and keep an eye on the bells.
Bottom Fishing
Bottom fishing. This is when the hook and bait rest at the bottom of the body of water instead of floating. We'll need a sinker for that.
These hooks will work for us. Now we have to attach everything carefully… There we go!
Bottom Fishing
So, the hook. Or, rather, the hooks. It's better to use multiple hooks when bottom fishing, which are attached to the line by smaller lines.
Bottom Fishing
Rods for bottom fishing are good because you don't have to constantly keep an eye on the fishing rod. Secure the bell on the line. When a fish bites, the bell will ring.
The water will wash away all the feed from the feeders. The fish will get a whiff of the treat and come to you themselves.
Bottom Fishing
To attract more fish, you can fit the feed holder right to the sinker. Put the feed in there.
Bottom Fishing
Let's set up our fishing rods. Then you have to carefully throw the sinker into the water. Now you can relax.
The feed is for fish what morning porridge is for us, and just like porridge it's made from grains.
Base for the Feed
We need good feed to have a good fishing trip. We'll make some now.
In addition to holding feed together, saxaul is nutritious. In this respect, fish are just like camels.
Saxaul for Fish
The feed is made into spheres, which you throw into the water. To make it sticky, I use juicy saxsaul pulp.
If you take the softest part of the papyrus, cut it, and dry it, you get a decent softener.
Natural Softener
In order for the feed to work, it has to dissolve in the water and float in it. It can't lie on the bottom of the river. Softeners help with this.
I walk around my house like this once every few days and treat the local fish.
Feed on a Walk
Regardless of which fish recipe we choose, the first thing we have to do is dress the fish.
The Art of Cooking Fish
Make yourself comfortable. I'll do the cooking.
The Art of Cooking Fish
Look on the shelves, please. I can't find the cutting board.
This pan's "speciality" is that its shape is elongated like that of a fish.
The Art of Cooking Fish
I have a special pan for frying fish. Here, take a look!
No, that's not why I invited you over, to feed you simple dishes. We'll think of something more interesting.
The Art of Cooking Fish
Maybe we can cook some fish soup? It's the easiest thing!
The Art of Cooking Fish
I thought of something to cook for you! It will be delicious! But I need a baking tray.
The Art of Cooking Fish
It will be ready soon. Should we invite someone else? I haven't had guests in a long time, but today I'll have something for them to enjoy!
Every day I would bring her a fish to cook and some beautiful lilies.
My Wife's Art
My wife taught me to cook fish. No one can surpass her artistry!
I often worked in the yard. The sound of this bell meant that I could take a break. It used to mean a lot of things…
Memorial for Wife
My wife used to have a silver bell. She would ring it when the table was set.
The Ritual of Cooking
When cooking fish, my wife liked getting dressed up, as if it were a holiday or a ceremony. It probably was truly a sacred ritual for her.
When the kitchen is neat and tidy, you can eat at your leisure.
Cleaning the Kitchen
Something else my wife taught me is that you have to clean the kitchen immediately after cooking. Immediately.
You may catch a fish, but from the kitchen window you only get little ones, like alestes.
Fish of the Nile
You know, at home I can catch fish right from my window. It's great to live by the river!
Little tilapia are just begging for the hook. But this isn't a fisherman's most interesting trophy.
Fish of the Nile
Just look at the water! There's a real aquarium right outside my door!
I'll tell you in confidence: The bichir is the most delicious fish that dwells in the Nile.
Fish of the Nile
In my yard I have a veranda that's over water. You can catch some seriously rare fish there.
The Nile is full of all sorts of different fish. I don't want to catch any!
Fish of the Nile
Some days there's no rush to go anywhere in the morning. That's when you can go and catch yourself a fish for breakfast.
This is an elephantfish. It's called that because of its trunk. These are the kinds of wonders that are living around us!
Fish of the Nile
I want to show you an unusual fish. Let's try casting our lines right from the roof of my house.
That was a noble battle! But I caught a tiger fish! It's bigger and more vicious than all other creatures of the Nile, except the crocodile.
Fish of the Nile
For some reason, fishing trips haven't been going well lately. Something has scared away all the underwater creatures in the area. We have to catch the predator!
I want Nimiru to teach me which gods a fisherman should worship. I know little about that myself.
Help from the Gods
No matter what trade you pursue, you shouldn't forget about the help of the gods. Search for Nimiru. Let her come to me.
A water caltrop showed us a good place for Hapi's altar.
Altar Site
Hapi, God of the Nile, protects all fishers in our City. Let's build a small alter to Hapi near the Fisherman's hut.
We'll carve into a stone on the banks. We'll decorate the bushes above the water with ribbons. Here's the alter for Hapi!
Decorating the Altar
There's nothing complicated about serving the Egyptian gods. Like people, the gods love beauty, happiness, and possessions.
May the generous Hapi be benevolent towards the Fisherman and grant him a full life and bountiful catches!
Hapi's Blessing
The gods love when humans give them the fruits of their harvest.
I have finally put all my sewing notions in order. They look really cute in the basket!
Homely Atmosphere
To be honest, I prefer gathering a flower bouquet myself. Sure, it's nice when somebody gifts you flowers. But I tend to trust my own taste more.
Homely Atmosphere
There will always be flowers in my house! And if my husband ever forgets to gift them to me, I will go gather some myself.
This armchair will be mine! You know, father sits in the armchair every evening and… whoops! Did I say "father"?
Homely Atmosphere
I don't get what this house fuss is all about. However, I have been dreaming of getting myself a rocking chair for a long time. It's comfy to sit in, isn't it?
I've never been so anxious about any of my creations. But the Lady liked the cup! It's cup version nine.
Homely Atmosphere
My wife gave me one hell of a task! She told me to make a special cup. One that would become a favorite! How am I supposed to guess this kind of stuff?
Homely Atmosphere
When I was a child, my mother revealed the secret of true coziness to me. It's all about the lighting!
Homely Atmosphere
I will be fitting up and decorating my house today. I will have the day all to myself! I'm glad that Nimiru agreed to babysit the children.
Spring Cleaning
It's important to clean the house thoroughly before fitting it up.
What should I do with all these colored candles now? I suppose I could give the red ones to the Lady. I heard that she was fitting up her house.
Experimenting with Colors
I tried my hand at making colored candles. At first, I couldn't find a dye with a high enough heat resistance. But I didn't give up!
What's so funny? I constantly use the hourglass to note the time! It lets me keep track of things like how long the dough rests or how long the filling is stewing…
Kitchen Tool
The Lady is a wonderful lady. She's no worse than me when it comes to cooking! I think I'll gift her an extremely valuable kitchen tool.
This dried rose comes from the first bouquet that the Potter gifted me. I doubt he'll recognize it, but it's really important to me.
The Coziness Is in the Details
What is the Potter grumbling about? The more cats, the better.
Pets
A house must have a cat! I will not accept any objections! Why would it matter if it's our seventh cat?
Pets
Pets should be useful. Take the dog, for example! It can guard our house.
So what if the chinchilla only eats and sleeps? At least you can pet it any time you want!
Pets
Look at this cute little animal! Its fur is so soft! Let's take it home!
You can also play with the ferret. It lets you pet it too! I mean, it only lets me pet it.
Pets
The ferret can catch snakes. It can also drive away vermin. Now that's what I call a useful pet!
Of course, I was scared at first. But then I realized that it's a really smart animal. We should keep it!
Pets
AAAH!!! Help!!! Rat!!! Hang on… is this a domesticated rat?

Just look at that! The cats are licking the ferret, and the ferret is playing with the rat! The chinchilla is sleeping on the dog… It's always nice at home when everyone is getting along with each other!
Pets
Beautiful. We have a zoo at home. It would be awesome if all these fluffy pets became friends with each other. I wonder if that's possible.
It's only been two days and the Lady has sent me the rooster back already. How strange!
Morning Alarm Clock
I know what pet the Lady and the Potter need! I wouldn't have coped without one, given my family and farm!
No, it wasn't the demons. I mean, of course it was the demons – they just took the shapes of our cats and that mischievous ferret!
Messy House
Oh, gods of Egypt! What on earth is going here?! Did the demons go on a rampage in our house?
Active Games
Here's what I'll tell you: the cats and the ferret are more than capable of destroying any house in half a day if they don't have a toy.
Master's Everyday Life
Will you help me feed all these animals? The Lady took them in, but I'm the one who has to feed them for some reason.
That's my sister's handwriting! I was sure she died in an attack on our city! She says that she knew that the sea would eventually carry the letter to me.
Correspondence with Sister
We should take extra care when opening the bottle in order to make sure that the note hidden inside doesn't get damaged.
Yes, Tissa is alive. But she is being held captive by some rich merchant.
Correspondence with Sister
My sister, Tissa, wrote where I can find her. The city is far away from here, but I think I'll be able to get a courier deliver a message to her.
Her master, a merchant from Alexandria, sells wax goods. She told me that everyone writes their letters on wax tablets there.
Correspondence with Sister
I received a new message from Tissa.
I wrote another message to Tissa and sealed the scroll with the letter. Hopefully, she'll get the hint and do the same thing!
Correspondence with Sister
Tissa and I made a mistake. We were sending letters to each other unsealed. Anyone could have read what we were writing.
My sister still hasn't told me the name of the merchant who is holding her captive. She is probably afraid that he will read the letter and get very angry with her.
Correspondence with Sister
I got another letter from Tissa! And it was sealed inside an envelope!
Only those who know the secret of this box can open it. Now Tissa will be able to send me secret messages!
Correspondence with Sister
Tissa needs something that will keep the contents of her next letter secret. Then she will tell me the name of her master and how to save her.
Thank you. I would've never written such a convincing letter without your help.
Risky Plan
My sister told me that her master had a secret. And she wants to uncover it! How should I reply to talk her out of this risky idea?!
This letter will give her an excuse to enter her master's private chambers, from where she will be able to access the secret room.
Fake Letter
Tissa still wants to take the risk and is asking for my help. We should write a fake love letter and send it to her master.
Thank you. I won't even ask where you got these from. And you don't have to tell me how to use them.
Criminal World
Now Tissa is asking me to send her lock picks so she can open the secret door. Where am I supposed to get lock picks from? Who does she take me for?
Tissa did it! You won't believe what she found there! Her master is hiding a sky horse in the secret room! I thought it was just a fairy tale.
Secret Room
Tissa wrote that on the next full moon she would try to sneak into the secret room and uncover the secret of her master.
I'll start saving up a ransom for my sister. I think this ruby has a high value.
Ransom for Sister
My sister told me that her master was willing to let her go in exchange for a worthy ransom. He really likes precious stones.
Ransom for Sister
Emeralds are expensive, especially if they are of a rare color.
Ransom for Sister
What if Tissa's master prefers cabochons over faceted stones? In that case, this sapphire should tickle his fancy.
Good thing we found the topaz. The heftier our ransom, the sooner the merchant will release my sister.
Ransom for Sister
Everyone in this city is so kind to me! My sister, Tissa, will be living here soon as well.
Ransom for Sister
The Chief has a wonderful stone – a diamond of extraordinary beauty. And he is prepared to give it away in order to help get my sister back!
Tissa has been freed! She will come to me as soon as she finds a caravan to cross the desert.
Ransom for Sister
With the citizens' help, I've gathered many pieces of jewelry for the ransom. But there's no way I'm sending those to Alexandria in a leather bag!
Gotcha! Salamanders possess the unique ability of sensing and finding gold.
Hot Hunt
The Fisherman is gathering jewelry for his sister's ransom. I would like to help him. And to do that, I need to track down an extremely rare creature.
Salamander in Action
Come with me! You'll be able to see how the salamander finds gold for yourself. Of course, we won't be taking somebody else's belongings.
This sundial is fully made of gold! Amazing! I don't even what would be better – to melt it or to send it as it is.
Search in the Ruins
We've already gathered quite a few lost gold coins. Now let's make our way to the uninhabited part of the city. We might find some bigger loot there!
Just look at that! All the door hinges in this house are made of pure gold! And all this valuable stuff doesn't belong to anyone!
Salamander's Find
Do you know why our search salamander is so interested in this destroyed manor? I don't think there's anything of value here.
The broom will be useful in all kinds of house-cleansing rituals. What did you just think about? That I was going to fly on it?
Home Magic
If you're a housewife, then the first thing you need to do is get yourself a good broom.
It would also be a good idea to learn what kind of scents your brownie likes!
Home Magic
The atmosphere at home is first and foremost defined by the scent.
The pyramid might just be a pretty item, but every time I look at it, my heart fills with joy. And with joy come good health and energy.
Home Magic
They say that stone pyramids cleanse the area around them and charge it with good energy.
Home Magic
Sadness and anxiety can be dispersed away by wind chimes. People from the East brought this wisdom to us.
Want to know if this crystal ball is actually magic? That's up to you to decide. Just remember that real magic doesn't come from the items – it comes from the hands.
Home Magic
Start something new during the growing moon and finish whatever business you've got left on the new moon. There are many rules – the calendar should help you understand them.
Home Magic
Any undertaking should be started at the right time. Especially when it comes to magic – even if it's of a home kind.
Thank god we found the cream. I did make a promise, after all… What will the others bring, I wonder?
Female Company
Let's have a girls-only get-together! Isn't that a great idea? I have a new wonderful cream. I'll bring it to you.
Fun Reading
The Lady invited me to a girls' get-together. I'll take this fascinating book with me. It's a lot more fun to read with others than on your own.
Girls, I brought wine. An ancient one! It was found during a clearance of the city ruins.
A Warm Evening
So, are we meeting up at the Lady's after sunset? The evening is going to be a warm one, so we'll be able to get comfy on the veranda.
Come on! Nobody will ever find out. I'll just hide it at mine. You let me know if you want any!
Lady Antics
Oh, I think we should persuade Nimiru to brew a love potion!
Thank you! I've been dreaming of a new sickle for harvesting herbs for a whole eternity!
Herbalist's Tools
Gathering herbs and healing people is a responsible task. It's important to keep track of your tools' condition.
Herbalist's Tools
Some herbs must be dug out completely. That is because there is a great variety of medicinal roots. But my old shovel's handle is broken.
Of course, you can carry herbs in cloth sachets or tie them onto a cord. But to be honest, I just absolutely adore baskets!
Herbalist's Tools
Okay, listen up. I was making a potion and added too much of one of the ingredients. I began decanting the potion, and the strainer… melted. Just don't tell anyone.
Herbalist's Tools
I need a new tea strainer. Do you want to know how a strainer can deteriorate and become unusable? I won't tell you. You won't believe me anyways.
Yes, I was exaggerating. I don't need a new teapot. I just want another one. It's just so pretty! And easy to use too.
Herbalist's Tools
Teapots can be really beautiful, can't they? I need a new one!
By the way, I have the most complete medicinal herbarium in the whole of Egypt! When I said "I," I actually meant "we." You are helping me a great deal!
Herbalist's Tools
Herbalists gather their herbariums for their whole lives. That is why my medicinal herbarium will never cease growing!
Thank you for helping me find the book! My mother would've really scolded me for losing it. And I don't want to let Nimiru down either.
Lost Book
My mother asked me to deliver this book to Nimiru. The Chief's daughter is an herbalist, after all. And I decided to read it and ended up losing it somewhere!
Herbarium Expansion
There are several samples missing in my herbarium. Normally, you'd think that these herbs are as common as they get. But it's actually really hard to find something suitable for the herbarium!
Just think about it yourself: it's not exactly easy to find a sample with undamaged roots and leaves.
Sample for Herbarium
I also need celery. Yes, the one that grows everywhere!
Dusty Work
I wonder what's inside this chest. Achoo! Oh my. Dried herbs. But it seems that these were prepared by my grandmother. I need to sort everything out here.
Many games with this picture. But I no remember the rules. Do you?
Board Games
While I be alone in mine, this game with pictures save me! The cards, I mean. They must be in mine.
When playing checkers, you actually have to think about your moves. It's especially not taxing if you think while lying in a hammock.
Board Games
No, cards are for lazy people. We need logic games. For real men! Men on a break, of course.
No, you are not a clever rat. You are my friend. If you don't want to play chess – fine.
Board Games
Even a mine rat can play checkers. As far as I remember. But chess is only for the cleverest rat!
Board Games
There's this game called backgammon. It's like checkers, but you also have to throw dice in it. It's fun unless you are getting ones.
Apparently, it's shogi. And the word is "shogi" as well. Shogi – fogy! Shogi – stogie… Oh, what's that word?
Board Games
Look here. In mine, I found this board with game. And with chips. I go ask master know-it-all from papyrus mill what this game be.
Let's play this game! But we'll use our own rules. Whoever pronounces the name correctly with their mouth full of honey is the winner!
Board Games
"Shogi" is a normal name. One of the guests from the North told me about such an odd game! It's a lot easier to play than to try and pronounce what it's called.
So that's who was behind all this mischief! Well, well. Do you like honey, by the way?
Furry Bandit
Hey, there was a chessboard lying around here! So, who scattered all the pieces? I'm sure it wasn't the bees!
That's what I thought! Anyway, you can stay with us, kitty. Just stay away from the chessboard from now on, okay?
Reluctant Helper
And who will put all the pieces back in place? It surely won't be me! Come on! Help me out, kitty! You are the one who scattered them, so you should be the one to put them back!
Important Piece
I just can't seem to find the black queen. It's such an important piece, too! Although my opponent would say that no piece was as important as the white queen.
Now that's more like it. It might be just a pawn, but you can't play the game without it.
The Last Pawn
I've counted the pawns three times, and it appears that I'm missing one. Oh yeah! There are only seven blacks.
No, I no see where this be on big map. But I see island. Beautiful place! But much water.
Mythical Lands
I dream of place. I draw what I see. You know where this be?
People in fur walk there. Everybody say this be Hy-per-bo-re-a. So I cold.
Mythical Lands
I very cold tonight! Because it snow in my dream. I never hear about word "snow" before.
These animals be there too. Like monkeys, but no monkeys. With ears. They cook food on fire!
Mythical Lands
Why everybody tell me that such land no exist?! I see it! Yes, in dream. But I draw map!
Many apples on island. Tastiest apples in my life. But I no eat – I sleep.
Mythical Lands
If only I wake up and bring apple from dream. Would they believe me about this land?
Believe it or not. But I draw a map.
Mythical Lands
What a dream I have tonight. Almost fall out of bed. But I no fall because I sleep on floor. All because of mountains. One mountain, two mountains, three mountains… Many.
Beautiful. And magic! And it all be true. True dream.
Mythical Lands
And nobody believe me. When I live in cave, nobody outside no believe me too. Except Nimiru. I put all my maps in a book for her.
The land that the Miner is talking about does not exist!
Searching the Library
The Miner is showing everyone his ridiculous maps from his dreams. I will search the entire library, and I will find something that will either prove or disprove his words.
A Real Atlas
I've already shown this atlas to the Miner. That land of his is not in there! Perhaps he will stop making stuff up if you bring him this book?
I will use this ring to check all my maps and atlases.
Revealing Signet Ring
I just can't seem to get this mythical land the Miner has been talking about out of my head. I've heard of an artifact that can reveal hidden symbols on parchment.
Yes, it appears that I am the one who was wrong. The secret writings are showing where Atlantis and Avalon are located on the map. The path to Hyperborea is portrayed as well.
Secret Writings
I found secret writings on the ancient map. I've come across them before. White grapefruit juice should help reveal the symbols.
It's not that I was going to wear this on my head… I don't have to, do I, Nimiru? It's just a symbol, isn't it?
Faces of the Sun
The Sun is the celestial chief. And that is why it's the patron of all chiefs.
Faces of the Sun
Among all the beautiful flowers, you must find the one that possesses a likeness to the Sun. I'll give you a hint: this flower grows in the Lady's garden.
Faces of the Sun
Our grandfathers believed that the Sun moved across the sky on a flame chariot pulled by white horses.
I must be well prepared. If I make one mistake when lighting the fire, everyone will think that the gods have turned their backs on us.
Faces of the Sun
The Sun moves across the sky. But here on Earth, we light a sacred fire in its own honor. This is also the duty of a chief.
Ouch! It pinched me! Does that mean that the Sun is angry with me, I wonder? Or is it the opposite?
Faces of the Sun
The Sun represents beauty, light and power. That is why white swans are the birds of the Sun.
Knowing all the Sun's faces, you understand its true power.
Faces of the Sun
The Sun's winged disc is our most sacred symbol.
We will hold a performance while the gods are congregating in the sky. And I will wear the mask of Horus, the god of the Sun and all chiefs.
Sun God
The Sun and the Moon crossing each others' paths during an eclipse is actually a meeting of two gods: Horus and Thoth.
Moon God
During the performance in celebration of the eclipse, I will be representing Thoth, the god of the Moon and wisdom. Will you find a mask for me?
Will that be okay for the performance? For the eclipse? What does it say here, by the way?
Eclipse Manual
Sun and Moon. Moon and Sun. I see tablets somewhere. They have symbols on them. Moon and Sun near. Somewhere in mine?
With this knowledge we'll be able to properly prepare ourselves for the festival in celebration of the solar eclipse!
Ancient Language
The sacred messages found in the mine are written in an ancient language. They contain knowledge about the Sun, the Moon and the time when they meet. I will try to decipher the text.
I've always found it easy to track down hares in moonlit spots. Perhaps that's why I became a hunter.
Faces of the Moon
What do you see when looking at the Moon?
I used to be able to do a trick with a coin like that. I could take down the Moon right from the sky!
Faces of the Moon
Look – I can put the Moon in my pocket. I can also spin it between my fingers!
Do you remember your dreams? I do. The dream world is a wondrous place.
Faces of the Moon
The crescent moon is a ship on which you sail across the dream world every night.
Be careful with both the flower itself and the drink that is made from it.
Faces of the Moon
I will show you something only few have seen. It's extremely difficult to find this flower, but it's the one we need to make the moon beverage known as soma.
Be careful not to prickle yourself! Otherwise, you might fall into a hundred-year sleep, like in that tale. Relax, I was joking! Or maybe I wasn't…
Faces of the Moon
The Moon goddesses weave the threads of our fate.
All these are the faces of the Moon. Now you know of its true power.
Faces of the Moon
The main lesson that the Moon teaches us is that everything moves in a circle. One changes the other. If you are brave enough, you'll be able to turn the circle into a spiral.
Loud Greeting
The whole city is preparing for the eclipse. Nimiru said that the meeting of the Sun and Moon must be greeted by fanfares. I must get everything ready.
Beer for the Festival
I will brew something special on the eclipse day. Oatmeal stout is as dark as the night sky. Its foam is golden like sunlight. And the taste! Delicious!
It's good that I actually have a ton of cosmetics.
Makeup for Everyone

The citizens must be wearing masks or other disguises when meeting the eclipse. But it's impossible to have enough masks for everyone. This means that we'll have to put makeup on some of the citizens!
Bright Disguises
There's very little time left, and I still have to put makeup on half of the city! Will you lend me hand? Come on, my friends! Line up in two queues!
Look – it turned into a tadpole as soon as we put it in the bucket. And now it turned back into a fish! I don't think it likes the water there.
Water Magic
Whatever creature this water spirit transforms into, it will be better off in water. And our nearest source of water is the river!
We were wrong. The spirit is constantly changing forms, turning from one fish into another. But it obviously doesn't want to go into the sea water.
Water Magic
Could it be that this creature is a sea spirit? It did turn into a starfish, after all. That means that it needs water from the sea, not from the river.
So picky! It doesn't like rainwater either! Oh, and quit turning into a tadpole, will you?!
Water Magic
The Nile water is not that clean, if you think about it. It's really muddy and slimy. If the spirit requires pure water, then I know what might just be perfect for it.
It doesn't like it! It doesn't like the dew water! It even turned into a toad!
Water Magic
So it needs something even purer?! I'm at a loss… We should try to collect some dew, since it's the purest and most magic water in the world.
It turns out that there was no need for us to look for pure water. It's a kappa, a swamp spirit! It needs swamp water!
Water Magic
Looks like we need to change our approach. But why is this spirit constantly transforming into either a frog or a toad? Could this be a hint?
Kappa was trying to show me where the magic jug was hidden! From now on this powerful artifact will be used for the good of our city!
Water Magic
Kappa wants to show me something. I guess I'll go wherever it is leading me. I think I will find something important there.
Did you know that Khnum is the patron of the Nile? Our Great River flows according to his will.
River God
I don't know much about magic. And I don't really like it either. But the Nile possesses a special power. And as a fisherman, I must treat it with respect.
First of all, crocodiles swim away to the other side of the river at night to sleep. So it's safe here.
Night on the Riverbank
I will share what I know about the Nile with you if you go for a hike with me. But we must absolutely go at night. I will tell you why.
I don't know what women use this clay for… But I use it as a water filter. You can make some quality drinking water with it!
Useful Clay
Careful! The ground is really boggy here. You can collect clay in this place. Of course, when there aren't any crocodiles rolling in it.
I have no need for this mint. It just smells nice, that's all. Nimiru, on the other hand, sees great value in herbs gathered from the Nile riverbanks.
Night Scents
This is what I wanted to show you. Can you smell it? Such a strong aroma is present during nighttime only. That's why I come to gather mint growing on the riverbanks at night.
Amethyst crystals charge water with their magic energy.
Stone Magic
We must charge whatever water our new companion requires with magic. Help me find something that can make this water magic.
Stone Magic

While I was busy looking for an amethyst crystal, the Beekeeper told me that he had another magic stone in his possession. I should take it away from him. You know, magic in unskilled hands and all that…
It would be better if I kept it. You just never know how and when stone magic will manifest itself.
Stone Magic
Our city is like some kind of an artifact museum! The Potter has a jasper disc with some obscure symbols on it. He doesn't know what to do with it!
I asked the Tradeswoman to observe this plate with extreme care. Who knows what other properties it conceals?
Stone Magic
The Tradeswoman told me that a jade plate was inserted into one of her house walls. Apparently, it glows the day before rain.
The Miner said that he'd had these stones for ages. And they sparkle too! I'd rather they do it under my care.
Stone Magic
This chest can store and preserve magic of any power. If we find something that poses danger, we'll just hide it in the crystal.
Stone Magic
There are so many artifacts in the city! But what if something truly dangerous emerges among them? Luckily for us, I know what we can do about that.
So the Warrior didn't give you anything at all in the end? Don't tell me he actually forgot our conversation.
Forgotten Conversation
The Warrior told me that he wanted to give me some artifact for safekeeping. And it looks like he forgot about it! Go and pay him a visit, please.
That's no artifact. These are just ladies' trinkets. How did face powder find its way into the barracks?!
Search in the Barracks
Yes, I remember that I promised something to Nimiru. But I just can't remember what it was. Perhaps if I look, I might find whatever I was going to give to her?
What is it? Somebody let a woman inside the barracks?! With whose permission?! I can't remember anything…
Find the Woman
Let's continue our search. Why are the working premises in utter disorder?!
Do you know what this bowl is? Alright, I'll just give it to Nimiru. Let her figure it out.
Yesterday
My memory of yesterday is really cloudy… What did I actually do yesterday? I think I was supposed to find something.
A good supply of water is the most important thing to have in the desert. Sweets, on the other hand, won't be of much use to you there.
Trip to the Desert
Alright, children. If you are going on a camping trip, what is the thing you are going to need the most? The most important thing you will ever need in a desert?
The desert can be very cold at night. Extremely cold. That is why you should always have a flint and a tinderbox at hand so you can make a fire.
Trip to the Desert
You might be thinking that it's always hot in the desert, so you'll never need to make a fire. But that isn't true.
Always bring a bundle of firewood with you. A well-made fire can save your life in the desert at night.
Trip to the Desert
Making a fire is not difficult. However, you will need firewood to keep the fire burning. And you won't find any in the desert! In fact, you won't find anything there except for sand.
A tent like this will enable you to weather the heat peak without any problem. And you will have enough energy to continue your trip in the desert.
Trip to the Desert
It can indeed be extremely hot in the desert during the day. To be honest, nobody ever travels on the sand in the middle of the day. That is why people tend to wait for the heat to subside.
A rope has its uses outside camping. It can prove to be handy anywhere. Alright, young man! You go and find yourself your own rope! Don't you try to steal mine!
Trip to the Desert
Always a carry a rope with you wherever you go. What do you mean, "why"? Because! You will need it! You can make anything out of a rope if you are resourceful enough.
Excellent! We are leaving tomorrow!
Trip to the Desert
We've gathered all the most essential stuff for our camping trip. All that's left to do is to pack it all up nicely.
Camping Food
Of course, we will eat during our camping trip. It's best to stock up on lentil. It's light and easy to digest, too.
Sausages are just the right thing! Fine, take some marshmallows too. But keep in mind that you'll be carrying all this stuff!
Tasty Stash
It's always a good idea to take something tasty on a camping trip. Especially if you can cook it on fire.
Many things can happen on a camping trip. Even a bandage might not suffice on certain occasions. To be able to deal with cases like these, you should take me on your trip.
Camping First Aid Kit
I almost forgot! You might injure yourself during a camping trip. For those cases, you should have something with which you could dress your wound.
Camping Practice
And now we'll go out in the yard. There you will keep making a fire and setting up a tent until I can see that you are capable of doing it with your eyes closed.
Take a look – this is a raft. The easiest means to traverse a water obstacle. Assuming it's not too wide. And open. And has no current.
Crossing the Nile
Children, the Nomad will be taking you out on a camping trip to the desert that is on the other side of the Nile. I must teach you how to cross a river.
Dugouts are a convenient means of transport. But only if you are alone. If two people sit in it, it will tip over.
Crossing the Nile
People began crafting dugouts from the wood just a bit later than making rafts.
All of you won't be able to fit on a sampan. We are going to need something else.
Crossing the Nile
A flat-bottomed boat is something like a mix of a dugout and a raft.
Sailboats are really beautiful! But if there won't be any tailwind, we'll never get to the other side of the Nile.
Crossing the Nile
If there is a sail on a boat, you don't have to row. This is an advantage. But only if you don't care in which direction you will be sailing. In our case, we need to get to the other side.
This is my favorite boat. No, I won't let you sail on it. I need it for work.
Crossing the Nile
The dhoni is a great fishing boat. It has a stable and maneuverable design. And it can carry a lot of fish too.
Crossing the Nile
You know… Forget everything I told you about different kinds of boats. To take children across to the other side of the Nile, we just have to build a ferry. That's all.
Floats for the Net
Do you want to help me with fishing? Alright. Find a coconut tree. We will make fishing floats from coconut shells.
Night of the Fisherman
Let's go set the nets now. The job will take us the whole evening. What did you expect? But at least you won't have to go to sleep until dead of night. It's best to set nets late in the evening.
The rice grains must remind fish of… you know, its usual food.
Fish Bait
If you put some bait in the water, more fish will swim towards the net. Rice will be great for the job.
Good Haul
Shall we move on to the most interesting part then? Let's go check who got caught in our nets!
This should be enough, I suppose.
Activity for Boys
Boys, we will be building a tree house! Bamboo will serve as our primary construction material. Make sure you only collect stems that are long and dry.
A cord like that will help us get the job done. If anybody runs out, make sure you ask the Lady to give you some more!
Activity for Boys
The bamboo stems should be clamped with a cord. That's how you make small walls. Okay. Everyone should make two walls each!
It's fun to climb a tree on the branches only the first hundred or so times. After that, it won't be as entertaining without a ladder.
Activity for Boys
Don't forget that we are building a tree house. You'll need to climb up there somehow. Of course, climbing on branches might seem really fun for you right now.
Now we can all sit by the fire in the house. But you must still be extra careful! The tree has agreed to offer shelter to you, so make sure you don't burn it down.
Activity for Boys
You must be thinking that we can't make a fire since we are in a tree, right? Well, that's where you are wrong! You just need to make a reliable fireplace.
If you don't like your current curtains, feel free to ask for different ones yourselves. But keep in mind that the Lady is busy with her cleaning.
Activity for Boys
You can use pieces of cloth as doors! Ask the Lady to give you some old curtains! Fine, I'll go ask her myself.
Отличный получился домик! Жаль, меня не поймут, если я начну с вами тут пропадать.
Activity for Boys
Could you have found something at least remotely more interesting than a white cloth? Fine, you can paint it in your free time.
House with a Flag
Hey, kids! We forgot the most important part! Our tree house is going to need its own flag!
Yes, I was joking about never feeding you again. Now come and eat your lunch! You definitely won't be full just by eating apples.
Foragers
Sorry but I'm going to say no, boys. Since you are now living in your own house in a tree, you can forage for your food yourselves!
Good boys! Just make sure you return to Sepat for dinner.
Food from Trees
If you really want to forage for your food yourselves, then I suggest you find a date palm. Dates are both tasty and nutritious.
The hen is in its nest and has already laid eggs, my little wolves! Oh gods, I hope the Lady never hears me say that… I meant, it's dinner time!
Secret Code
Kids, I think we should come up with a secret code! Something that you will understand when talking to each other while others won't.
Girls, don't take flowers away from each other. Each one of you should make a unique wreath!
Girly Wreath
We are going to need flowers to make a wreath. Don't even think about plucking any in my garden! Good girls weave wreaths from wild field flowers.
I am so glad you found some fern! Its delicate leaves will make any wreath prettier!
Girly Wreath
Girly Wreath
It's best to use a silk lace as a base for a wreath. After all, it's easy to attach all kinds of things to it. And it looks cute.
String the beads right on the grass blades. It will turn out really pretty!
Girly Wreath
Now is the perfect time to get your secret stashes out and find yourself a dozen of pretty beads.
Girly Wreath
There is no wreath that could be ruined by ribbons!
Now hurry and try your wreaths on! You are all very beautiful!
Girly Wreath
Now you've got everything you need! If anybody needs help or advice, you're more than welcome to ask me!
Suitable Activity
Will you help me find Sheriti, please? She ran away with the boys to build a tree house. The Lady happens to be teaching the girls how to weave wreaths right now.
Can I put this in a wreath? It's pretty and you can have a snack any time you want!
Useful Adornment
Fine, I'll make a wreath too! But mine will be the most unusual! What should I add to flowers, I wonder?
Mom's Treasures
My mother had a box of broken jewelry somewhere. I don't think she would mind if I used some of it for my wreath!
Caught you! No, it flew away… Just why won't it sit on my wreath? It has flowers too!
Fleeting Beauty
Oh my, such a pretty butterfly! I want to adorn my wreath with it! Where are you going? Wait!
Safety first. It would be better to leave real weapons to the warriors. The theater is a place for props only.
Theater Props
There are battle scenes in some theater plays, but nobody ever uses real weapons there. I wouldn't trust the actors to handle combat steel either…
Great job! Now our theater has its own set of plates and jugs.
Theater Props
Producers often add meal scenes to their plays. We need special hollowware!
Papyrus furniture is just what we need for an amateur level!
Theater Props
We don't know yet what performances we'll be doing, but using real furniture to decorate the stage will cost us a fortune.
Making artificial trees and other plants is not that hard.
Theater Props
Okay, we've got the furniture issue resolved. But what are we going to do if the performance will be set somewhere in the wilderness?
A costume designer is mainly a ladies' job. I am really grateful to the Tradeswoman. She's done an excellent job.
Theater Props
We have gathered all the necessary theater props required for our first play. But there still remains the question of costumes.
Spectators love stories based on real events. I believe you've produced a faithful representation of all the details. That's exactly how everything was!
Theater Props
Our first play will be about the kidnapping of Nimiru by Menes and her release from captivity! But we need to assemble a corresponding scale model before beginning work on the decorations.
Building Stage Props
Sometimes theater props are difficult to manufacture. For those cases, it's easier to just find suitable items! We need a throne.
Diva's Wishes
The Diva is concerned that her adornments do not produce the required image. Can you find something more suitable?
Household Props
I had a quick think about what the stage will look like. We're missing simple household goods to fill the scenery.
Prop List
Our theater has accumulated quite a lot of various props, including some really valuable ones. We need to review everything and compile a list!
Thank you. You are just in time! Would you mind lending us a hand with other things, too?
Building the Stage
We are building a stage right now, but how am I supposed to climb on top of the scaffold if we don't even have a set of stairs?!
Wheeled platforms! Yes, that's very convenient! Now even the diva will be able to move the decorations. Although I doubt she'll ever stoop to that…
Building the Stage
If I'm going to have to call in soldiers every time something on the stage needs to be moved, our play will never see the light of day!
We need more of those lamps! We've already got enough dark with Menes as it is…
Building the Stage
Let's take a look at the stage from the auditorium… Oh gods, you can't see anything from here! It's black as night in this place!
The backstage is a really practical thing. Theater was invented by clever people, after all!
Building the Stage
In every theater across the globe, the stage scenery is displayed using an expertly decorated backstage.
Desert motifs? Yeah, I think we could use those.
Building the Stage
What's that white bedsheet? The whole point of using flats is to add more decorations onstage. Please draw us something suitable as soon as you can.
What a gorgeous Greek meander! I've always thought that using the right curtain will create a special kind of theater magic.
Building the Stage
It is now time for the most important item of the theater stage. The one that conceals mysteries and reveals them only to the chosen ones.
Memories of Things Past
The Warrior told me about the storyline he had chosen for his first play. It will be based on a story from our past. Now all that's left is to gather all the mementos…
I decided to bring artifacts from that era to the theater. I hope that way everyone will remember how it all used to be.
Artifacts from the Past
Do you remember how we summoned Bastet to our city? I've still got precious artifacts from that period.
Feats of the Past
There used to be a time when I was learning how to harvest moonlight. I still have that first flask I filled up. Shall we give it to our theater as a gift?
It appears I got completely lost in memories. Time to find my way out!
Beauty of the Past
There are things whose beauty does not fade with time. Just like the glory of our city!
Theater is one of the key elements towards achieving enlightenment. So I'll go prepare the paper and draw something.
Theater Paper Business
The Warrior came to my Factory and started ordering me around all of a sudden! Make him paper, make him tickets, make him posters… He literally just went full commander mode on me!
We got the playbill done! What else does the theater need?
Theater Paper Business
The Warrior wants me to make a playbill for his show! But he didn't tell me what kind of play it was… We can, however, prepare the sheets and design for now.
Theater Paper Business
The Warrior told me that his play will be dedicated to the kidnapping of Nimiru by Menes. That was one dramatic event! I can finally draw the poster now.
The paper and design for the libretto are done! Wonderful!
Theater Paper Business
The libretto will help the spectators better understand the meaning of what is happening onstage.
Theater Paper Business
The Warrior managed to get his hands on sheet music for his play somewhere. We need to make copies so that every musician would have one.
Theater Paper Business
I knew it would happen! The Warrior asked me to write a script for his play! Can I count on your help?
Good choice. I was at this festival and saw how Nimiru was putting flowers exactly like these on Bastet's altar.
Bouquet Scene
In the play there is a scene where Nimiru is greeting Bastet with a flower bouquet. Unfortunately, I don't know anything about flowers. Will you help me out?
You added some grass to the flowers! Great idea! I think the audience will like it.
Bouquet Design
The Diva is complaining about how a bouquet is not supposed to consist of just one flower. Or not even three! So, let's gather the most elegant bouquet out there, just to be on the safe side.
Finally, the Diva took a liking to our work! You have my gratitude.
Adding the Final Touch
The Diva is extremely demanding! She looked at the bouquet and declared: "Something is missing!"
If someone has any comments regarding the play's script, please go see the Master right now. There's still time for corrections.
Reading the Play
The Master of the papyrus mill has sent a draft of the play's script. In cases like these, it is usually read in the theater first.
I really am quite knowledgeable about music.
Theater Orchestra
The Warrior accidentally walked in on me playing djembe. I do enjoy my evening slapping sessions… And it seems that I'm the one in charge of the whole theater orchestra now!
You can easily play some simple yet catchy melodies on the xylophone.
Theater Orchestra
There aren't that many professional musicians in the city. But even a child will be able to play on some of the instruments properly.
Theater Orchestra
You need skill to play the valiha. I will be able to teach it to a couple of kids if I manage to get my hands on the actual instrument.
Too bad the mbira is too quiet for a theater orchestra.
Theater Orchestra
The mbira! Within it resides the melody of Africa's soul! It is almost as fine as my beer.
And there it is – the gorgeous kora. It's a shame you still haven't found someone to play it.
Theater Orchestra
We're missing one of the most important instruments of the Egyptian minstrels. While you're out there looking for the kora, try finding someone who can play it for us, too.
We've now become a veritable theater orchestra! The Warrior and the whole city can be proud of us now!
Theater Orchestra
So, we've got the instruments. And we found the musicians too. Time to practice!
The great Bastet plays the sistrum. Let's leave this music for rituals.
Sacred Music
There is another main Egyptian music instrument. However, it is considered sacred. I don't think we are allowed to use it in normal plays.
There's nothing but trouble with these ocarinas: you can never tell whether it's just a toy or whether you can actually play it before trying it.
Additions to the Orchestra
I'm still thinking what other instruments we could include in our theater orchestra. How about children's ocarinas?
They say that the sound the sedge produces resembles the whistle signal of Menes's warriors.
Sound Effects
A theater orchestra doesn't just play music. We must also make various sounds required by the script. Let's give the sedge a go – we can use it to make whistle sounds!
That turned out pretty great! But there's still plenty of room for our orchestra to grow!
Orchestra Practice
The Master of the papyrus mill has made several copies of sheet music for us. Now we can practice playing our instruments not just in general but for performances too.
The wool of the Buchis Bull is said to grow in the opposite direction and change color every hour, just like the sky.
Monsters of Egypt
The Buchis Bull is the son of the sacred cow. That also means he is the brother of Ra.
The Bennu Bird is believed to be the soul of Ra. Legend has it she is able to rise from the dead, and maybe even resurrect others!
Monsters of Egypt
Some say that the Bennu Bird rose from the flames of the sacred tree near the temple of Ra. Others say she broke free from the heart of Osiris.
Cryosphinxes serve the god Amon. He instructs these animals to sit near ancient cemeteteries, urging the souls within to remain silent.
Monsters of Egypt
You're familiar with the sphinx… a lion with the wings of an eagle and the head of a woman, yes? Criosphinxes are similar, but lack wings and have the head of a ram.
The Sak is very dangerous. After all, he is a demon that brings with him drought!
Monsters of Egypt
The Sak is a strange creature… it has the head of a hawk, the body of a lion, and its tail ends in a lotus flower.
The creature has the legs of a hippo! The paws and mane of a lion! The face of a crocodile! The Amat is a goddess of vengeance, said to devour the souls of sinners. Luckily, that's not us, right?
Monsters of Egypt
Those with the courage to travel to Duat, the underworld kingdom of Anubis, may see the monstrous Amat.
As a child, I was scared of the Apophis. But I learned the sun god Ra sneaked past the serpent each night as he traveled from through the underworld.
Monsters of Egypt
Deep within the bowels of the earth there lives a huge snake who dreams of swallowing the sun and plunging the whole world into eternal darkness!
Good thing I can bake pies so quickly. Of course, I am gracious for your help!
Fairy Tale Lovers
There goes the Chief, telling tales on the City square. A crowd of children has gathered around, and yet, no one thought to feed them!
Adult Listeners
It turns out that adults love listening to fairy tales just as much as children! We can't feed them sweets, though. We need something hearty.
Treats For the Listeners
As the crowd around the Chief grew, I realized I was going to need more treats than just my pies. I didn't want anyone to go hungry!
Tidy Area
The fairy tales are over and the crowd has dispersed, but the square is covered in apple cores and other rubbish. Will you help me clean the area?
Each night, the inhabitants of the village heard the rustle of giant wings overhead. Not knowing the source of the sound, they became very scared.
The Legend of the Dragon
I was one told a story about a monster that cannot be found in our area. The creature was seen in a small town of a country far, far to the north…
However, all that the brave young man managed to see was the monster’s eyes glittering in the dark. The narrow pupils were large and angry looking!
The Legend of the Dragon
One night, the son of the city's leader…a brave young soul… left the house in hopes of glimpsing the monster flying above the village.
In the side of the mountain the young man found a large cave. Entering carefully, he spotted a glittering pile of treasure.
The Legend of the Dragon
The young man didn't give in to fear, and when the monster flew away, he followed. Tracking the sound of flapping wings, he arrived at a mountain.
“Get out of my house!" yelled the thunderous voice. The young man did not argue, and quickly fled the cave.
The Legend of the Dragon
As the young man looked around the cave, it filled with fire. As the violent flames died down, a monstrous voice spoke from the shadows…
Scattered around the moutain were huge scales, as hard as steel. The scales reflected the sun like well-polished steel.
The Legend of the Dragon
As he descended the mountain, the young man saw some very strange stones. Well, he thought they were stones, but he quickly realized he was mistaken.
Suddenly, a huge dragon appeared from the depths of the cave! The beast was fearsome, yet beautiful, but what happened next… I have forgotten.
The Legend of the Dragon
The next night, the young man returned to the mountain. Entering the cave, he said, "Come into the light and talk to me, and I will not enter!"
The Nomad said it was only a tiger's claw. It may not belong to a dragon, but tigers are still very scary!
Scary Claw
Look what I found! Perhaps it's the claw of the dragon the Chief told us about?
End of the Legend
Tonight we are going to my house to try to figure out the rest of the Legend of the Dragon. Will you come with us?
According to legend, a special potion can be made from mandrake. Drink it, and you enter the land of the northern fairies.
Nordic tales
I also know a few northern tales. One of them being about the magic root of the mandrake.
I don't remember anything from the tale, except that the story ended with a broken trough. I wish I could remember what it all meant!
Forgotten Tale
I'm trying to remember another fairy tale I've heard, but I can't. Something about an old man, an old woman and… a fish, perhaps?
I wondered, is it possible to find a bird even smaller? It turned out that you can!
The Smallest Birds
I remember once spotting a small bird the size of my palm. At that moment, I felt like I was in a fairyland!
Greenish Warblers are not very bright in appearance, but they have loud and shrill voices.
The Smallest Birds
I've heard these birds winter in India. It's amazing it could fly so far, considering it's no bigger than Nimiru's palm!
The fluffy wren sits on a branch like some kind of fluffy ball, whistling loudly!
The Smallest Birds
In general, amazing little birds live not only in overseas countries, but here as well. For example, here you can meet a fluffy wren.
The golden-crowned kinglet… that's what they're called! I saw these birds when I was in Greece.
The Smallest Birds
Among the smallest birds is one called the kinglet. She's called this because of the golden crown on her head.
The short-billed bird, know as a Weebill, was so tiny that I thought my quest was complete! However, it didn't end there…
The Smallest Birds
Everywhere I went, I asked about the smallest birds in the world. One traveler showed me a bird that he carried with him in a cage.
It was several years before I saw a hummingbird with my own eyes. The stories were true after all! I don't think smaller birds than that truly exist!
The Smallest Birds
Overseas traders told me about a bird the size of a walnut. I couldn't believe that such a thing existed!
The cheese was so full of holes, I couldn't tell if it had been pecked at by birds or something else.
Suspicious Birds
I recently found a bitten on piece of cheese on my patio. Perhaps some little birds tried to eat it?
Can birds break a pot? Would they even have the strength? And why would they bother?
Pests on the Patio
The troubles on my patio continued. Soon, one of the pots had been destroyed. Good thing it was empty!
You think that a mouse got onto my patio rather than birds? Okay, I can fight off mice.
Track Down the Pest
Sage for Mice
My wife said that spreading sage on the floor will keep mice away. I don't really believe that, but trying it is easier than arguing with her!
When the merchant pulled the cloth from the cage, I saw incredible birds inside! They looked like flying rainbows! Each bird had very unique colors.
Bright Meetings
I went to the market for spices, but as I browsed, I came across a curious dealer. He had a large cage covered by a cloth.
Bright Meetings
A long time ago I had the chance to travel to faraway lands. It was there I saw a beautiful bird, all different shades of blue.
You've never seen a beak like this one… large and colorful! I was surprised that bees didn't mistake it for flowers!
Bright Meetings
While different shades of blue are beautiful, but bright colors are what I love. I once saw a bird that was all black, except for its beak!
It was the sacred bird of the air god heralded by overseas priests. That god's name was Quetzalcoatl.
Bright Meetings
There was another amazing bird… one I didn't see it with my own eyes, but instead saw in a painting.
The bird gave me a pensive look. The feathers on top of the bird's head were all curly, as if it had just come from the salon!
Bright Meetings
How's this for a story? Someone once asked me to cut his hair like a bird's. He even brought the bird along with him so I could see it!
There, on the deck of the ship was a dais, and atop it a throne. Beautiful golden birds sat around it, bowing to their sovereign.
Bright Meetings
I once caught a glimpse of an emperor's golden bird. As we sailed the eastern sea we passed an amazing flat-bottomed ship…
I've seen a lot of zebras in my life, but only one zebra-colored pie!
Unusual Cake
I've never been lucky enough to meet any multicolored birds, only ordinary parrots. But I have seen the most beautiful pie in the world!
Sweet Meeting
Pies are tasty, but when you want a sweet one and none are available, a good old honeycomb will do.
For a long time I lived in a cave, without a sky to gaze upon. It made me sad, but now life is good!
Cloud Miracle
The sky is full of wonders beyond just birds! Look with me to the heavens. Do you see all those clouds?
Stories On Record
There have been many amazing stories told throughout the City in recent days. I should have written them all down immediately. Now I have to catch up!
I don't know what prompted the Potter to bring such a plant, as the hoya symbolizes a declaration of love. Or maybe he knew that?
Flower Magic
When the Potter asked for my hand in marriage, he brought a potted hoya as a a gift. It was so cute!
Aihrizon flowers are wonderful, but many people don't water them. Relationships are like flowers… you must nuture them if you hope for them to grow.
Flower Magic
The sunny aihrizon flowers attract happiness to a house. My mother always grew them in the garden.
I don't think that my happiness with the Potter is in danger, I simply planted a Calathea because I like its striped leaves.
Flower Magic
My mother said calathea flowers have the power to save family and help maintain marital happiness.
According to legend, planting an oxalis will help anyone find their true love. I met the Potter, so I can't help but believe the stories are true!
Flower Magic
Do you know what helped the Potter and I to find each other? I'd like to think it's all the oxalis that grew on my window!
I water the acalypha and I water it some more, and still the Potter can’t seem to hammer a single nail to hang a flower closer to the sun!
Flower Magic
The acalypha is Potter's favorite plant. He brought one to my house, impressed by it's red tail. But now, he doesn't take care of it!
Flower Magic
Once each month, I put aside everything in order to take care of my plants. I inspect them, fertilize them, and talk to each and every one of them!
Unfortunately, the money tree didn't bring me instant wealth. As it turns out, it was only called a money tree because the leaves look like coins.
Money Tree
When I was first learning how to care for potted flowers, I planted a money tree in my room. Supposedly such plants attract wealth to the house.
The jovibarba is a wonderful plant. Sure, it has a strange name, but by being planted on the roof, it prevents lightning from striking the house!
Lightning Protection
There are plants that aren't intended to be grown in a garden or inside of a pot… take jovibarba, for instance, which is planted right on the roof!
I thought some irrigation and fertilizer would help the plants I needed to bloom on time, but it didn't work.
Flowering Time
When the Potter and I married, I wanted to make my own bridal bouquet. However, all my favorite plants bloom at different times of the year.
The Best Bouquet for the Bride
My bouquet turned out so beautifully that ever since then, all the brides of the City come to me for flowers. I'm working on a boquet for one now!
Tahini halva was my favorite recipe, and I was terribly proud of it. When the Potter tried it, I could tell immediately that he didn't like it!
Favorite Sweets
The Potter and I met when he came to help with the construction of the Sepat. When he sat down for a rest, I gave him a tahini halva to say thanks.
Halva with almonds is only moderately sweet. I gave some to the Potter the next time I saw him, but he wouldn't even taste it!
Favorite Sweetness
I thought maybe the Potter was too manly for sugary sweets, but then I remembered another old halva recipe.
My future husband picked the halva from the beans without any interest. I started listing chores that needed done, and he ran off quickly to do them.
Favorite Sweets
Suddenly, it was a challenge to make a halva that the Potter would eat!
Alas, carrot halva interested the Potter no more than my previous attempts.
Favorite Sweets
It occurred to me that the Potter might think halva wasn't a healthy food! He wouldn't be wrong in thinking that…
When I asked the Potter to try the dainty dessert he was embarrassed. He soon admitted that he was so nervous around me that he couldn't eat anything!
Favorite Sweets
A trader gave me the recipe for dayma-oyla. I had to cook all night to make it since the Potter was coming in the morning to fix the Sepat roof!
Now, the Potter happily eats any halva I put in front of him. I also learned to cook a real sakalans, complete with honey and cream!
Favorite Sweets
It turned out that the Potter really liked halva, but he was so in love that he was embarrassed to eat in my presence. I tried so hard to feed him!
Sweet Memories
Did I tell you that our wedding cake was partly made of halva? I remember it so well, just like everything from that wonderful day.
The Nomad and Chief decided that before the wedding I should undergo a series of trials to learn whether or not I had the courage for married life…
Testing the Groom
The Lady remembers everything about preparing for our wedding. Of all the memories I have, there's one I'd rather forget…
Unfortunately for the Nomad and the Chief, I'm not afraid of spiders, and I easily passed the challenge.
Test of Courage
First, the Nomad ordered the bridegroom… in this case, me… to claim my house key from a basket full of spiders.
A Feat in Honor of the Bride
Next, the Chief told me to catch a giant-toothed stegostoma. It wouldn't be easy, but how could I refuse?
Ishida is the wife of Osiris and the mother of Horus. She would pause to help any woman awaiting the birth of a child.
Temple of Motherhood
First and foremost inside the Temple of Motherhood should be a tribute to Isis, Mother of Kings and patroness of all children!
Having a baby is a long path. Without love and fun, the path can be tough. Especially at the very beginning.
Temple of Motherhood
Beautiful Hathor is the goddess of heaven, love, femininity, fertility, fun, and dance!
In fact, midwives call themselves "servants of Heket."
Temple of Motherhood
Heket is the frog goddess. You will never meet a pregnant woman who isn't wearing the symbol of Heket!
Mut gave birth to the sky! Of course she knows what it means to be a mother.
Temple of Motherhood
Mut is the Queen of Goddesses and Mistress of the Sky. Not only is she the mother of the gods, but also the spouse of the eternal Amon.
Taurt may appear menacing with her terrible grin, but she has a good heart. Taurt gives women the strength she needs to give birth to her child.
Temple of Motherhood
Future mothers always receive aid from the goddess Taurt, a species similar to a female hippo with the tail of a crocodile.
We did a great job! Now any woman can come to the Temple of Motherhood and the goddesses will take care of her!
Temple of Motherhood
Temple Salvation
Help us! A huge python has slithered inside the building we plan to use as the Temple of Motherhood!
Qualities of a Midwife
Any midwife must have a strong green thread. I say green because it's the color of fertility.
Temple Garden
I thought we might grow some plants around the Temple of Motherhood, especially those that symbolize purification.
Offerings to the Goddesses
The Temple of Motherhood is nearly complete. Let us gather the fruits and vegetables of the harvest to make an offering to our goddesses.
We've cooked the rice. Now let's set it aside until the remaining ingredients are ready.
Holiday Fatteh
The secret to the fatteh is preparing all of its parts separately, and combining them only at the very end.
When cooking fatteh I make an extra batch of cakes. While preparing the remaining ingredients, I can eat the first batch and no one will notice.
Holiday Fatteh
The finished fatteh is pressed into special cakes. First they are baked, then fried.
You can pour the broth over the rice we prepared earlier, but generally, the broth is served in a separate cup.
Holiday Fatteh
I won't teach you to cook meat broth, since everyone has their own recipe. The only rule is that it must be tasty!
Cut the meat into slices and serve it over the rice.
Holiday Fatteh
Don't forget to remove the cooked meat from the broth before serving. Be careful not to burn yourself!
I personally love cooking garlic sauce, but you can also use tomato. I don't know of any rules that would prohibit such.
Holiday Fatteh
The sauce is the soul of any dish. Did I already say that? Well, some truths bear repeating!
Holiday Fatteh
Now we put it all together, topping the cakes with rice, adding the meat, and finishing it off with the sauce. Oh, and don't forget the broth!
Good thing I know all about luck! Here, have a horseshoe. It's said to be full of luck.
Good Luck to Help
Mother shares her fatteh recipe while Nimiru manages the Temple construction… I asked if I could help, but she said only luck could help her now!
Good thing there was red thread! Now, let me teach you how to tie knots that will bring good luck.
Good Luck Knots
Drawn Letters
Come with us to write letters of happiness! Well, we'll draw ours, but since you're an adult, I guess you can write if you want.
It's going to be great! Inside every house there will be a horseshoe, and on each door a knot. We even distributed all our letters of happiness!
Good Luck
We have everything we need to ensure a home has plenty of good luck! We just need to hand these items out to the rest of the City.
New
Progress
Quest
Reward:
OK
We received a message from Nomad. He's bringing a baker to the city. How exciting! We must prepare for his arrival.
It's not much, but hopefully this building provides the essentials for the baker to use his talents.
These are the necessary items in this bakery: a big pantry for storing flour, good stove and different tools for baking. You'll soon smell fresh bread here!
In Knead of a Bakery
I'd be happy to settle down in your city and bake the tastiest cakes in the neighborhood! I just need a proper place to work…
Праздник хлеба
Ура, вот наш победитель! Ты собрал больше всех муки! Поздравляю, ты действительно самый ловкий!
Праздник хлеба в наших землях, попробуй намолоть больше всех муки и получи приз!
Thank you for the assistance. The Baker said he can make twice the sweets, now!
Bigger Bakery
The Baker said his building is too small to keep up with demand for his delicious treats. I could use an extra set of hands to help him expand his bakery!
I'd like to bake something truly special for the city, but my building is too small to accommodate such a grand recipe. Think you can help?
It's hard to convince people that I create beautiful-looking pastries when my bakery appears so plain. Would you help me to give this place some personality?
The city's constant dust storms has caused the bakery to become dull and worn. It could really use a fresh coat of paint, if you aren't busy…
The Chief has taken a liking to my sweets, but I feel this building isn't regal enough for his morning visits. Perhaps it's time for some remodeling…
My treats taste best when eaten immediately, but there's nowhere for my patrons to escape the hot desert sun. Will you help me add some trees and awnings to provide shade?
People are hearing of my legendary baked goods, but many can't find the bakery in this bustling city. Nimiru suggested adding a sign!
The bakery has proven so popular that I must add seating for my guests! Will you help me to pick out the right colors?
Thank you. This is perfect! Just wait until you see what I'm cooking up!
Wow! It's like a brand new bakery. Amazing what a difference that made!
The place looks wonderful! How did you know my favorite color?
Now the bakery is fit for a king… or at least, our Chief!
Excellent! Now there's plenty of shade to keep the glaze from melting off from my pastries.
It's a wonderful sign! Now everyone will be able to find my bakery!
Thank you for your help! Not only do my guests get delicious food, but the best view in the entire city!
With each passing day, more citizens are signing up to serve in our army. The Chief has requested larger barracks in which to house them!
Just as I feared… we must add another wing to the barracks to accommodate our eager recruits. Can you help?
We must train our warriors for combat at sea. Construction of a dock should begin immediately.
Warriors from the neighboring settlements are eager to join our cause, but we have nowhere to put them! Can explore adding additional housing to our barracks?
Our warriors are now proficient in sea combat, but we must begin mounted training immediately. Horses are the fastest way to defend our city.
Princess Nimiru says she's spending too much time showing new recruits the way to the barracks and has asked that we consider adding some sort of sign. Can you help?
The Chief worries about our barracks coming under attack by Amrun's forces. He has requested that the walls be reinforced to be twice as strong.
Excellent! Our archers can perfect their bow skills while our foot soldiers learn close combat.
This will suffice for now, though we will quickly outgrow it.
What people have said about you is true. You the heart of a warrior. Thank you for your help.
The Chief extends his thanks for your hard work. I must go and begin running drills with my soliders.
The new floor will serve us well. You may not carry a weapon, but you do our city proud.
These stables look strong and sturdy. Thank you for once more lending us your skills and talents.
I'm not sure I agree with advertising the location of our army, but I won't disagree with the Princess.
You've reinforced the walls, eh? I suppose there's only one way to tell if they are truly stronger, but I will not hope for an attack of any kind.
Training Stations
I underestimated how many people would take up arms to fight for their city. Before we can bring on more soldiers, we need additional training stations.
I'm so glad the citizens accepted me. I've never been able to brew so much before in my life. I hope it's to their liking.
The Birth of Brewing
Now I have everything I need. A few more days and I'll be ready to present my brew to everyone who wants it!
Thank you so much for trusting me. My trade is my life and I promise to dedicate myself to it completely.
The Birth of Brewing
My Master, your city is large enough to make enough BE-ER for everyone. I've decided to expand several storage buildings and I'm going to need some more resources.
I'm glad the Farmer agreed to help me. When everything goes to plan, the citizens will praise us no less than the warriors. I know my friend likes to be respected.
How the Brewer Saved the City
We'll need the Farmer's help to repel the enemy army's attack, so I decided to let him know about my plan.
I'm proud of our citizens - what we did today wasn't for nothing. Today we help our friends, and tomorrow, in our hour of need, they'll help us.
Helping Neighbors
I spoke to the citizens in the Sepat today and asked them to get a small fund together for our western neighbors suffering at the hands of the insidious Menes's soldiers.
In a new dream, the girl told me she was born of a lonely woman in a year of terrible disease. When she grew up, she took to healing people, and the disease soon disappeared.
City of the Past
The girl I saw in my dream was Azeneth. She asked me to break the cursed mirror, and in return, she promised to give the city a gift - a box of rare medicines.
I'll make such reminder knots for all my customers and give them out at the entrance. I hope it'll help people remember to take things with them.
Lost Things
I've been returning things people lost after the Brewery opened all week. The poor folks are still unused to my brew and are constantly forgetting things here.
When the Warrior's troops came over the nearest hill, our enemies couldn't even fasten their sandals, let alone take up arms! It was an unconditional victory.
How the Brewer Saved the City
The citizens loaded a barrel of the new brew onto a cart, and I set off into the enemy camp alone… And I asked the Warrior to bravely head into battle at first light!
I hope the unexpected danger that appeared in our city has unified us forever and made us good friends. A city is not made of its walls, but its people.
Troubles of the Trade
Today I got my best BEER out of the cellar to treat to our entire war party: the Warrior, the Farmer and the Healer.
I think the Gods themselves must have brought me this grain. I'm glad I decided for some reason to keep them safe.
Helping Neighbors
The wind brought me several strange pieces of grain last season. Could it be the malt the Brewer needs to make his brew?
In exchange for the meat, I treated the Nomad to a glass of my best BEER, brewed using the ancient recipe of my forefathers.
A Snack with Beer
I'm grateful to the Nomad. All my guests loved the meat he brought back from his journey. I'll make my best snack out of it.
I took the tablet with me to give to Nimiru. I think she'll be able to decipher this mysterious text.
Legends of the Desert
By the way, in the cave where I met the mummy, something strange caught my eye - an ancient tablet. Perhaps it has something to say about the creature that was sealed inside.
It's wonderful that the Lady is finally well again. I'm so glad the people in this city live as if we're all one big family.
Accidents Will Happen
The Lady invited me to visit her and drink ginger tea with dessert. I'm so glad she's not upset with me.
I remember being amazed myself when I first tried this brew. Nobody who came today was disappointed - and compliments mean more to me than gold.
The Birth of Brewing
My cellars are full of barrels of the freshest BEER. I think tonight will be the perfect time for the citizens to gather in my Brewery.
I asked the Miner to collapse the cave he found the mirror in. I also managed to find out from the old scrolls how to reunite the Lady's soul with her body.
City of the Past
The mirror turned out to be one of the cursed objects of Amrun. It's a shame the Brewer didn't mention that sooner. The poor Lady was petrified and lies unconscious as we speak.
I place new supports in Mine. Now city not collapse underground.
Earthly Tremors
Rhinos go crazy! Whole herd of them crash past city and make cracks in Mine!
The Nomad said he has never seen so many warriors before. Their standards block out the sky and their camp stretches out into the horizon!
Enemy at the Gates
My Master, the Nomad came out of the Desert recently and warned us that there is an enemy army several days' march from the city. We must warn the citizens of the looming danger.
I've never tried anything better than BEER. We must include information about the Brewery in the manuscripts and celebrate the day of its construction every year.
The Birth of Brewing
The Brewer hasn't been here long, but he's already won the trust of many citizens. His brew will soon draw people from other cities.
I'm glad the Warrior trusted me. I know I'm just a Brewer and know nothing but how to brew BEER, but that's just where my strength lies.
How the Brewer Saved the City
My plan is almost ready to put into action. I asked the Warrior not to worry and to lift his men's spirits with an inspiring speech.
I was walking past the Beekeeper's house when I heard a scream. I had to roll up my papyrus and help swat the angry insects away from the apiary - I've always said that knowledge is power!
Incidents in the City
My Master, I have brought you new papyrus to write on. Forgive me for my swollen face, I had to save our Beekeeper from a hornet attack last night.
In the morning I took the seal, the mask and the dagger as souvenirs and went outside. My lost camels wandered close by.
Legends of the Desert
I fell breathless myself in that cave then, and drifted into a deep sleep, right until the morning. I was no longer afraid, and I was deathly tired.
Trading with the higher powers can't hurt, in fact it can only strengthen my plan. The Warrior and his army will be on the alert. Tomorrow morning, I'll have everything ready.
How the Brewer Saved the City
I went to see Wise Nimiru. She knows that an overwhelming enemy force approaches the city. I told her the details of my clever plan.
People come and drink, but they complain that there is nowhere to sit as they enjoy their beer. Perhaps it's time to build some seating?
In order to keep up with demand I must build several beer tanks and brewing kettles. Unfortunately, I have nowhere to put them!
As word of the brewery continues to spread, seating remains scarce. Perhaps you could help build a few more tables for my customers?
On hot days, business is slow since no one wants to sit in the sun. What could we do about this?
Business may be good, but the brewery could use some personality. I've heard you're quite handy at decorating…
Customers are clamoring for more styles of beer. Some days it feels impossible to please them! Suppose we had somewhere to store new kinds of yeast…
The new flavors of beer I invented have brought people from the neighboring cities to sample them! However, I need more seating to accommodate everyone. What do we do?
The cellar you dug out is perfect! It's nice and cool, and will keep the beer from spoiling in the hot desert sun.
This should certainly help! Many of the seats are already spoken for by my regulars.
Ah, yes… this new addition will be the perfect place to house my beer tanks!
