In the heat of battle, it's important you're able to distinguish between friend and foe.
You're no longer in danger. The poison wasn't lethal. The visions you've experienced were hallucinations.
Daydream
What's the matter? Stung by a scorpion? Calm down! I'll help you!
Good people taught me this recipe. Wait a bit, let it get cold! It tastes better that way.
Festive Meal
We just need to bake it and the meal is ready!
Later, when I have more sketches, I can put them into an album. That's a great idea!
Portfolio
The master was glad to know that I took up painting. What's so funny? By the way, he said it would be better to do the sketches on papyrus, not in my mind.
You'll make an excellent camel driver. Will you go with me? No. You're needed here.
Searching for the Master
The bigger the caravan, the harder it is to manage it.
I wish this guilty feeling in my stomach would subside. The city has been shaken, but sometimes tragedy can bring people together.
The toys worked out better than I could have hoped. The children are occupied, which means I can give the Potter my full attention.
Preparing for a Date
Child's Play
I've run out of things to keep my mind occupied, and now all I can do is pace the Sepat's hallways. Why am I so nervous about Potter's visit?
How can I hope to entertain the potter with all these children around?
I've wanted a personal slave for a long time. And here's my chance. A familiar slave trader has offered six slaves for the price of one! How can I resist this offer?
Hiring a Slave
Wow! I look nice! Hmm, what do you think? Oh, stop flattering me! Enough… time to leave. I'll tell you about it later…
Excellent! We've assembled our first collection!
First Harvest
Let us gather the fruit in baskets. Our people must nourish their bodies if we hope their spirits to remain high.
The weapon is ready! Beware, pathetic servants of Menes! You're in for it now!
Ra Totem
We have restored one of the mightiest totems of all! Let's get our hands on the sacred weapon!
The weapon is ready for battle! Onwards! Let our enemies tremble in fear!
Anhur Totem
When I see the fiery chariot rush at the enemy, it makes my heart soar! Quickly, let's equip our army and head into battle!
The trade is done! With the help of this ancient weaponry, our army will achieve victory even in the toughest battle! The main thing is not to forget to use it when you need to!
The Power of Totems
The ancients' weaponry will help us achieve victory after victory! Let's make sure that we always have it in supply!
During the last rain my roof was almost washed away! We have to protect the honey at all costs. Can you help me build a sturdier roof?
It seems I spoke too soon… the last sand storm nearly blew down the apiary's walls! They need replaced with something stronger.
I could use some new hives for the bees. Right now I have several colonies inside, which makes getting dressed each morning an adventure!
The desert sand really does a number on the houses in the city. My walls are worn and in need of repair. Think you and your crafting friends could give me a hand?
The Farmer is tired of getting stung and suggested I plant some flowering trees around the apiary. Grab a shovel and give me a hand, will you?
We now have a surplus of honey and Nimiru has encouraged me to sell it to the citizens. She also suggested I hang some sort of sign on the apiary. Any ideas?
Not only has my honey become popular across the city, but my fresh fruit as well! If I just had a cool place to store it, the fruit would last longer…
Wonderful! Now I can accommodate even more bee colonies!
This is perfect! Now, the honey will be safe from the elements.
Thank goodness you're friends with the Potter. These new walls will protect the city's honey reserves from dust, wind and sand!
Not only are the bees comfortable in their new hives, but I can get dressed without fear of getting stung!
You did it! The apiary feels as secure as a fortress!
Everyone wins! Now the Farmer will get fewer stings, and the bees don't have to fly as far for pollen.
Wonderful! One look at the sign and no one will be confused about what we're selling here!
You're always so helpful! This cellar will provide the perfect store room for my fruit!
Even More Hives
My bees are polinating the field, but more bees means more crops! Think we can make room for some new hives?
You built the hut! Great! Let me show what's next.
Roof Over Your Head
Stocking building materials isn't hard. I can also make nice clayware. I'll start as soon as I fix my old potter's wheel.
Thanks for your help with the garlands! Sorry|I doubted you. I've known many lucky men in my life and many were awful snobs. I'm glad that you're not that kind of man.
Lavish Feast
The preparations for the feast are under way. Someone asked me to make flower garlands to decorate the village. This is not a job for one person, but everyone is busy… What? You'll help? Thank you!
Праздник кочевников
Ура, вот наш победитель! Ты собрал больше всех монет! Поздравляю, ты действительно самый ловкий!
Сегодня праздник кочевой звезды, участвуй в древнем состязании кочевников - добудь больше всех монет.
What a delicious roast! Now everyone will know that I'm more than just an excellent hunter: I'm also a skilled chef!
Worthy Hunter
We're back with a nice load! Lets make roast hare for the neighbors, okay? We'll need vegetables for that.
I'll spend this money on everything we need for the journey. A good bag, for example, so we have something to keep our food in.
I don't have much gold to my name, but I'm happy to donate what I can to the cause.
A Worthy Hunter
Saving Up
We'll have to spend several days in the desert before we get on the beast's trail. We need to make sure we buy all the equipment we'll need!
Hide whatever gold you may have! We may need it to purchase building supplies if we hope to return our city to its former glory.
Well, you know how to get out of trouble. It's a valuable skill. You're like my father in this respect…
Knock, knock!
Uh oh! Ankabut attacked the nomad! What are we going to do now? How can we get there?

I don't believe it! I haven't shot a hare and you've got a dozen! There's got to be something wrong with my bow. Listen friend, please don't tell anyone about my failure. Otherwise, they'll laugh at me!
Lavish Feast
A few days ago, I saw hares in the valley. They're great this time of the year as they're well-fed and slower. So we won't have to run after them much, and the roast will be amazing!
A couple days ago I saw desert hares in the valley, so we're off to bag them now. At this time of year they're especially well-fed and lazy, so we won't have to do too much running!
Praise the gods! You are a true friend. How could I be so silly to be late with my debt to Ankabut's priests? I've become their foe. Besides, I let you down…
Warning! Warning!
Help! Help! This beast is going to make a meal out of me!
Here it is! The very flower we need! My father was wounded badly in the last battle. I hope that the potion made with this plant helps him get better. Thank you for your help! You are very kind.
It's the most delicate flower I've ever seen. Thank you for bringing it to me. But will the Lady like it?
Remedy for the Chief's Disease
Straight to the Heart
A rare flower grows in the valley to the south of the village. It's used to make healing potions. If you bring it to me, I'll tell you about its properties and show how to use it.
Jasmine is beautiful, but I recalled a story about a rare flower that grows outside the city that feels like silk! Do you know it?
Here's the kettle. Great! Well, the sun is setting… so let's rest up. We'll finish preparing for the feast tomorrow morning.
Let us fill this kettle with soup and begin the feast of Ptah.
Lavish Feast
We shall hold a feast to honor Ptah, the god of architecture, and seek his blessing. Help me find a kettle and so we can get started at once.
You found a ladle! It's perfect! The food is ready, and all that's left to do is eat and honor Ptah.
Lavish Feast
It's going to be a wonderful day! I can't wait for everyone to try our scrumptious roast… Oh, what will we use to serve the food?
This soup should warm the souls of our citizens. We need a way to pour it into bowls. I don't want to waste a drop!
You found it! That's the basket I was thinking of.
First Harvest
The first harvest may be small victory, Farmer, but we will cherish each one. There's a basket in my hut we can use to collect the fruit.
All right! Now we have a cultivation tool! What do you call it? Hoe? Yes, that's it.
These are just small tricks for a rich harvest. I heard it was Menes that lead the charge against out city. Did you see him with your own eyes?
Art of Farming
The elders say that people used to cultivate the land and grow fruit. We need tools to restore this old practice.
We'll need tools to revive the ancient art of agriculture.
We must ensure the plants can breathe by loosening the soil after watering.
This horn sounds almost as loud as the pharaoh's horn! It was a wonderful idea, wasn't it? Restoring old traditions inspires people and reminds them of the glorious days of a prosperous Egypt.
Lavish Feast
In the old days, the pharaoh's servants went to the main city square. They'd blow a special horn to invite people to the festival. We can restore this tradition and use a hunting horn.
We're ready. And, yes, you're going with me. No arguments.
Lavish Feast
It's time to think about what to have for dinner. I'm sure the roast here will be a favorite. It's time to remind the people of the tribe that I'm a good hunter.
You've done it quickly! With this amulet, we shouldn't be afraid of the High Priest's magic.
This amulet will protect you while I venture to the neighboring cities to warn them about our enemies!
Protection
Edge of the Earth
We need to find a protective amulet. It will help us when we meet the High Priest of Amrun.
Amrun's servant, Menes, seems to become more powerful each day. I'll retrieve an amulet to protect us from the high priest's dark magic.
My father gave this blade to me years ago. I hoped I'd never have to use it.
Path of the Warrior
We must cleanse our warriors of Amrun's mist. Only fight if we must! Here, take my father's sword in case you need protection.
Excellent! I was right! You are the one the prophesy speaks of. With your help, we will restore the city and defeat Amrun!
First Trial
Hunting and gathering used to be a profitable occupation. It's time to breathe new life into this old trade.
I thought this hut would be big enough for me, but now it's feeling crowded. It's time to think about expansion.
This hut may look nice, but it won't withstand a powerful sand storm. We must rebuild it larger and stronger!
Many people in the city are still homeless. I wish I could offer them a bed, but I have no extra rooms.
The Nile is so close and yet it feels so far. My home should take advantage of its access to the great river.
While our city has attracted many good people, some have questionable intentions. I should make my home more secure.
Nimiru says my house is nice, but it lacks personality. Perhaps some decorations are in order!
With many structures being rebuilt across the city, Nimiru has asked that I add a something unique to make my home easier to find.
Get 24 stars in the hut and then upgrade it.
Done! I decided that minor repairs wouldn't be enough, so I made the living area larger. It's good that we have useful building materials.
Good work! This hut looks more durable than the last, and our gold reserves will benefit as well.
Ah, yes, a little more elbow room is always a good thing!
Excellent! Now I won't wake in fear each time the wind howls through the city at night.
The hut is now more spacious, and I have room for those citizens in need of a safe place to sleep.
This dock will allow me to launch a boat, fish, just enjoy the city's beautiful sunsets.
This fence may not stop Amrun or his followers, but at least it will deter any thieves.
Nomads are typically minimalists, but I'll admit it's nice to add some color to the landscape.
The house may be larger now, but it's still humble. No need to live in excess, right?
Enemy Plot
Building A Better Hut
While I was hunting, someone broke into my house and smashed everything! Maybe Menes sent his servants? What is he up to?
Upgrading the hut will unlock new levels and let us collect gold even faster. That's sure to help in our restoration efforts!
Thanks to the sketches we found at the factory, we were able to learn what Bastet's idol looked like before Amrun destroyed it. We were finally able to restore it!
Symbols of the Gods
The pedestal we found among the ruins turned out to be the base for Bastet's idol. We have to rebuild it anew to gain the goddess's ear.
The Sepat is a refuge for children, and the Lady is almost like a mother to them. Isis is similarly the mother of all people, which is why the throne was hidden here.
Symbols of the Gods
Secret symbols that once belonged to the gods are the key to regaining their ear. Isis's throne might be hidden in the Sepat.
I spent the entire night at the hut studying old maps, and managed to figure out where the dagger was hidden. Anubis used it to administer justice when he came down to earth.
Symbols of the Gods
We must find the dagger of the merciless Anubis. I know the desert better than anyone. It is in the places where the lions prowl that the temples to this god were built.
Nimiru took the fruit I gathered to the river. After dipping them in the water and saying a few words, they all turned into precious stones…
Symbols of the Gods
I know how to find one more symbol of the gods! Hapi was the god of the harvest and the flooding of the Nile. All that is required to bring him into this world is to do what I do best!
Clay figurines are powerless without magic, so Nimiru has our gratitude for turning our work into a real symbol!
Symbols of the Gods
Once upon a time, Khnum created man on his potter's wheel. Let's fashion a man-like figurine to be the secret symbol of this god.
The gate is gaining power! The gate key will help us free the gods!
Symbols of the Gods
We were able to collect five divine symbols thanks to the hard work and responsibility of the citizens. I sense the distinct call of the gate…
The people must remember the goddess Bastet. To make sure they do, we'll hold a celebration in her honor! I have some excellent wine in the cellar for just such an occasion.
Bastet is the goddess of joy and would love for us to hold a celebration in her honor. Let's make her smile with our joy!
Essence of Bastet
It's time to get the wine from the cellar. It was being saved for a special occasion, and they say there will be a celebration in the city today!
Menes has placed a curse on the city! But this should not stop us. Let us trist Nimiru's magic and continue to prepare for the celebration.
The celebration should feature all the attributes embodying the qualities of the goddess. Flowers are the symbol of her beauty!
Essence of Bastet
Some delicate orchids grow not far from my hut. They would doubtless add color to the holiday Nimiru is holding in honor of the goddess Bastet. Let's pick a bouquet of them!
A wooden duck symbolizes the comfort of home. One of our pupils has one that I found, and I think it would be perfect!
Essence of Bastet
The goddess Bastet is the keeper of the hearth. What could we bring to the celebration that would emphasize that divine quality of hers?
The children cut a bunch of bright, rainbow-colored ribbons from cloth and decorated the Sepat with them! They will look beautiful streaming above the heads of our guests.
Essence of Bastet
I decided to make something embodying the joy of the goddess Bastet by asking my pupils for help. A little more time and everything will be ready!
I hope my fields will be even more fertile with the return of Bastet!
Essence of Bastet
The goddess Bastet also helped those who work the earth. I will bring a bundle of wheat to the celebration.
I think Bastet was happy with the celebration. After the festivities came to a close, a cat showed up at the Sepat. I am sure that was the goddess's way of blessing us.
Essence of Bastet
The citizens turned out to be so helpful, supporting me as I threw the celebration in honor of Bastet. Look how much fun everyone is having and how they're praising the goddess!
The cat told us that Bastet came to our world from the stars… That happened early in the morning, when the grass and tree leaves were still covered in dew.
Bastet's Birth
A cat appeared to us during the festivities. It settled into the chair we prepared for the goddess and suddenly spoke in a human voice!
I learned from the cat's story that Bastet did not originally have a material body. The goddess liked the feeling of rose petals and decided her skin would be just as silky.
Bastet's Birth
It turns out that in those distant times, when the gods came down from the stars, everything in these lands was in full bloom. How sad that it's all turned to sand!
Bastet touched a papyrus stalk, creating papyrus and rods with which to write. Later the gods taught people to do the same, which is how our ancestors learned how to write.
Bastet's Birth
Bastet decided to resort to the magic of words in order to create a body for herself. In those days, people in our world did not yet know how to talk.
Bastet knew she needed special ink for the first words written in our world, and so she trapped some moonlight in a crystal flask.
Bastet's Birth
There was no verbal magic in our world before the gods appeared. They brought it with them, first speaking themselves and later deciding to inscribe the first symbols.
When Bastet came across the first cat on earth, she was stunned by the animal's beauty. The goddess uttered her incantation, rang a silver bell, and took on her earthly form.
Bastet's Birth
The cat that came to the celebration told us quite the fascinating story. It turns out Bastet wrote her incantation for giving bodies to gods on papyrus with moonlight.
The ancients, as we now call them, traveled between worlds on their sky castles. Those who saw them passed the story down to their children.
Bastet's Birth
The cat spoke to us, saying that those of the gods who decided to stay in our world took on earthly bodies. However, there were also some who did not wish to stay.
We have to decorate Bastet's idol with special attributes by the time she returns. The gods and pharaohs always carry things that emphasize their qualities: Bastet, for example, had a special crown.
Bastet's Idol
The celebration in honor of Bastet was a success! The people have learned much about the goddess, which will give her the strength to return. Let's get ready to welcome her!
The traders have quite the stock of goods, as they bring them from the four corners of the world. It's a good thing they had that beautiful emerald necklace.
Bastet's Idol
I know quite a few traders who wander the desert. We could buy a special necklace for Bastet's idol from them.
I think the belt we made will fit the goddess's form perfectly. I am sure this will make a fine decoration for the idol!
Bastet's Idol
We could make a gorgeous silk belt to emphasize the divine greatness of Bastet's idol. This will take quite some time, but the children will help us.
So many fruits and vegetables fit in the new basket! I'll take it to the goddess's idol so she remembers me.
Bastet's Idol
Bastet, the goddess of fertility, will love our gifts and offerings from the harvest. May she know who works tirelessly in this city.
The nomad introduced me to some trader friends of his who are staying at the Sepat for a few days. These lovely people sold me a beautiful golden sistrum.
Bastet's Idol
The goddess Bastet was welcomed with a special musical instrument called a sistrum. It would be great to find one!
Bastet in her earthly form is about to appear in our world. She will assume her power and help us fight the ruthless Amrun!
Bastet's Idol
Everything is ready for the return of the goddess to this world! All that remains is one small detail: the scepter of Bastet, which holds her power.
Possesses magical power. Use it to get more crystals at the same price in the shop!
Super Crystal
The ancestors had powerful weapons. What could've happened to destroy such a mighty civilization? It must've involved that dark magic and Amrun.
Rescue Plan
While there's time, we need to think about a weapon. Let's use the power of the ancient totems to get the ancestors' weapon.
We're now ready for the attack. Whatever Menes does, I'll fight to the death to protect my people and family!
Weapons Stockpile
Menes will be furious when he finds out that Nimiru is not in the temple. We must prepare for an attack on the village. We need weapons and protection.
The Master made me an excellent canopy! Now I can put spices under it. They can be so sensitive to the sun's rays.
The Bloom of Trade
The Egyptian sun is merciless to buyers and sellers alike. If only I had a canopy over my stall, the sun wouldn't interfere with my trading. I'll ask the Master to help me.
It seems I'm in luck! There truly have been fewer incidents of theft. I sold my grain at the market for a very good price, and now I have a new cart and a pair of young oxen!
Nothing Ventured, Nothing Gained

Now that the Chief has proclaimed that thievery will be punished with a public whipping, the thieves should lie low. My granary is full of grain which isn't meant for long-term storage. If I don't sell it soon, it'll go bad. I'll have to risk it.
I bought a number of different items for gold and I'm very pleased with their quality! I particularly liked the Libyan crockery made from fine glass and decorated with fantastic western patterns.
A Sale
Did you hear? There's a sale at the bazaar! That means everything is cheaper! Maybe I'll go buy something right now. They say a crowd has gathered around the Tradeswoman's stand!
These supplies should be enough to cross the desert. Once I'm across, I'll buy everything I need for the return journey.
A Dangerous Journey
Crossing the desert is always dangerous. This time it'll be doubly so, since my path lies far from trade routes and oases. I'll need to prepare even more carefully than usual.
There are some good people in the world! As soon as the citizens found out about our bad luck, crowds of people came to my hut, bringing whatever they could to help us.
Unexpected Help
Unless I get a new caravan together within a few days, then the tradeswoman's daughter, little Sheriti, will die. But where can I find so many resources and so much gold..?
Poor thing! She's gotten so thin from this ordeal. I hope she starts recovering quickly after she takes this medicine!
Medicine for Sheriti
The Nomad brought the medicine! The healer who gave him the remedy said we should add ground chalk stone to it for the best results.

You can't judge a book by its cover. Take onions, for example. They're bitter to the taste and their smell makes you cry… What could be good about them? But in fact, they're some of the healthiest vegetables around!
Bitter, But Healthy!
It's time for the onion harvest! This healthy vegetable is in high regard among the citizens. Everyone knows that if you eat a lot of onions, you'll never get sick!
The Nomad told me parrots love melon! I bought the most aromatic melon at the market. I hope it's to my feathered friend's taste!
A Talking Bird
To catch the bird, I'll need a lure… I wonder what parrots eat.

In the old days, I couldn't have imagined making so much profit! Sheriti and I live in an old hovel at the edge of the Sepat. We don't even have any chairs. This is enough money to buy furniture and move to a better home! What fortune!
Money Likes to be Counted
We've been selling goods at the market for 12 moons already. It's time to take stock and figure out how much we've earned.

They're gone! Someone took my fine grey granite stones! I spent all morning hewing them in the Mine! Hey, who's that? Stop!! I'll catch you, make no mistake!!! But what if I get lost in the labyrinth? I think I'd better get back to the surface and call for help.
Thieves in the City
This time I'll take the wheelbarrow to help me carry the stones out, and I'd better hurry - I thought I saw some kind of shadow in the Mine… I hope no one steals my stones!

We might as well talk to a wall. We offered him freedom and a reward if he gives up the other members of the band, but it was all in vain. We can't resort to torture, it's against our rules. We'll just have to find another way to catch the criminals.
Thieves in the City
We caught one of the members of the thieves' band. But that's only the beginning. Now we need to make this man talk. We need to find out where his allies are hiding.

I love going to the bazaar with my scales - there are tricksters aplenty there, but with my own device for measuring weight, I can always be sure I'm not being ripped off. I can't wait to brew the divine beverage I tried in my dream!
Ale, Wonderful Ale!

I've been journeying in my dreams again! I was in the Brewery and saw my ancestors brewing a special sort of beer, which they called ALE! Its taste was divine! I must go to the market right away and buy the ingredients I need for it!

We caught the evildoers! It turns out they had an entire storehouse underground where they kept all their ill-gotten gains. And in one of the neighboring caverns, we found a cache containing gold bars!
The Bandits' Lair

The Nomad told me of a man he followed through the city. We gathered some people together to search the underground tunnels. If the Nomad is right, we'll find the bandits' lair and catch them unawares!
Coins aren't just a unit of exchange. They're the symbols of an entire state.
Witnesses of History
When I look at these coins, I think of the thousands of people who have held them. Coins are silent witnesses of human history, and each of them has its own unique story.
A trade ship sailed into our harbor and I traded the sloth for a few bales of sheep's wool. I'll give the wool to my wife so she can make some blankets out of it.
A Profitable Trade
The monster I caught in the field is called a SLOTH. The Nomad told me I can keep it as a souvenir. What nonsense! What do I need this beast for? It'll eat me out of house and home!

Family is worth more than gold to a child. It's hard for me sometimes, when I think that I might never see my father again. When I paint, my heart feels lighter. Maybe that's why the Gods invented painting?
School of Art

My dad was a warrior. Mom says he loved us very much. A long time ago, he went out to war and never came back. No one knows if he died or fell into slavery… Sometimes I miss him, and painting helps me through such moments.
I caught the bird! Maybe I can teach it a few more words? Or even an entire verse, like "Delicious honey for not much money"? Great!
A Talking Bird
I cut the melon into pieces and put them on a plate. Now all I have to do is find the bird in the garden and offer it my tasty treat.

What a great idea! Buy two melons and the third is free! Wonderful! What did you say this was called? A SPE-CIAL OFF-ER? This offer helped me sell in a day what might have sat on my stand for another week!
A Special Offer
These melons are going off! If I don't sell them in the next few days, I'll have to throw them out… I have to think of something!
The thieves must have been making a living in the city for some time. They've intimidated the locals so much, they were afraid to tell the authorities about the extortion and regular robberies.
Thieves in the City

This city grows thanks to the labor and solidarity of its citizens. We can forgive those who make mistakes and help those in need, but we can give no quarter those who deliberately leech off of the labor of others! We'll search the entire city and find those thieves!
Miner find tracks in labyrinth… Miner fear to go there alone. Need help.
Thieves in the City
Miner help find thieves! Maybe they hide in Mine?

We searched the city from the Sepat to the river, but didn't find any traces of them… The guards on duty in this part of the city say they didn't see anything suspicious last night… That means we need to take our search in another direction.
Thieves in the City
Thieves in the city? I'll help you catch them! I'll get some people together and we'll comb the western quarter of the settlement. If the thieves are hiding here, they won't get away from us!

Oof! I found some suitable rock and managed to break a few stones off it. This is just what I needed, but the stones are too heavy, and I can't carry them out one at a time. I'll need to go get a wheelbarrow.
Thieves in the City
What a fine morning! Ideal weather for drying papyrus scrolls! I need to head into the Mine and find a few suitable stones to make a press with.

I'd never have thought I could sell my goods so quickly! Nothing was left on my stall by the end of the day! Tomorrow, I'll head to the nomads' camp to buy a new consignment of goods from the merchants.
A Sale
A lot of goods have piled up on my stall, and they'll soon go bad if I don't sell them right away… What am I to do? What's that, my Lord? I need to hold a sale? Hmm, would that really work?
The new caravan is assembled! I can boldly set off on my journey! I can't waste a single moment, otherwise little Sheriti might not survive until I get back!
A New Caravan
The things the people brought will be enough to put a new caravan together. All that remains is to saddle up he camels and set off!
She's coming around! Oh Gods, blessed be the nomad who saved my daughter from death!
Medicine for Sheriti
The medicine is ready! Drink, my daughter, and let the Gods return the strength to your exhausted limbs and fill your eyes with the light of life again!
Mom really liked Zulfia. She likes hard-working and good people, and those are just the qualities Zulfia has. It's great that I have a friend I can look up to!
Thick as Thieves
I love playing with the Farmer's children! Zulfia and I are best friends now and I want to invite her home so she can meet mom.

I doubled the guard on the market square. Apart from that, I've given them ancestral weaponry, which is sure to strike fear into the hearts of thieves. They'll think twice before they commit a crime in our market.
Security First
Many local and foreign merchants come to the Market every day to trade their wares. They bring large sums of money with them… We need to strengthen the guard on the square to protect against thieves.
Ancestral weapons will make the journey a safe one. If we're attacked by bandits or wild beasts on the road, we'll be able to defend ourselves!
A Dangerous Journey
Many dangers threaten a nomad in the desert. At any moment, I could be attacked by a giant scorpion or a cave lion. I need to make sure I have enough defenses.
The market has attracted more vendors, but it feels chaotic. I wish there was some way we could make things more organized…
We must consider expanding the market's footprint. I've had a dozen vendors request space just this week, but I don't have room for them. I'd hate to turn them away…
I've had vendors complain of items being stolen during the night. Is there a way we might make the market more secure?
The market has become one of the city's major gathering areas, but the whole area is congested! How can we make room for more people?
Some new seating would really go a long way in attracting more people to our wonderful market. Do you think you could help with that?
Nimiru said that the market has helped to repair the city's economy. I'd like to put up a sign to celebrate, but I'm no designer. Mind helping me draft some ideas?
I think it's important to bring some more color to the market and celebrate the wide array of people and products we have represented. Do you agree?
The entrance was a great idea! How do you come up with these things?
You figured it out! Now we can group similar items together so customers can easily find what they need!
It's amazing what you can do with a little bit of hard work. More vendors provides more options for the citizens!
Excellent! These walls will surely provide some added security. This is sure to please our dedicated vendors.
Wonderful job! Now customers can spend more time inside the market and hopefully buy more goods!
I can always count on you! The market's new courtyard is almost as comfortable as my own home!
It's perfect! I'm so proud to see our market grow from just a couple stalls to dozens!
The new awnings are wonderful! Not only do they brighten the market, but they provide our vendors with shade from the unforgiving desert sun.
Market Pavement
Unfortunately, many citizens don't realize the city market has been restored. Maybe there's something we could do to make it more obvious?
This tramp must be hungry all the time, and few can resist the aroma of the Lady's home- made pie! Let's put the pie down outside the mine and wait.
Caveman

Nimiru spoke to me of strange voices which seemed to come from the caves. That tramp I saw in the caves a couple of days ago must know something about them. But how can we lure him out and talk to him?
I made some food supplies. I'll give them to the caveman every day until he stops being afraid of me. If we make friends, he can help us in our search.
Miner

We've already spent many moons exploring the labyrinth, but we didn't find anything apart from more and more new tunnels leading into the depths of the earth. Will our search truly remain fruitless…? I think I know someone who can help us.
Ugh, I baked so many pies today! I'll wrap them in linen and lower them into the cellar so they don't lose their freshness and aroma before the celebration starts.
The Valley Celebration
The Valley Celebration will soon begin in the city. On this day, statues of the great gods will be carried onto the city square, and there'll be a rich feast at night, which I'm preparing now.
Work on building the Mine is going at full steam. The Potter was very hungry and was grateful for the hearty dinner I made for him.
Dinner for the Potter
The Potter has been working on building the Mine all day. He must be tired and hungry. I'll take him dinner, and at the same time take a look at how things are going on the building site.
Making hieroglyphs from gold is a demanding and laborious task requiring a special talent. One uneven line can corrupt the meaning of the entire message, so there can't be any mistakes.
The Divine Message
The message must be written in golden letters. That means I'll need to find some gold to smelt into hieroglyphs.
I got a good price for those fish! I'll spend the money on new clothes for the kids.
Fishing
We caught a lot of fish. Now we can sell them at the market and buy the kids some new clothes.

I sold the stone as soon as I got to the market! I wanted to buy a new hammock and build a pool in the garden with the money, but I decided to give the money to the Farmer instead - he needs it more now! I hope I can still make it to the celebration of his daughter's birth!
A Gift for a Friend

On the way to the Sepat, I met the Farmer. He told me his wife just gave birth to a daughter, and invited me to celebrate the occasion. The Farmer is my friend, but I can't go visit him now - I need to sell this stone on the market as soon as I can.

I spent all night studying the black stone in the workshop, but my attempts bore no fruit. Then an accident came to my aid: one of the stones fell into the burning stove, and it turns out this stuff burns wonderfully! Let's call it COAL!
The Black Stone's Properties
I want to take some samples of the black stone and send them to the workshop. I can study it there and find out how we can make use of it.

I made a deal with the chiefs of the neighboring clans. If we're attacked, their warriors will be on our side. Using these materials, we'll strengthen our city walls. In the case of a siege, this will help us survive until reinforcements arrive.
In Defense of the City

Our clan chief led an army of thousands to free the lands of the Warrior from foreign invaders. We now have only a few military units and we need to think hard about how to defend the city if it gets attacked.
Our craftsmen make the finest arrows I've ever seen. I trust my neighbors and I'm sure these weapons will never be used against us.
In Defense of the City
In exchange for military aid, the chiefs of the neighboring clans have asked us to make weapons for them. I think this is fair, and I'm willing to labor to gather all the materials we need.
Such fine wall! Miner like his work.
Miner Want Friend
Nomad build house. Miner help Nomad.
It took several days for us to get the soil blocking the cave passages out from under the ground. But as it turned out, they were dead ends anyway, leading nowhere.
Clearing Cave-ins
Some of the passages in the labyrinth are caved in. If we want to go deeper, we'll need to clear the collapsed passages.
I'll need to wear this mask for several days, so the repairs will have to be delayed. But the important thing is that I'm safe now!
Frustrated Repairs
I haven't been outside for many days, and now daylight hurts my eyes. I'll have to wear a mask to protect my eyes from the sun until they get used to light again.
The truth is always simple, oh Lord. Only the hollow- hearted seek ways to tangle their untruths in it and thus hide them from the people's eyes.
The Divine Message
A stone rose will serve as a symbol of the great god Ptah's wisdom and immutable truth. We'll fashion an altar for the sacred papyrus and decorate it with these divine flowers cut from stone.
It can't be! It seems I've found some stone discs with the coded recipe for porcelain! If we can decipher it, I can learn how to make crockery worthy of the table of the Pharaoh himself!
City of Sacred Beings

The ancient scrolls claim that the citizens of the City of Sacred Beings were skillful masters. They made the finest crockery from an unknown material called POR-CE-LAIN. Maybe we can uncover the secrets of its making?

There it is! A giant blue crystal, a shard of which I carry in my staff! The ancient scrolls say it has many magical properties. The Miner says it hasn't always been so big - it's growing. It was thanks to the crystal that I heard the Miner's voice.
The Secret of the Blue Crystal

We found many magical items with diverse properties in the underground city, but we still didn't find what we came for - the source connecting the Blue Crystal in my staff with the underground depths.
Ah, how wonderful! After taking a bath, I feel as if reborn! Now I'm ready for the celebration!
The Valley Celebration
I can't wait to get into my warm bath! All that remains is to heat the water and add a little almond oil to properly moisturize my skin.
Miner invite friends to caves. Friends see where Miner lives. They like Place of Blue Stone!
Miner Want Friend
Friends invite Miner to drink tea and rest in little house. Miner very glad!
Owl hunt at night. Soon no bad animals left in field! Farmer will be glad!
Helping the Farmer
Moles and mice harm Farmer. Miner teach owl and give to Farmer. It catch bad animals.

I barely slept at all! I kept hearing strange voices all night, like the mutterings of a madman. It seemed to me they were coming from the Sepat, but who could be making such strange noises? I'd better ask the Lady…
The Secret of the Blue Crystal
The Potter and I spent all day looking for a good place to build a mine. It's already well past midnight. I'm very tired and want to sleep.
The potter and I have spent all day in the mine, and it's already well past midnight. I'm exhausted!
We'd traveled most of the path without incident when we suddenly encountered a chasm we couldn't cross without special equipment. We'll have to head back to the surface and get everything we need.
In Search of the Blue Crystal

The path to the mysterious Place of the Blue Stone shown on the map goes through a bunch of complicated winding tunnels. This journey will be long and dangerous. The Potter, Nomad and Farmer will come with us. We'll set off tomorrow at dawn.

The children just loved our fishing trip! We met the Miner on the riverbank. He turned out to be an old hand in catching fish! With his help, we caught a bucket full of small fish and decided to make a fish soup.
Fishing
What a wonderful day! I've been promising my children I'd go fishing with them for a long time. The time has come to fulfill that promise. Hey, look! We got our first bite!
I'm pleased with the results! If it has to, our little army can put up a worthy fight and be victorious, even if the enemy outnumbers us two to one.
In Defense of the City
Our military units have to be well organized. That's why I want to hold some training battles and test our warriors' fighting abilities.
Ugh, I'm so tired! I still have to pour the honey into pots and put it all in the cellar.
Honey Harvest
Oh my! The time has come for the honey harvest and I need to hurry! If I don't get started now, the honey could set hard and then I'll never get it out of the comb.
Now we can rest easy. These weapon supplies should last us even through a long- term siege on the city.
In Defense of the City
Weapons given to us by the gods possess magical strength, but their number is limited, and only the worthiest of our warriors can use them in battle.
Thank you! This will definitely speed up the process.
New Tunnels
The Potter greatly underestimated the amount of rich materials we would find underground. I'll need more room in which to sort them.
Thank you for the new mat! I will sit on it at the tomb. The miner has promised to protect me.
The Next World
To pierce the veil beyond the world of the living, I will have to fall into a deep sleep. I must organize a comfortable place and find a reliable guard.

The Court of Osiris is in session! The feather of the goddess of truth, Maat, symbolizes divine truth and justice. It sits on the scales as a counterweight to the human heart and is the measure of its good deeds.
The Next World

It is believed that after death, the soul of the deceased is sent to the Hall of Two Truths. Osiris himself sits on the throne there, and by his side stand Nephthys and Isis. Will I see them in my dream?
I see giant cobra crawl toward tomb. I scare and chase, but it not afraid until I use power of totem.
The Next World
I calmly protect Nimiru at tomb. I have honor to receive such task. Nobody dare attack lady while I is here. But I feel worried…
I found a few ancient scrolls and discovered that Amrun used the servants of the Shadow in the next world, and stole Osiris's symbol of power!
The Next World
Nimiru set off to follow the soul of the deceased so that she might confirm the Gods' return. But if they have returned, why do we have no link to them?
This is a statuette of the god Khnum. It was his mask that the potter wore during the celebration. Let this god bless him in his work!
Sand Lizard
My husband is a man of true courage. He protected the children from the giant lizard and caught the thief that stole my jewelry. Without a doubt, he is worthy of a reward!
I heard a rustle and a whisper at one of the neighborhood warehouses. When I crept inside, I saw the band of thieves. They were very quick, and I wasn't able to catch any of them.
Setting Up Shop
There are rumors that thieves have settled in the city again. They say they have some sort of hideout and band together there at night. We must search the neighborhood.
I am sure that the soul of the nomads' leader will pass the trial and the Cup of Oblivion will pass him by. But it is all in the hands of the Gods.
The Next World
During the court in the next world, the Gods ask questions to the deceased and listen to the answers. If they were untruthful in life, the gods let the soul drink from the Cup of Oblivion…
The nomads' leader was a noble warrior. He passed the trial with honor and Osiris granted him eternal life!
A New Threat
The Gods truly have returned! But we still have much to do before we can gain their support in the fight against Menes and Amrun.
I have made a stencil of protective symbols. We will print them on the tomb of the deceased, so that nobody will ever find their way inside.
The Next World
Nimiru told me of her adventures beyond the world of the living. She brought good tidings of the Gods and their holy court.
The thief broke one of the bottles of cedar oil, so I was able to follow him by the oily trail. I managed to catch the young man at the port while he was hiding his ill-gotten gains in a warehouse.
Lurking Dangers
A huge cargo of cedar oil has been stolen from a visiting merchant. Even the smallest bottle of it is worth a vast amount of money…
The man turned out to be a thief! I screamed, trying to call for help. The thief ran off, but dropped a small jar on the ground. Mama told me there was some special make-up powder in it.
Lurking Dangers
There's a strange man walking around the market. I didn't like the look of him as soon as I saw him, and I want to follow him… Will you come with me?
Someone's been digging in my plots! And that someone hid a golden statuette among the corn – it must have been stolen.
Lurking Dangers
During the night, I heard a rustling in my field. Maybe some kind of beast has found its way onto my land?
We found several precious stones. Children were playing with them in the dust. They said the stones fell out of the bag of someone in black clothes…
Lurking Dangers
The diggers from a neighboring village sent us precious gifts. But the workers didn't even have time to unload them before they were stolen! We need to go in hot pursuit of the thieves!
Our efforts bore fruit! Our manhunt took is through the whole city, and we caught around ten men. They all turned out to be thieves from the same band.
Lurking Dangers
We'll gather up a group of reliable men to set up a manhunt against the thieves. Too many things have been stolen of late. It's time to put a stop to it!
We managed to open the Shadow's tomb! As it turns out, the pot it was kept in has been broken. And the cave itself was packed with all kinds of treasure.
Lurking Dangers
Somehow, the Shadow may have freed itself from its tomb. We need to get some weapons and check if this is so.
The smell of musk led to the potter's house, but it turned out that the potter was using the musk to cover the smell of the glue he adds to his solution for making bricks.
Lurking Dangers
The Shadow's tomb is filled with the persistent odor of musk. I think we can use this to figure out where our enemy is hiding, or at least find those who are hiding our enemy.
The Shadow and several of its servants set up a trap in my room. I appealed to the totem for aid, and managed to chase off my opponents.
Lurking Dangers
Let's keep searching for the Shadow! We should check the barracks this time. I thought I smelled musk in my room…
A few of our ancestors' remedies and the healing power of Nile clay will help restore his strength. Now I must think about how the Shadow managed to escape from its prison.
Lurking Dangers
Shadow has returned to the city. It broke free of its tomb and attacked the warrior. He remained alive, but is gravely wounded. He needs my help.
These healing oils and salves can bring back a woman's youth and beauty. Soon all the beauties in the city will flock here to buy them!
Lurking Dangers
An unusual merchant has arrived in the city from distant lands. I didn't get a good look at his face, but I recall that he smelled strongly of musk…
What a find the mariner is for our city. He is a skilled sailor, an excellent fisherman, and so good with his hands! Check out the darts he made!
Hunting Season
We'll need a hunting weapon, and I prefer darts. The mariner makes fishing nets, metal hooks, and metal tips in his spare time. Let's drop by.
What a nice carved mask. My nomadic tribe had a custom of wearing masks that looked like a beast that hunted nearby. If you do that, the gods give you its abilities.
Hunting Season
We need to head over to the market and buy a dog-shaped ritual mask from the mask seller. We'll need one for our hunt.
What a gorgeous Ibizan Hound! What a find! Hunting dogs don't get any better than this one. I've heard that in ancient times only the rulers had them.
Hunting Season
We're lucky so many different dog breeds have been brought to the market from the neighboring lands. I think we'll be able to find something unusual today.
It's so nice of you to find the time and stop into my brewery! I'm always happy to see you, but you always have so much to do. I only ever drink my best beer in your honor!
Hunting Season
I heard you and the nomad are heading off to hunt tomorrow morning? Tonight please visit my modest abode to relax for a bit.
I'm thrilled I was able to save a little bunny and keep him from getting made into a pie by the baker. I will nurse him back to health and release him to find his mother.
Hunting Season
I heard you and the nomad brought back a bunch of hares from your hunt and the baker bought them all. But one of them is hurt - could I take him?
My ostrich got scared and ran off into the Sepat, frightening all the kids there. I got there just in time to keep the warrior's troops from killing that stupid bird.
Hunting Season
The nomad caught a few ostriches for me while hunting, since I wanted to start an ostrich farm next to the field. But one of them ran off and I don't know where to find it!
Thanks! That is plenty of money for me. I appreciate you paying attention to my trusted warriors. They will serve you and the city with honor.
Warrior's Soul
I need a little gold for my short trip. I have to equip a team of recruits and buy everything else as well.
My old travel bag. I crossed the entire desert to and fro with it, and I only use it to keep what I absolutely need for survival. Never anything personal
Warrior's Soul
My troops are getting ready for the trip, so I think I'll head home. I need to get packed.
A powerful dog like this one will be a true friend for me. This trip will be useful for it too. I'll have to thank the Tradeswoman for getting it later.
Warrior's Soul
I heard you can now buy dogs at the market. I hope I can find a good one for myself. I wouldn't mind taking a good friend with me for the road.

Mistress Nimiru always takes care of everyone in this city, from the least to the greatest. She gave me a talisman to protect me on my way. I don't really believe in that kind of thing, but it was nice of her to do so.
Warrior's Soul
Nimiru asked me to stop by before my trip to say goodbye. Now would be a great time for that. I can drop by to ask the mariner to sharpen my sword on the way.

It's the perfect time to burn some firewood on the fields to fertilize the earth, and there was just enough. I had to ask the potter for help, and he just happened to have a little left over after building the Sepat.
Everyday Affairs
I have to keep an eye on my helpers: all the wood they stacked against the house walls collapsed. There isn't even enough as it is, so I'll have to find some more.
Maybe the nomad is a bum wandering the deserts because he has nothing better to do, but his trick with the mask was well done. Tomorrow I'll wear it while plowing, and maybe the gods will help me.
Everyday Affairs
The nomad told me about ritual animal masks. The nomadic peoples used them to have success in everything they did. He promised to get me one.
My father was very happy with his new friend. I don't often see him smile like that. The Tradeswoman hammered out a deal with buyers from far lands to bring us dogs to sell.
Pets
The people in our city have started getting pets. I wouldn't mind buying a good dog for my father. I think I'll get that done while he's training the troops in place of the warrior.
The old trader gave me his smartest dog! He said all dogs from this breed have sworn never to bark. Once they heard the most important human secret of all, and so they don't want to give it away.
Pets
The old trader from distant lands promised to give me whatever dog I want. That was because my mother invited him to trade at our market.
Wow, does our baker know how to cook! I have never had such delicious pies and loaves. There was no one like him in the village where I was born.
Everyday Affairs
The baker made a bunch of meat pies and wants to give them to my kids at the Sepat. I need to bring a few boys with me to go get them.
Good thing my faithful dog was with me. He put up such a fuss that all the street dogs ran over and drove the thief all the way across the city to the port.
Pets
Someone just got through the Papyrus Mill window and stole the Master's important scrolls. We need to quickly find the thief before he can leave the city.
I decided to buy my big-eared friend a little lady. Why not? I will raise puppies in honor of my lost woman. She loved this breed so much, after all.
Pets
My Saluki puppy is quite the big dog already. I remember when Sheriti gave him to me after the battle with the sea serpent. He's probably bored living all alone in the port. I have an idea!
Last night one of my guys found a lamp in the sand and opened it. A terrible fire genie escaped and started burning everything around. I could barely hold it using the power of the totem.
Warrior's Soul
Everything went well the first couple days. My recruits did a good job handling everything I told them to do. On the other hand, we had an unexpected problem.
At the threshold of death, I grasped Nimiru's talisman and prayed for help. Suddenly a black dog appeared in front of me, the very embodiment of Anubis. He drove the genie back into the lamp.
Warrior's Soul
The fire genie was incredibly powerful. All my valiant troops fell in battle with it, while I ended up weak and covered in burns. However, I suddenly remembered Nimiru's talisman.
I found my harpoon at home and set off to look for the bird. The treacherous creature had already attacked the old beekeeper, and I was almost too late to defend the poor fellow.
Hiding Faces
The huge bird just flew over the city, covering the sun with its wings and calling loudly. Ah, this looks like trouble. Time to find a weapon.
My spear struck the predator, and it fell to the earth. But imagine my surprise when instead of a monster I saw a man in a bird mask lying on the ground!
Hiding Faces
I ran around the city looking and looking for the terrible bird. It attacked again, this time going after the defenseless Lady. This time I won't miss. Time to take down the monster.
Nimiru tended to the beekeeper after the monster attacked him, and together we headed back to the mariner. On the way I found the mechanical wings the man in the mask dropped.
Hiding Faces
The mariner wounded the huge bird that turned into a man in a mask. I immediately understood that there had to be some kind of nomadic sorcery going on and decided to find Nimiru.
The master prepared an excellent drug for me. The potion will quickly loosen the tongue of our shape-shifter, and he will say why he attacked our city.
Hiding Faces
The city was attacked. The nomad said that his people are the only ones who can use the magical power of the mask, and this guy won't say a word. We'll see about that!
The prisoner died immediately after dropping the crystal. I decided not to touch it, remembering that only you and my daughter are able to hold those evil stones.
Hiding Faces
Lord, we need your help right away. I was interrogating the prisoner and he managed to get a purple crystal from his pocke and touch Nimiru with it. She is now unconscious.
The warrior's burns, it appears, have finally healed. He helped me divide my troops into squads and disperse them around the city to protect the people.
Hiding Faces
The enemy army is too close to our city's borders. We need to get all our troops to posts in the port and around the river immediately.
The thief used his special claws to clamber up the papyrus mill wall like a cat. All of us on patrol were able to scare him off and follow him to the Sepat itself, though we couldn't catch him.
King of the Thieves
Everyone living in the city tries to be useful. I help patrol the streets, and I think I might have seen a shadow hiding behind the Papyrus Mill wall.
The Shadow, as the townspeople have been calling her, used those blades so well he might have had four hands instead of two. But there was no beating me in an open area.
King of the Thieves

Last night I met the thief by the Sepat. Yesterday he tried to rob the Papyrus Mill. I tried to catch him and succeeded in disarming him, but he disappeared in a cloud of thick smoke. All I had time to notice was that it was actually a woman!
Stinking green powder. I didn't notice it right away when I entered the room. Could it really be that our chief was put under and kidnapped? What should we do…
King of the Thieves
The chief disappeared from his own room. It's strange, but the room was locked from the inside. We need your help, since we're losing one leader after another!

The seahorse that helped me in the battle with the sea serpent brought a gift from the depths: a magic lamp. I released the river genie that was inside it and the genie pushed our enemies back to the shore.
Hiding Faces
The wild tribe of half-man/half-lion nomads built a raft and attacked our city. We weren't able to hold them off. But what's with the creature flashing by in the waters of the Nile…
Thanks to the potter I made a great mask from clay and stone. My people use dark powers to change their appearance, but I use the good powers and call them forth to help nature.
Hiding Faces
Many of the people in my tribe use their magic to turn into ferocious lions. But no worries, I can do something too. I just need to make a mask.

I was waiting for the Shadow when she arrived. We fought and I was able to tear the mask off her face before she ran away again. Under it was the face of Nimiru! Afterwards I went to the Sepat, but the chief's daughter was still lying there unconscious…
King of the Thieves
I am sure the Shadow kidnapped the chief. Most likely, the nimble thief was in the service of Amrun. She wants to weaken our city by taking out the best of us. Today she'll be coming for me!
The nomad used the totem and his magic mask to call a herd of elephants to help. They trampled their way through the enemy with their huge legs and used their trunks to throw stones and logs at them.
Hiding Faces
The enemy's forces are being directed by a giant. His face is terrifying and seems familiar. Today there will be a new battle, so we have to get ready to hold him off.

It's a good thing the priestesses scattered coal around the bed and set fire to it. I think the Shadow was very scared by the bright light. She didn't resist when we put the magic pill in Nimiru's mouth.
King of the Thieves

My dog had a chat with me and let me in on a secret. He knows the recipe for a special pill. If Nimiru eats it, the Shadow will leave her body. The only problem is that it won't be easy to make that happen.
The shroud of shadow dissipated and Nimiru started to come to. Now she'll be able to help us defeat our enemies, and I hope the Shadow is gone for good.
Hiding Faces
When Nimiru swallowed the pill, I was terrified for her. She screamed so loudly, and then I almost collapsed when the dark smoke shrouded her body.
Man-lion just man in mask. And their commander I guess is our chief. He not know what do because bad medallion hang on his neck. I tear it off!
Hiding Faces
Lord, evil creature try get in my house. I run to you and tell you it. Scary man-lions attack we. I kill one. Need help!
Who could have thought the nomad magicians would create a mask of the most dangerous creature on earth: man. Real evil really disfigures our faces!
Hiding Faces
Our brave miner doesn't show his face too often, but he was on the surface today. The courageous guy held off the first wave of attackers and freed our chief from the curse.
The miner himself volunteered to take a surprise over to the enemy camp from us. Menes will learn the power of my wrath today when our daredevil opens the jar of lightning on that bank.
Retaliation
We need to press hard after the retreating enemy with a counterattack of our own. Now that my father is with us again, Menes is leading the nomads. I have a surprise for him.
I knew the book was lost by our ancestors many years ago. It was buried under the sands, though the miner helped us find it.
Retaliation
While the Shadow lived within me I was able to hear its thoughts. Menes sent it to get the book of prophecies. He thought the book would be in the Papyrus Mill, but he was wrong.
This is the key to all doors. It doesn't just open normal doors, it can even get through space and end up anywhere at all.
Retaliation
Thanks to the book I learned where a powerful amulet is hidden. It will help us get deep into the very heart of the enemy army and strike a blow to Menes while he is recovering from the lightning.
I'm happy our plan worked and the key opened the path to the nomad den. Without the pendant, Menes chickened out and took off. His people disappeared into the far corners of the jungle.
Retaliation
Thanks to the Shadow I learned that Menes carries a pendant of eternal life on his chest. It heals many of his wounds. We have to get that pendant to strip Menes of his power.
This cannot is. Someone get into mine and make himself at home. This person find terrible door into Ancient City. He tear door from hinges. What now do?..
Rising Crime
Only I live in mine always. But now I think someone live in mine too. I hear rustle every day. I have to find who wander in my house.
I went to get the warrior to help us find the thief. We looked around your whole house, but we only found strange black blots on the window.
Rising Crime
Someone snuck into my house and stole the money I earned today. I have to tell the warrior right away.
That can't be: someone stole all the honey I made for the city children. And many of my bees are lying there as if they were put to sleep…
Rising Crime
I'm not young anymore, I love a good night's sleep, and I hate getting woken up. But it looks like someone snuck into my house. My bees aren't scary enough?..
I searched through every street in the city with my soldiers. We found a lonely camel, but there was no trace of the stolen goods.
Rising Crime
It's time to take care of all this crime. These disgusting thieves ravaged the market during the night and stole a visiting trader's camel and goods.
For some reason robbery is becoming popular in our city. It's taking a toll and spoiling our reputation among our guests arriving from neighboring lands.
Rising Crime
Unfortunately, a trader visiting our city was robbed by the thieves. He lost everything he brought with him and now we'll have to compensate him for his losses.
White camels are considered a symbol of prosperity by the nomad tribes, who decorate them with bright blankets and bring them to market. They're very expensive presents!
New Friends
My old fellow tribesmen are very thankful to the people in the city for forgiving them and letting them settle nearby. Their leaders would like to present the townspeople with gifts today.
The nomads are used to getting everything they need by raiding and stealing. They don't understand what our generosity means, though they're willing to change their ways.
New Friends
I understand the nomad tribes' language, so the chief named me our negotiator. I was ordered to gather food for our brothers as a sign of our gratitude.
These vagrants aren't too bad at plowing. Well, we'll see. Maybe they'll turn into something after all. We were able to make a real man out of our nomad.
New Friends
The nomads are quite the crowd of loafers. I'm sure they're the ones stealing in our city. And why did the chief ask me to teach them how to use a plow?
That was a nice bargain. I was able to find the rooster that sings the loudest at the market. They cock-a-doodle-do at dawn until they lose their voice, which is exactly what I need.
New Friends
Wow, it's so hard teaching these new people how to work the land! I'm so tired I can't wake up in the morning. It's time to do something about that.
I found an unusual, leopard-shaped vessel in the sand. And why did I decide to dig it up? As soon as I opened it a real sand hurricane exploded out.
New Friends
It would be nice to head over to the brewery after such a hard day and throw back a glass or two of good beer. Hey, what's that sticking out of the ground?
The old sailor taught me how to make different paper toys. They even look real! I didn't think that was possible. I'm going to show my mom what I did.
Eastern Art
The old sailor from eastern lands invited me to visit his wharf for a half day. He promised to make a small present for me. The sun is already high in the sky, so it's a great time for a walk.
Sheriti helped me make a fantastic paper flower for my darling. It didn't turn out to be that easy, but I was able to do it. The Lady was very happy to get it.
Eastern Art
I heard that little Sheriti learned how to make pretty things with paper. I invited her to come over today and help me make a present for the Lady.
The baker bought this jug at the market. He decided I would like how it looks. I swear to the gods, he knows me! Later I let the baker drink from it for free all night.
Pleasant Moments
Today the baker invited me over. He promised to give me something. I'm sure it's yet another vessel of some sort. Everyone in the city knows how I like big ones, since I fill them with foamy beer.
I go to master. Master help me make special clock for who work in mine. That candle burn and show what time man work. One candle, one day.
Rising Crime
I decide help people. Because I need close up entrance to Ancient City before too late. But people cannot work in dark, they not know what time.
It looks like something bad happened! The tunnel where the miner was working all day is empty. There is no trace of him at the end, just a spot of blood on one of the rocks…
Rising Crime
The workers who helped the miner close up one of the caves said that our digger unexpectedly disappeared. He is never more at home than when he is underground, so I hope nothing happened to him.
I wouldn't have been able to handle that thick-skinned creature without the totem. I'm so lucky it got stuck in the pottery. Although the potter won't be all too thrilled…
Rising Crime
Somebody opened the animal pens at the market and let out a terrible creature! I have no idea where he came from - I didn't think anyone had them around here anymore.
I think there's a whole gang working in the city. We never had this kind of chaos in our parts before the nomad tribes came. I'm sure it's their doing.
Rising Crime
While the townspeople were trying to catch a fierce hippopotamus all night, someone decided to take the opportunity to rob several places in the city.
It looks like the thief undid all the locks where I was hiding a chest of these special tools. Worst of all, some children are missing from the Sepat!
Rising Crime
That can't be! The thieves snuck into our warehouses and made off with a chest full of all my charges' savings. How could they steal from children??
On road I scare small children who steal gold from old chest and run to Ancient City. Seems Shadow now uses children.
Rising Crime
Shadow me hurt and drag to Ancient City. It still live in our city. Now I see who steal everything. I barely get away from kidnapper.
Today the Shadow openly announced its presence by sending me a message. It selected a black lotus as its symbol and is living in the very heart of our city!
Rising Crime
I know the Shadow wasn't completely destroyed. It hid underground, nursing its wounds and learning how to live without someone else's body. Now it is strong and has gathered its own gang.
I made a paper horse for the warrior. He was very happy to get it. I know the warrior and his people love horses, since they once came to our city on horseback.
Eastern Art
I so love making paper animals, and even taught the potter how to make a little something. Now I want to make a present for the warrior. He is so brave!
I was able to make the clock exactly how it is in the design. The townspeople loved it, and now my work will be right in the middle of Market Square.
Pleasant Moments
I recently found the design for a very interesting invention at the Master's Papyrus Mill: a sun-dial. I would like to try my hand at making one.
Today the Sepat children and I made things out of paper. I taught them how to make a turtle. The children will now be able to make toys for themselves, since there aren't that many at the Sepat.
Eastern Art
The Lady is very worried that several of her children left the Sepat and have started earning their way as thieves. She asked me to help her a little by doing something interesting with the kids.
A gorgeous horse just flew right by me. It was like its body was made out of blue mist, while its mane shown like starlight. I've never seen such a beauty.
Force of Nature
Such a nice evening. I did all the work I needed to get done today and decided to relax for a bit at the wharf. But what are those sounds, like hooves thundering closer and closer?
I was able to get the resources needed to repair my house. The beautiful Lady offered to let me live at the Sepat until my house is ready. I agreed!
Force of Nature
That terrible animal, a giant hippopotamus, destroyed my whole house. All my long months of work shattered all at once. Now I have to repair everything…
A small sandstorm kicked up not far from my house yesterday. I could bet there was some kind of animal in the middle of it.
Force of Nature
Something is wrong in and outside the city. During nights I hear strange wailing or a loud rumbling from underground. It's making me really nervous.

That ferocious monster tore out of the pyramid, though the scorching sun forced it to hide in the mines. If it weren't for the help of the warrior and the power of the totem, I'm not sure what that thing would have done during the night…
Force of Nature
I was inside my ice pyramid practicing ice magic. Suddenly it was like I lost control and a huge chunk I had been freezing all week came to life.
Now Sirius shines brighter than ever before. The master and I were able to decode all Sirius' symbols. Harnessing the force of nature will require two powerful artifacts.
Force of Nature
The stars have recently been shining very brightly. We need to get Sirius' help before the unbridled force of nature destroys our city for good.
The beautiful moth is only of light. It want talk to me. It call me to mine and show one wall. There it disappear… Probably treasure is behind wall.
Force of Nature
I love go to city at night when all sleep. At night not hot, at night sun not sting my eyes. Oh, I see beautiful color far away. I go see what it is…
Farmer bring me hoe. Hoe is not pick, but also is good. Together we finally break fat wall and go to old tunnel.
Force of Nature
I hit fat wall where phantom moth show me. Wall is very firm, like rock. I break my tool and need help from Farmer.
The only idea I had was to push the water clock onto the burning papers. Suddenly the flame hissed and turned into a fiery beast.
Force of Nature
Oh, gods! I accidentally dropped the candle and some of the scrolls caught on fire. I have to put it out immediately. If the flames get to the ancient scrolls, I won't make it out alive.
Well, I'm still a talented animal tamer. I was able to lure the salamander to the port, where the mariner and I shoved it into the water. The whole city is now covered in a fog.
Force of Nature
What's that shouting? It sounds like the master! Smoke is coming out the window of his house… But it isn't a fire! It's a fire salamander. We have to catch it before it burns the whole city down.
I grabbed the hour glass and headed down into the secret corridors. Surprisingly, down here the sand stopped trickling, instead staying in the top bulb…
Force of Nature
The miner said he had found old passages underground. He wandered around there for a few hours, and when he came back the sun still hadn't set. Time has no power in that cave.

I found a clock that let me move time. The Shadow must have dropped it when it was building its den here. That's why a portal between times opened in our city, and that's where all these strange creatures have been crawling up from.
Force of Nature
I found many things that had gone missing from the city in the cave the miner showed me. However, I was most interested in an ancient artifact that should be the one Sirius mentioned.

The cheetah charged at me, aiming to tear me to shreds. I bravely faced it. We fought for quite a while, but soon I started gaining the upper hand. The creature tore itself away and ran off into the desert. The sandstorm subsided.
Force of Nature

An hour ago a powerful sandstorm came in from the desert and covered the city. The townspeople hid in their houses. I was coming back to the Barracks when I saw a creature coming towards me through the wall of sand…
When I came to myself I told the miner and Nimiru about the vision. Together we went down into the ancient ruins and found a lasso in the square - an artifact used to pacify the wild elements.
Force of Nature

Today I had a vision. On my way down to my cellar I stumbled and fell for a long time into an abyss before ending up in a square that was part of the Ancient City. At the very center of the square I saw a glow, above which stone statues of mysterious animals bowed.
When I came to myself in the morning, I saw a paper crow in my hand. A black bird is a bad omen, and the Shadow asked me to give it to Nimiru. What should I do…
New Enemy
Last night I had a scary dream. I saw the Shadow appear in my room. It gave me something and asked me to hand it to Nimiru, after which I woke up.
I spent all night making this huge heart and in the morning gave it to the Lady as a sign of my thanks and feelings for her. She was thrilled by the present and rewarded me with a kiss!
Eastern Art
The Lady was so caring the whole time I lived at the Sepat. Now the pottery is fixed, however, and it's time to head home. I would like to thank the Lady somehow.
The Shadow always leaves a black lotus at the scene of its crimes. We will create a squad to catch the thief, and ourselves take the white lotus as our symbol.
New Enemy
The Shadow is a huge threat to the townspeople. It is an enemy who has taken up residence deep under our city, and we have to figure out how to get it out of there.
Well, that was an unexpected present. I'd heard about creatures like that, but I thought they were long extinct. It looks like the time shift let one of them appear in our parts.
New Enemy
Nimiru accepted me as a member of the White Lotus squad so that I could help look for the Shadow. In honor of that, the nomad promised to give me a mount his relatives had caught in the desert.
The Lady wrote that she had to head off to the neighboring village right away to take care of orphaned children. However, she can't wait to get back so we can see each other.
Quivering Heart
I'm so happy! A messenger just arrived from the Sepat and said that the Lady left a letter for me there. I need to get down there and pick it up right away!
These candies look so delicious I wouldn't mind eating them right here and now. I left a box of them for the Lady at her house. I can just imagine how happy she'll be when she gets back.
Quivering Heart
I need to make some kind of present for when the Lady gets back. I heard the Tradeswoman is selling candy from the Far East at the market. I think she'll have what I need.
The Lady is so kind to me. I've never seen her pay me so much attention. But that is really strange, seeing as how she's married to the potter.
Quivering Heart
The Lady and I brought orphan children from the neighboring village. She asked me today to help her to find her new wards something to eat.
The flower the Lady returned to me today was completely dry. The boy who gave it back to me said that the Lady no longer wants to be my wife, as her heart now belongs to another.
Quivering Heart
I know the Lady got back from her trip a while ago, though she spends all her time at the Sepat. I sent her a flower, though she returned it the same day…
Last night I made my way to the Sepat and watched the Lady taking some kind of medicine before bed. I waited for her to fall asleep so I could sneak in and steal the strange bottle.
Quivering Heart
I tried to talk with the Lady, but she doesn't want to see me and kicked me out. She said she's now in love with the nomad, but there's no way I'm letting that happen!

I went through a special ritual for the potter and learned the secret of the potion the Lady was taking. Whoever takes it falls in love with the first person they see. That person turned out to be the nomad.
Quivering Heart
The Potter thinks the Nomad bewitched the Lady using the magic elixir. I need to buy the beekeeper's wax candles for a special ritual.
The Tradeswoman got her hands on a new pottery wheel for me that's better than my old one. I think I'll have a lot of work now and before long I'll have made a bunch of new pots and jugs.
Worldly Affairs
That clumsy hippopotamus who destroyed my entire pottery broke my main tool. I had to order a new one from the Tradeswoman.
Today I went hunting with my relatives, and we shot a gazelle. Not far from where we were hunting I saw a strange cave. I found it as alluring as it was frightening…
Worldly Affairs
My brothers living not far from our city are getting more and more used to local life. They accept me as their elder, and we're getting ready to go hunting together today.
I found the cow in the port. The mariner did a good job not letting it fall in the water. It ate so much seaweed that I don't even want to think about what its milk will taste like.
Worldly Affairs
Today I sent my younger son to shepherd our cow. The little lazybones fell asleep, so now I have to look all over the city for it. I hope nothing happened.
The little merchant from the southern lands was going on and on about his dates, so I couldn't resist the temptation to try them. Mm!!! They're so good!
Hostile Machinations
Ah, I'm kind of hungry after our exercises at the Barracks. I could eat a whole cow. Let's run over to the Market and buy something to eat.
I got an apple and enchanted it with the ability to restore health. Now my father is feeling better, and even looking younger than he used to.
Hostile Machinations
A strange trader sold my father enchanted, dried dates. When he ate them, he suddenly started aging. If I can't help him, he will turn into dust by evening.
Nimiru said the strong smell of crushed garlic in the drug would break the spell of the sweet elixir. She turned out to be right. The Lady is already feeling more like herself.
Quivering Heart
Nimiru told me the Lady wasn't bewitched by the nomad at all, and instead by some trader from the village she visited. At least now I know how to remove spell.
My potter gave me a stuffed animal - how sweet! He's so shy, but he'll do anything for me. He even wanted to fight the nomad. What a real man!
Quivering Heart
I wasn't myself thanks to the enchanted elixir, and I'm so thankful my husband was able to remove the spell. Just now I realize how much I missed him.
I remember how the potter proposed to me. I couldn't wait and thought he would never make up his mind to do it. But it happened and now we're husband and wife!
Quivering Heart
Nobody has ever been more caring toward me than my husband. I still can't believe I met the only one like him. I'm really happy when I'm with him!
