Why, oh why did I buy that ill-fated cream from the foreign merchant? After I put it on my skin, terrible scales covered me. I'm so ugly…
Hostile Machinations
A foreign merchant brought a ton of fantastic perfumes and creams to the market today. They smell so good! I will absolutely have to get something for myself.
I told the people I met what I had seen at my house. The chief, the mariner, and the warrior headed there to figure out what is going on. I hope everything is okay with my mom.
Hostile Machinations
Tonight I went home, but instead of my mom I was met by some kind of snake-like monster. What should I do? Time to call for help!
I searched the entire port, even looking under the wharf, but Sheriti was nowhere to be found. It's like she dissolved. All I could find was a small chess piece.
Secret Kidnappings
The warrior told me to go look around the port for Sheriti while he set off to see what happened to the girl's mother. I wasn't able to find Sheriti at the port, though.
I enchanted the artichokes for the Tradeswoman. If she peels off the tough outer leaves that look like scales and only eats the ones on the inside, she will soon be back to looking like herself.
Hostile Machinations
My father told me what happened to the Tradeswoman. Some kind of mysterious trader once again is involved. We have to save that poor woman right away before she completely loses her mind.
I searched all the outskirts, but I couldn't find my friend anywhere. It was like he slipped through the earth. All I could find was a chess knight.
Secret Kidnappings
While Nimiru was tending to the Tradeswoman, the nomad and I set off to the Market to look for Sheriti. Maybe she decided to go home. However, I soon understood that the nomad had also disappeared.
I decided to help my husband clean up around the pottery. It will only work in his favor if the people who come to buy from him see that he is a very tidy fellow.
Worldly Affairs
The potter finally got the pottery in working order, but it was obvious that it needed a woman's touch. There was a steady flow of work, and who would put things in order…

I was able to find two interesting knick-knacks the antiquities dealer had. It looks like the statuette is in the form of the last great ruler of Egypt and his sons. The ring is the symbol of his power.
Family Ties
I learned that an antiquities dealer had arrived at the city. These people aren't the most scrupulous when it comes to acquiring their goods, and so I invited him to my house in secret…

A chess rook was lying on the warrior's bed. That makes sense, since it corresponds to his strength. The knight symbolizes the animals the nomad handles, and Sheriti is as small as a pawn. Could Nimiru really be next…
Secret Kidnappings
First Sheriti and the nomad disappeared, with chess pieces found where they last were. Now the warrior is missing. I wouldn't be surprised to find yet another chess piece.
I found a chess king in the mines. The miner said he saw something dark envelop my father and drag him off to the underground labyrinth… the Shadow!
Secret Kidnappings
My father warned me that he might be kidnapped and that the kidnapper would leave a chess piece at the scene of the crime. But where could he have gone…
I collected some ingredients and decided to brew some pomegranate beer. It was simply incredible. Today I'll give some to all my guests for free.
Worldly Affairs
I was rummaging around in my father's old records and found some interesting recipes for the fruit beers he used to make. Very intriguing. I think it's time for me to update my supply of drinks.

When I burst into the house I saw something dark disappearing out the window. Nimiru was being held by the neck, and next to her a string was laying there. Oh gods! The Shadow tried to strangle our Lady!
Advancing Shadow
Nimiru dropped in to buy a little more honey. When I left to head to the apiary I heard the enchantress' scream coming from the house. She was calling for help…
I found what Mistress Nimiru needed. She still can't talk and uses hand gestures and signs to explain everything to me. I would do anything to see her healthy again!
Advancing Shadow
After the Shadow tried to strangle Mistress Nimiru, she lost her voice. She needed my help to quickly buy ingredients for medicine.
The Lady helped me look for the pill Mistress Nimiru told me about. The enchantress used my honey to make some kind of elixir, and by the evening her voice had returned.
Advancing Shadow
Mistress Nimiru asked me to run to the Sepat and bring her some kind of pill she wanted to use to make a very strong medicine.
I caught up to the thief right by the wharf. He paid for what he stole using a coin that later disappeared from the pocket of the trader and returned to its master. Yet another trick by the Shadow.
Advancing Shadow
Our market was beset by a rash of robberies, both of goods and money. Rumors are going around regarding some kind of disappearing money. Wait, it sounds like somebody just yelled "Grab that thief!"
I hypnotized the thief who served the Shadow. He went back to the robbers' lair and brought me a scroll. I'm sure the Shadow found it in the ruins of the Ancient City.
Advancing Shadow
I learned from the thief the warrior caught that the Shadow found a magic scroll used to create tools for burglars. I need to get a hold of it.
The Shadow's substance is reminiscent of a genie. That means I could trap it in a vessel. The potter helped me draw a sketch he would use to make the vessel. I'll then breathe magic into it.
Advancing Shadow
When the Shadow tried to strangle me, I felt a connection with it that was just like when we were one and the same being. In those short moments I learned something interesting.
I found all the scrolls that interested Nimiru. It turns out especially strong genies cannot be trapped in just any old jar. We need one specially made for that purpose.
Advancing Shadow
Nimiru asked me to find her all the information I could about genies and how to trap them in lamps, jugs, and other vessels. She thinks she knows how to beat the Shadow.
I was able to mold a jug just like in the sketch. After baking it, I covered it in special magical designs just like Nimiru showed me.
Advancing Shadow
Nimiru explained how the jug needs to look so she can use it to catch the Shadow. Well, time to get down to work. I have never made magical jugs.
When the Shadow attacked, I pretended I was sleeping and then hit it to weaken it. The kidnapper was pulled into the jug, with nothing left on the floor but a chess queen.
Secret Kidnappings
I think I will be the Shadow's next victim. Well, I've battled Menes and handled his power. I'll need to use the totem for support.
I found a chess board in the Shadow's lair that symbolized our entire city. The Shadow's plan was to completely control it in the end.
Secret Kidnappings
While wandering through the underground labyrinths I found everyone else who had been kidnapped. None of them were hurt - they had all been hypnotized and were sleeping peacefully.
I find strange decorations. I think in my time rich man wear such gold thing on chest. Then everyone bow low to him.
Family Ties
Master ask me search many old knick knacks in cave. He say I bring him all that I find. I very try, because I have no other work.
I gave the order to find as many building materials as possible and build a special vault in the mines. We will wall the Shadow up forever there, filling the vault up with earth.
Advancing Shadow
Now that I was able to free all my friends and trap the Shadow in the jug, I need to hide it as far away as possible. The Shadow's servants cannot be allowed to find their mistress.
The miner and I set off toward the places where he found the plate, and I found some embroidered sandals there. The scrolls say footwear like this was a trapping of high status.
Family Ties
The miner brought me something unique that for those times matched the ring and statuette. I think the plate belonged to one of the Pharaoh's sons.
I personally headed up the raid around the entire city in search of the Shadow's servants. I didn't even think that creature would have been able to collect such a large group in so little time.
Advancing Shadow
When all the White Lotus members and little Sheriti got back to the city, the Shadow had been caught and trapped deep underground, while its accomplices were weakened without their master.
Going down deeper into the underground city I got to the ancient sepulcher. There was a sarcophagus belonging to someone very important at the center. Oh gods! It was empty…
Family Ties
With my interest piqued by the story of Egypt's last ruling family, I am continuing my search along with the miner. I think I'm on the verge of discovering an ancient secret.
The mummy spoke with a human voice and said that it would let us in on a secret if we help it find peace. Otherwise, we would be killed. We had no choice!
Family Ties
I was so scared when a terrifying withered mummy came out of the corridor directly at me. The miner and I pressed ourselves against the wall and froze, fearing for our lives.
I found the tablet with the image of a scarab. I think this is the edge of the area where all the ancient wise men gathered. I need to tell Nimiru.
Ancient Knowledge
I'm helping Nimiru find her way through the Underground City using symbols and tracks. Now I need to find the area where the scroll storages were located in ancient times.
The first volume I was able to find was well preserved. It talked a lot about how to turn one metal into another. Well, that could be interesting.
Ancient Knowledge
Finally, the nomad was able to find the area in the Underground City that most interests me. We have no idea what knowledge is stored there.
Some building materials, skill, and experience, and now the only entrance into the very heart of our ancestors' past has been preserved. I'm very interested to see what those caves are hiding.
Ancient Knowledge
The miner said the main corridor leading to the Underground City does not seem safe to him. He asked me to help him shore it up.
The book the master found is truly valuable. It is a list of all the rare plants from different parts of the world and how to use them.
Ancient Knowledge
The master sent news that he was able to find an interesting book. I can't wait to see what he got his hands on.
It turns out the Althaea is a very useful plant. It helps wounds heal and also reduces inflammation. I'll definitely have to remember that.
Ancient Knowledge
I've been reading through this book of ancient plants all day - I can't tear myself away. I'm now learning about a few of them I found at home. For example, Althaea…
I can't believe my eyes! I'm not great at reading letters, but I'm excellent at figuring out maps. And this book is filled with pages of maps. Oh gods! I haven't even been to some of these lands!
Ancient Knowledge
I also decided to wander around the underground knowledge storehouse for a while. Why not? Maybe I'll get lucky and find something unique…
A steady hand, sharp steel, and the strength of the totem helped me drive off the evil underground spirits. I wouldn't be surprised if those creatures are the handiwork of Seth himself!
Ancient Knowledge
The miner came over and told me he saw some nasty creatures in the vault that didn't look too friendly. I need to hurry, since the nomad is still down there…
I found the symbol for the new region and another book. Somebody drew skinless people on its pages, so let the master and Nimiru figure that one out. It's probably some kind of dark magic…
Ancient Knowledge
On my way back to the top it seems I turned into the wrong corridor. I think I'm lost. I'm still deep in the underground city, though I'm in a completely different region.
I never see such interesting book. I never hold such book in hands. Such nice smell. Such smooth page. I want to keep it.
Ancient Knowledge
I understand that all look in vault for book. They so happy it found. Maybe I also happy if find one more such book. I try happiness!
The miner asked to keep the book of popular sayings so he could learn how to read. I think I'll be able to help him with that. Knowledge should be free for everyone who searches!
Ancient Knowledge
Well! We got everything we could out of the underground city. Now we have our own small library filled with the knowledge of our ancestors. It's time to get to studying.
Cornflower is successfully used to make food. In some countries women use it to create rejuvenating masks. It also has a ton of other medicinal qualities!
Ancient Knowledge
I got so engrossed in reading that I completely stopped sleeping. I didn't know that plants have so many unusual qualities. Take the simple cornflower, for example…
I find in cave small cat baby. Seems he is very hungry. But he not want eat my food. Need to take him to Sheriti. That good girl should help me.
Fluffy Neighbors
While everyone rummage in earth to find different things, I walk in corridors and hear sad squeak. Who can make such clear sound?
The dogs in our city chase cats up and down the streets, though my panther terrifies them. She and I saved a kitten from the dogs and I went ahead and decided to tame it without thinking.
Fluffy Neighbors
Ever since we started freely going through the Underground City, a lot of cats appeared on the surface. They were probably hiding underground the whole time. I'll have to take one home.
My little terrors didn't want to clean up, so they hid the broom from me. However, it was found as soon as I promised we would go swimming after finishing the job.
Weekdays
Ah, it's been so long since I cleaned up around here and in the kids' rooms. Time to take care of that before everything is completely covered in dirt. But where's my broom?

I barely had time to save a small, sleeping kitten from under the wheels of the wagon. Another couple seconds and it would have been too late. Now I need to take care of it. The miner already gave me one, so now I'll have two.
Fluffy Neighbors
Our city is huge these days. So many people live in it that it's hard to walk down the narrow streets during the day. And the wagons are already trying to crush someone.

I saw a strange picture when I got home. Some kind of street cat got its head stuck in a jar trying to steal milk. Lucky for him, my kids convinced me not to be mad and instead take the little thief in.
Fluffy Neighbors
Well, morning is here, so it's time to head out to the cattle shed and milk the cow. Today there will be a lot of milk. I'll just grab a few extra jugs from the house.
That's what it means to be a real team. My friends and I ran around the entire city and said why we need food. Every one of the townspeople gave what they could for our cats.
Fluffy Neighbors
I now have an entire squad of cat helpers: me, the Farmer's kids, and a few girls from the Sepat. Today we have an important mission: we need food for all our fluffy friends.
Sheriti has an entire cat nursery at the Sepat. I told her about my problem and she gave me the smartest kitten she had. That whiskers will definitely put things in order at the bakery.
Fluffy Neighbors
Such terrible luck! Every night mice get into my bakery and spoil all my bread. I have to take care of this problem right away. I think Sheriti will help me.
Sheriti's group and I looked around the whole area for the cats who ran off. By morning we had returned all of them and even more to the Sepat. Not the easiest night…
Fluffy Neighbors

An out of breath Sheriti ran up to me and said that someone accidentally let a dog into the Sepat. The cats from the shelter were scared and ran off across the whole city. Well, nothing for it but to help.

Nobody dared go into the beekeeper's except me. Everyone thinks he's crazy and stirs up his bees against kids. However, I know that the old beekeeper is a very nice guy. I got the ball and had some honey.
Weekdays
My new group and I not only take care of cats, we now also chase a ball around the courtyard. Except just now the Farmer's son hit it so hard it flew into the Apiary.
A little kitten was chasing a butterfly and almost fell off the wharf into the water. He looks very well groomed. He probably ran off from Sheriti's shelter, so I'll take him back.
Fluffy Neighbors
Who's that pottering around my freshly-caught fish? It's a small kitten, and he's having so much fun chasing that butterfly. Oh, it looks like he got a bit too involved in the game…
Sheriti's shelter has so many good-looking cats that I wasn't able to keep from taking one home. I need to show it to the potter right away - he will also like it.
Fluffy Neighbors
I didn't really look too deeply into what Sheriti and the rest of the kids are doing. I have enough to do. But when I decided to check out the cat shelter, I thought it was so wonderful.
It's been a long time since I washed so many clothes. If my little terrors weren't here to help, I would be hanging clothes all day.
Fluffy Neighbors
After the night the cats ran away, all the kids who helped look for them came back dirty. I had to get to work cleaning everything.
I picked out the cutest of Sheriti's charges. He'll make a great gift for Nimiru, seeing as how she once gave me a dog. I hope having a cat around will make my daughter feel better.
Fluffy Neighbors
My daughter is spending a ton of energy studying the ancient books. Day and night she sits with the master poring over the scrolls. I decided to cheer her up a bit.
The cucumber is one of the ingredients I use in my daily exercise drink. All the good stuff it contains makes my heart work better.
Ready to Compete

In honor of the celebration for the gods my troops and I will take part in a horse race. As the leader of my cavalry, I need to finish first. There is one thing I use to get ready for intense training.
Celery makes my joints flexible and clears out diseases. Apples help keep me thin and lithe.
Ready to Compete
Celery and apples are two important elements of my health drink. The baker should have good apples since he likes adding them to his pies.
It isn't easy finding a good lip paint or face powder these days. And I'm out of mine. Thankfully, the Lady helped a friend out.
Weekdays
Everyone is getting ready for the upcoming holiday and wants to look their best. I also have to take care of my looks. I'll run over to the Lady, since she'll have lip paint.
Now I have my own warhorse. He's wooden, but when I grow up I'll be a warrior with a real one!
Weekdays
The warrior is focusing so much on getting ready for the competition. He wants to ride his horse as fast as possible. He's the strongest in the city, and I want to be just like him!
The warrior told me I should eat grapefruit too. He says it will keep me from ever getting sick and make me just as strong as he is.
Ready to Compete
The warrior told me a lot of fruit was transported to the port. He asked me to get him some of the white grapefruits he needs for his special drink.
Mm! What fragrant mint, just what I need. It will make my drink smell good and clear my head before the races.
Ready to Compete
I asked the nomad to find me some mint. He knows where to find it around these parts. It's time to go talk to him about the last ingredient for my drink.
Thanks to my drink and persistence, I won the horse competition in honor of the gods and… my grandfather, who told me about this fantastic recipe.
Ready to Compete
Well, I have all the ingredients for my drink. All I have to do is mix it well and drink it. I can already feel health and strength coursing through my body!
Great, that money will be enough for everything we were thinking about. Now we need to work on getting everything ready and putting our plans into action.
Faces of the Gods
We'll need some money for the celebration of the gods and the competition in their honor. Let's see what we have in our warehouses and what the townspeople would be willing to share.

I have the honor of becoming the God Thoth with the head of an ibis for a little while. He was the patron of knowledge and wisdom, a being who gave people the light of knowledge. That's perfect for me.
Faces of the Gods
Everyone in the city wears the mask of the deity that is the sponsor of their profession. In that way we'll personify the gods and tell their stories to our children.
I put together a fun team of townspeople and kids. They were all more than happy to help decorate our wonderful city.
Faces of the Gods
Nimiru asked me to decorate the whole city. I need to find people to help me quickly take care of hanging the colored lamps and garlands.
Bast was a goddess with the head of a cat. And now I love the cats running around all of the Sepat. She was also the patroness of hearth and home.
Faces of the Gods
I have an interesting role to play in this fun celebration as well. I will wear the mask of the goddess Bast. I can't forget to touch up the eyes so it looks more mysterious.
Khnum is a god with the head of a ram. Our ancestors thought he created all people and molded them from clay on his pottery wheel.
Faces of the Gods
I would never have thought I'd have a role to play, much less the role of a god. Well, I hope I'll do a good job. At least I get to be someone interesting.
Horus had the head of a falcon and was Seth's main opponent. Right. That's how it works in nature. The courageous falcon dives from the skies at its prey, killing it with its talons.
Faces of the Gods

Even though I'm taking part in the horse race, I also have to play the role of one of the most powerful ancient gods. I will head to the streets looking like Horus. I will even compete wearing his mask.
I now am Anubis! My head is jackal head. I live under earth where all dead. I lead in that world like assistant to keep bad away. My work is very useful!
Faces of the Gods
I already learn a little to read and know about that god with the mask I wear on my face. Like in my book it says: "Learning is light, and ignorance is darkness." I live so long in darkness…
Yesterday I was at Market Square and surprised the citizens of our city with a magic performance. Afterward I thanked everyone for trying so hard to make our city blossom.
Faces of the Gods
I made a special mask for myself. It belongs to one of the ancient Egyptian queens. I will be wearing it at the end of the celebration in front of all the townspeople to make a speech.
I used the strength of the totem and ran off to help the miner, but it was too late. He was buried under the piles. An angry Menes laughed, standing near the old entrance to the vault.
Faces of the Demons
At some point during the celebration I lost consciousness and had a terrible vision. Menes and the underground people were trying to collapse the mines.
It's not much to look at, but it'll do for now.
Milling About
The Chief has asked me to set up a papyrus mill for the city. It doesn't have to be grand, it just needs to get the job done.
I go to my mine and break icicles every day. But in morning they here again. I freezing in this icy prison. Maybe I should go to surface.
In Chains of Ice
Some white snow on surface began to melt, and water start flowing into my mine. Is very cold here now, and big icicles grow from ceiling. Is hard to walk in mine now.

I selected some hardy helpers from a group of newcomers in the sepat. They're all accustomed to working on the land. In the meantime, the tradeswoman and her daughter helped gather all the surviving seeds and seedlings at the market.
In Chains of Ice
The snow destroyed much of the harvest. Now that it's melting, we need to start over at once. I'm going to need seeds and reliable helpers.

The warrior gave me an amulet he found in an ancient sanctuary. With its help, I managed to evaporate the water in the mine. I used my own magic as well, to speed up the process. Thank the Gods the miner is still alive.
In Chains of Ice
The snow started to melt in some parts of the city. A few days later, I saw water flowing out of the mine. That's all we needed! It seems our miner has been submerged underground.
I spoke with the master, and together we found some ancient scrolls which helped us decipher the nature and structure of the pattern on the ice. I think I understand how to do magic like this now.
In Chains of Ice
The miner found a giant piece of ice with fantastic patterns on in one of his caves. He invited me to take a look at it. Oh Gods! This is an incredible natural pattern, like frozen magic.
Last night, a new constellation in the shape of a bull was clearly visible above the field. The star charts tell me that this is a good omen. Bountiful crops and prosperity await us again.
In Chains of Ice
I heard the farmer wandering around the city and muttering that the future holds nothing good for us, that the new harvest won't grow. I decided to ask the skies for advice.

Using ancient knowledge from my scrolls, Nimiru was able to create a pyramid of ice which does not melt even under our scorching sun. There, the sorceress will discover even deeper secrets of new knowledge.
In Chains of Ice
Nimiru is a powerful sorceress and a perceptive woman. She sees deeply into the substance of things. Thanks to this gift and my scrolls, she has uncovered the secret of some special magic.

I stood long admiring the little birdie jumping between its perches, and then it flew into my hand on its own. It's as if all of nature is celebrating the sun's return. I hope all our worries are behind us…
In Chains of Ice

The snow has finally disappeared from our lands and the sun is shining again. It seems it was another of Menes's tricks. And yesterday, while walking around the market, I heard the joyful singing of the returning birds.
A new constellation appeared in the east today. The ancients depicted it as a female figure with a disk on her head. This is a good omen for Nimiru. The sky feels her growing strength.
Speaking to the Stars
I summoned Nimiru to come at night to the port, to study the new appearances in the night sky. There, where the sea meets the sky, infinity is born. A new discovery awaits us today, I can feel it.
The constellation depicts a hippopotamus and a crocodile. Our ancestors believed that all the enemies of the god Horus were transformed into these animals. I think a new danger is on the horizon.
Speaking to the Stars

My Lord, I will soon learn the ancient knowledge of the Celestial Secrets. I couldn't sleep last night, and went for a walk in the market. There, I saw a new appearance in the sky. I hurried to the papyrus mill.

My father ordered a special copper tube from our craftsmen. It has magnifying glasses inside. If you look through it, you can see the stars in more detail. The master must have found a diagram for it in the scrolls.
Speaking to the Stars
My father found out about my new hobby. He probably spoke to the master. He decided it's a worthy occupation, so he wants to give me a gift. I don't know what it is yet.
I was amazed when I got to the market. The townspeople were making balls out of this white snow, then throwing them at each other and laughing.
In Chains of Ice
The people trembled with cold for several more hours before we handed out warm skins and blankets. But now I hear laughter on the next street. Why are they laughing?

I found some manuscripts which say that the constellation above the city is the Lion constellation. When it shines so brightly, it is said to herald the coming of a terrible draught and of great rulers.
Speaking to the Stars

For the second night in a row now, I've been seeing a strange pattern of very bright stars in the sky. I need to take a look in my records and see what this constellation is. And tell Nimiru about it.
This rain amulet was handed down in our family from generation to generation. Apparently, it was created in the ancient times by a pharaoh priest who lived in these lands.
Speaking to the Stars
The sun has been broiling us mercilessly for several days now. My crops can't possibly survive after all these catastrophes. It's time to find the amulet my father gave to me on his deathbed.
Nimiru tell me that earth shake because of magic. Wicked Menes do this bad thing. Lady give me special amulet. I hide it in mine and earth become calm again.
Speaking to the Stars
Land shake much today. I not think this is herd of elephants or rhinos. Shaking too strong. I afraid for people and quickly run to sepat to help.

The captured bird turned out to be a black kite. Its coming is a good sign for the soldiers. For us, the black kite is a prophetic bird, accompanying the troops in their campaigns and bringing victory.
Speaking to the Stars
I noticed that a giant bird of prey had started flying above the barracks, my Lord. I ordered my warriors to capture it and bring it to you.
I went to the nomad for help and asked him to draw all the new constellations he sees on his travels. This new knowledge could come in handy.
Speaking to the Stars

Mistress Nimiru has been coming to me more and more often. She's started studying the Celestial Secrets and spends all her time poring over star charts. I decided to organize all the records for her and find some new ones.
I combined together all my new knowledge and created a powerful magical item. It will protect the city from many great catastrophes, and dark forces will fear to approach it.
Speaking to the Stars
My Lord, the people have suffered much from Menes's wicked magic in recent times. I have created a special defensive cartouche, which we need to hang in the center of the city.
It turns out someone poisoned the honey in the apiary and the beer in the brewery. That's why so many people got sick. But Nimiru will come soon and make them well again.
Speaking to the Stars
I've heard rumors that there are many sick people at the brewery and the apiary. There aren't enough free hands to carry them all to the sepat. I've decided to go and help.

At some point, Nimiru's power strengthened and began to rival that of Menes, and then he was on the losing side. When he saw me, the evildoer struck the ground with his staff and disappeared in a shroud of mist.
Speaking to the Stars
I was running to the brewery to help people, when all of a sudden, I saw Nimiru and Menes dueling on the market square. Nimiru was clearly losing, and decided to turn to the totem for aid.
I found volunteers in the city to help expand Nimiru's chambers. They don't want any payment in exchange, but all the same, I decided to repay them with food.
Speaking to the Stars
My Lord, Nimiru needs more rooms to continue her studies of the Celestial Secrets. We'll need resources to build them. Can I ask you for some?

The cold and drought were serious threats to our city, all caused by Amrun's dark magic. And when Nimiru created a defensive cartouche for the city, the foul Menes crept into our midst and poisoned many citizens. But all that is behind us now.
Speaking to the Stars

I saw a pigeon at the market, my Lord. This is a good omen. If my memory serves, these birds have always been a symbol of peace. Perhaps it has finally come to us. I gave the order to catch one of the birds for you…

This is the Anu constellation, depicted as a falcon-headed god armed with a spear. Here it is said that it was a harbinger of great victories. All the same, I have a bad feeling about this for some reason.
In Chains of Ice
Last night, another constellation shined brightly in the sky. I'd never paid any attention to it before, so I've decided to read about it in the scrolls.

I doubt our enemies will plague us again for some time now. It seems life is making a comeback in the city. I saw that the birds have made a nest on the roof of the sepat. There'll be chicks there soon. I've never been so happy to see new life.
Speaking to the Stars
I have good news, my Lord. The nomad and I were able to drive the vile Menes out of the city. The sick citizens are on the mend, and the danger is already behind us.
I once found a special amulet in one of the ancient sanctuaries. Using it, I was able to turn the storm against our enemies. Nonetheless, Menes then escaped once again.
In Chains of Ice
In one of our campaigns, while we chased Amrun's defeated troops across the desert, the wicked Menes appeared before us and summoned a sandstorm. But I managed to deal with it.
I found this little bird near my home. It must have been unable to fly away with its family, and remained here. But never mind, I won't let it freeze to death.
In Chains of Ice
Because of the sudden cold, all the birds flew away from here. It's a shame mom and I have no wings. We'll stay in the city and help each other keep warm, especially the smallest of us.
It turns out that snow is made from tiny icy stars, all of them unique. While I was studying them, the citizens made boards for themselves and started sliding down the iceberg from top to bottom.
In Chains of Ice

People say that a huge iceberg floated into the port and the entire city gathered on the riverbank. The citizens pulled the iceberg from the water and dragged it to the sepat. As for me, I studied the snow in amazement.

In weather like this, people need a roof over their head to keep the snow off, walls to keep the wind out, and hot food in their bellies. I brought all the homeless people into the sepat, and the tradeswoman sent food from the market.
In Chains of Ice
In weather like this, our new citizens won't survive. We don't know how many people can live through such cold nights. I decided to gather all the people together, so the cold won't feel so bad.
Wise Nimiru gave me a powerful amulet of the ancient gods. As soon as the storm appeared on the horizon, I hung the amulet on a pole over the sea. The storm calmed at once. It was a wonder to behold!
In Chains of Ice
I found Nimiru in the sepat and told her that I met several old sailors from the North today in the brewery. They say that a fierce storm is brewing.
The beekeeper was happy to share his honey with me to help the sick. And the brewer made plenty of hot beer specially for them. We brought it all to the sepat to help the citizens get better.
In Chains of Ice
Many people living in the cold in the sepat fell seriously ill. I need to figure out a way to heal them, and quick. Magic can't help everyone, I need to find other ways.
I know firsthand that gull meat is edible. I asked the nomad to help me and we walked along the bank shooting as many gulls as we could find, to give their meat to the hungry.
In Chains of Ice
All the crops have frozen, and the shallows have iced over, so I can't catch any fish. People don't have enough food. But I think I have an idea. I'm going to need some helpers.
I dig new storehouse for goods in city. I make good place underground. Market right above it. Want get goods? No problem. Tradeswoman say this convenient.
Reviving Former Glory
Chief come to visit miner. He say city very rich now. Very. Not enough space at market for goods. Chief need my help. Need to dig. I love dig.
Nimiru told me that this was the Great Pharaoh who left his name on every cliff in his campaigns, to strike fear into his enemies. These lands may hold many of his secrets…
Reviving Former Glory
In one of our campaigns, far from the city, my soldiers found a strange tablet on a cliff. It read Amenhotep I. He must be some kind of famous hero. I thought I'd ask Nimiru about him.
I managed to gather enough food to feed myself on the road. I also saved a decent amount of gold, which I plan to use to buy rare goods in the neighboring lands.
Reviving Former Glory
I've decided to travel to the neighboring lands to buy rare goods while the roads are still clear of bandits and Amrun's minions. I'm going to need plenty of money and provisions for the road.
I asked the Lady to find the best dancer who can play a harp and sing. The warrior was pleased with the Lady's choice and listened to the girl's songs all day.
Reviving Former Glory
I asked the warrior what reward he desires for driving our enemies so far away and making our city rich. The warrior said that nothing makes him happier than beautiful women singing and dancing.
I place these treasures at your feet. Amrun's soldiers wanted to spend it on their warring, but we will spend it on peace. Let it benefit our citizens.
Reviving Former Glory
My Lord, we traveled far in our last campaign and crushed Amrun's mighty army in spite of being vastly outnumbered. The Gods must be watching over us.
I got everything I needed and went to the master for help. Together, we're surely up to the task. All the same, it's going to take some time, maybe even a few weeks.
Reviving Former Glory
My Lord, we've amassed many assets lately, but there'll be chaos if we don't keep an inventory of them. I'm one of few who can read and write, and would gladly help do this.
All the city's residents gathered up as many valuables as they could and melted them down into a golden throne. They'd be honored for their beloved ruler to sit on it.
Reviving Former Glory
My Lord, thanks to the will of the Gods and your fair leadership, our city is thriving like never before. The citizens truly love you and have decided to present a gift to their Sovereign.

I went to the mariner and expressed my gratitude on behalf of myself and the entire city, and gave him the cheetah skin from my shoulders as a gift. Let it give him warmth and shelter on his voyages at sea.
Reviving Former Glory
Our mariner turned out to be a great man. Once, he saved us from sea monsters, and now his ships help our warriors travel great distances. He deserves a reward.

The miner kindly provided several of his home caves for some of our guests. They're not very comfortable, but they're safer than the desert. The rest preferred to spend the night in the market square.
Reviving Former Glory
Apart from the people the nomad already brought to the city, another hundred people came to us from the desert. We should have found a place for the newcomers to stay the night.

Amrun really did plant a spy among the newcomers to the city – one of the living dead. The miner cornered it and waved his pickaxe at it, but only the power of the totem could lay the monster to rest.
Reviving Former Glory

I awoke in the night to a terrible scream from outside. I dressed quickly and ran out the house. The scream came from the mine. I think I'm going to need a totem for this. An enemy is in our midst, I feel it…
It turns out the warrior and his men freed some of their countrymen from Amrun's slave traders. They are strong and healthy and want to fight on our side.
Reviving Former Glory
I heard the warrior has returned from another campaign and brought many gifts with him. People said he brought prisoners who now await their fate at the market.

I went to the barracks and brought the warrior to the market. Mom put together a sack of rare gems specially for him. He gratefully accepted the payment, then he carried me around on his shoulders a little.
Reviving Former Glory
Mom went to trade in the neighboring settlements. She asked me to go to the warrior and remind him that his reward for guarding her on the road is waiting for him in the market.
I created a powerful amulet – the Fiery Ra. It is dedicated to the Sun God. We'll place it next to the cartouche and any undead entering the city will crumble into dust.
Reviving Former Glory

How did that undead monster get past the magical cartouche and into the mine? Maybe it was because the creature was surrounded by the powerful energy of so many living people. We can't allow this to happen again.
I dig new mine in ground. This time I dig very deep. City need new strong stone for new house. I find it and give it shape. This fun for me.
Urbanization
Chief tell me our city growing very big. Many people come here. No homes for them. Need new home for them and new building material. Also must read many diagram for building.
I brought the miner with me, he probably knows his stuff when it comes to stone. The miner looked at the columns, felt them and said we can take them. Mom will be so happy!
Urbanization
A stonemason guy came from another land and brought some columns to sell. I can't buy them while mom isn't here, I don't know if the stone's any good. Who can I ask for help?
I invited the farmer to visit and baked some bread. In his turn, he stopped by the brewery on his way here and picked up some beer. After a short chat, we agreed on a good price for the both of us.
Urbanization
I heard the farmer's harvest is good this year. I need to go see him and invite him over. I want to discuss new deliveries of grain for my bread. But first, I'd better tidy up a little around here.
I carry orb to sepat. People like it, Lord like it too. Chief ask me to make such orb for city decoration. I agree. It look nice.
Urbanization
When earth shakes happen last time, wall go crash in my mine. I find big round stone behind this wall, very nice feeling in my hand, very smooth.
When they found out about our city's expanding borders and new construction projects, many stonemasons agreed to work with us. It seems my trip was a success. It's time to go home.
Urbanization
The chief sent me a message by carrier pigeon telling me about what's been happening in the city. He asked me to make a deal with the local traders to deliver building materials into our lands.
As it happens, the cave the miner fell into is filled with veins of diorite. This stone is harder than most and weathers the wind more easily. Now our homes will be more solid than ever.
Urbanization
While our new citizens waited in the mines, I decided to visit them and the miner. But it turns out the miner tripped and fell into an underground cave. We can't just leave him down there.
I got plenty of people wanting to help. The master drew up some building plans for us, and Nimiru summoned the power of a totem to inspire the workers for this grand construction project.
Urbanization
We already have enough building materials and tools. With your permission, I'll spread the word in the marketplace and gather all those able to work or help in some way.
The brewer and the baker arrived tired, but happy. Other workers soon followed them. People are smiling with all their hearts. It seems peaceful times are to everyone's liking.
Urbanization

The baker, beekeeper and I have been distributing food to our builders all day. We were all pretty tired by the evening. I need to drop in on my friends and invite them to drink a mug or two of beer with me.
These pauldrons have served me faithfully and stopped more than one enemy sword. They brought me victories, and I would like to give them to the god Aker, the guardian of all people.
Reviving Former Glory

My long campaign was worthwhile. My men and I marched many miles and defeated many enemies. Almost all of us returned home alive and unharmed. I want to make an offering to the gods in thanks for this.
Nimiru tell me that this figurine is good omen. She say this how ancient pharaohs bless our labor that make city better. Me think so too.
Urbanization
I dig ground for foundation in all free spaces in city. My friends help me. I hit ground with pickaxe long time in last place and find very very unusual thing.
Our troops captured so many things, but the most valuable of them are Libyan rugs. I once heard about them from a merchant. They're going to be great for trade!
Reviving Former Glory
The warrior captured many valuable items in his last campaign. His soldiers brought everything they captured to the market and unloaded it. We'll have to work through the night to sort it all out.
The warrior brought some truly excellent copper. If we mix it with tin, we can create new weapons for our soldiers and tools for the farmer.
Reviving Former Glory

Our soldiers captured a large number of new mines full of copper veins. The warrior brought a few samples of this metal to the market to show it to the people. Good copper like this is a great find for us.

Oh, what a wonderful gift the warrior brought me. It's a smoking pipe. There's nothing more relaxing than sitting down in the brewery of an evening with this pipe and listening to the warrior, nomad and mariner telling stories.
Reviving Former Glory
The warrior sometimes brings back small, but pleasant gifts for people from his military campaigns. He asked me to go visit him today. He must have brought something back for me this time.
The beekeeper gave me a whole barrel of honey for the smoking pipe. It might even be too much. I can't eat it on my own, so I'll share it with my fellow soldiers.
Reviving Former Glory
I love to bring trinkets back as gifts for my friends, the ones I spend my evenings with in the brewery. They like to show their appreciation too. Today, the beekeeper invited me to visit him.
This is the helm of one of Amrun's generals. Now it belongs to me. If our enemy sends his soldiers into our native lands once more, I'll go into battle in this very helmet.
Reviving Former Glory
The mariner came to me today and said he has a certain gift for me. Something worthy of a true leader. I should go see him tonight and find out what it is.
I cut off a few ears of wheat and tied them into a sheaf. I want to offer it as a sign of my gratitude to the god of fertility, Min. May he always make our lands thrive as they have this year.
Reviving Former Glory

We've had no enemy attacks or other problems for a while now. It's wonderful! All the crops in my field have grown like never before. I have more than enough food to feed our citizens. Eternal glory to our Gods!
I think this hunting falcon is an embodiment of Min's will. I tamed this bird, and now he helps me look after the field by keeping the pesky crows away and hunting rodents.
Reviving Former Glory
Since I made an offering to Min, a young and healthy falcon began to visit the field often. This is a good omen. I'm going to try to catch the bird, it'll bring me good luck.
I've never seen such a vile creature. It filled up several corridors in the mines and attacked us from different sides, stinging us with its tentacles. But we overcame it!
From the Depths
We managed to cut several tentacles from the jellyfish, but it was somehow still able to reach the Mine and hid in a cave there. We have to find it!
Gods! I've never seen fish as large as this in all my life. Who would have thought that our river is so full of living creatures? I think I'll buy this perch from the Mariner.
From the Depths
My daughter Sheriti just came to me and said the Mariner caught a giant fish in the river and wanted to sell it at the Market. I should take a look at it.
If the local waters continue to bless me with such catches, then I'll soon be well set up in this city. Maybe I'll finally be able to build a little fishing boat.
From the Depths
I didn't know we had such large fish in our river. This is a good sign for the city. The Tradeswoman has agreed to pay me a good sum for my perch. I need to collect my payment from her.
Imagine my amazement when I arrived at the wharf and saw a giant panther in the water. The Mariner helped me pull it out. He said such creatures are kept in ships' holds, to guard slaves.
From the Depths
The Tradeswoman's daughter Sheriti came to see me in the Hut. She said there's a "kitty" floundering in the water and we have to save it at once. I couldn't say no to the little girl.

I spoke to the Nomad of how my city was attacked by tattooed invaders from the sea. On that day, I was taking a ring to my beloved as a sign of loyalty and hoped that she would become my wife. But in the end, I found myself on a galley and received a slave's brand.
From the Depths
After saving the panther, the Nomad took it to his hut and invited me to spend some time with him at the Brewery. After a few mugs of beer, I relaxed and shared my story with him.

The spy we caught refused the soup we offered him, and asked for fish instead. His face was covered in tattoos which seemed familiar to me, and his voice was like the croaking of a frog. He was armed with a whip.
From the Depths

I decided to take a few soldiers out on patrol in the night. I wanted to relax and inspect our newly built Port. We found spies on the bank. One leapt into the water and hid, but another we caught and put behind bars in the Barracks.

When the Mariner appeared in the prisoner's room with the fish, the prisoner went crazy. He flew to the Mariner and took him by the throat. His grip was so strong that I could do nothing but kill the prisoner where he stood.

When the Mariner appeared in the prisoner’s room with the fish, the prisoner went crazy. He flew at the mariner and took him by the throat. His grip was so strong that I could barely save the Mariner.
From the Depths
I realized that we wouldn't get any useful answers out of our prisoner until he ate. I sent a few of my boys to the Port to ask the Mariner for some fish.

When the Mariner got the whip, he told me the dead prisoner was once his overseer on a slave galley. This whip was somehow connected to the tattoos on his wrists. And with each strike of the whip, his hands contracted in pain.

The Mariner told me that the prisoner was once his overseer on a slave galley. This whip was somehow connected to the tattoos on the Mariner’s wrists. With each strike of the whip, his hands contracted in pain.
From the Depths
I noticed that the prisoner and the Mariner's tattoos were similar and asked him what they mean. He said he would tell me if I give him the dead prisoner's weapon. How did he know about the whip…?
When I make ANKH-ORE, Mariner and Warrior tie rope to ANKH-ORE and tie dead man with drawing on face to rope. After they do all this, they throw it onto bottom of sea. Me not understand…
From the Depths
Mariner and Warrior come see me. They say I make for them big stone with round hole in. Say they tie rope on stone and throw it into water from ship. This stone called ANKH-ORE.
Mariner and Warrior come to me. They say prisoner die suddenly from unknown illness. They say we need make anchor!

The Mariner believes that thanks to this sacrifice, the city has earned Anahita's Blessing. Anahita is the goddess of water and fertility in the lands he comes from. He says she helped him out of many a tight spot.
From the Depths

The Warrior told me of the outlander prisoner who came for the Mariner. They took his body to the sea as an offering, so that this terrible man will not rise from the dead and bring his people here next time.
This port may be small, but it's the perfect launch point for fishermen like myself!
Giving Berth
The Chief has asked me to build a port. And while I know all about the sea, ships, and fish, I don't know a thing about construction. Can you help me out?
The storm has calmed, but the city is still flooded. Thank the Gods that no one was hurt. On the other hand, our city's streets are knee-deep in water. I've never seen anything like it in my life.
From the Depths

A strong storm blew last night and continues to rage at sea now. Giant waves smash against the shore, and the river has burst its banks. This is a serious threat to the city. We must save our people and supplies!
When I went to the Beekeeper's house, I saw a huge animal. It looked like a whale, but a little smaller and with two tusks. We decided it'd be best to put it back in the river.
From the Depths

The water is dropping, albeit slowly. I had it worse than most during the flood. Many valuable papers got soaked, and now I have to dry them out. As if that wasn't enough, the Beekeeper came to me and said there's a giant creature lying outside his house and howling.
My Lord, I caught one of these fine birds by the Bakery as a sign of my good intentions. Let it be a symbol of this city's growing prosperity. I promise not to let you down.
From the Depths
My Lord, I have some good news for you. Many pink-backed pelicans have begun to appear on the shore. My experience tells me that these birds settle where there are many fish.
I found a beautiful cup I once bought from a visiting merchant and filled it with beer for the Master. After a few swigs, he cheered up, and crying that he was full of ideas, ran out of the Brewery!
From the Depths
The Master of the Papyrus Mill came to visit me at the Brewery. He looks very tired and I've decided to lift his spirits. I'll find a beautiful cup for him!

I fulfilled Nimiru's request and caught an eel for her. This fish has a very painful bite. But imagine my surprise when I discovered that Nimiru managed to bring the lethally wounded soldier back to life using those very same bites!
Underwater World

A unit of our troops returned from the desert after falling into an enemy ambush. One of the warriors is unconscious, and Nimiru asked me to catch an electric eel in the river at once and bring it to the Sepat…

I met the Nomad and the Warrior in the Brewery, who decided to ask me about my adventures. I had to tell them the terrible story of how my city was attacked by people with fish faces and turtle shells who killed many of its citizens.
Underwater World
After yet another successful catch, I decided to go see the Brewer for a mug of beer. But first I had to take my catch to the Market, where the Tradeswoman was waiting for me.

The Mariner knew what fish I was taking about. He said he didn't catch bichirs before because of their rock hard scales, but it turns out the meat underneath truly is delicious and tender. Now we can sell it to the merchants.
Underwater World

I read about the bichir in the scrolls - a rare fish which inhabited this river in ancient times. Our ancestors considered its meat the most delicious of all. I'll ask the Mariner to try and catch one and bring it to the market.

I went to see the Mariner in the evening, as promised. He had a nice surprise for me - a catch of oysters. I steamed them and served them to my customers that same evening, and everyone was pleased with the new snack.
Underwater World
I asked the Mariner to find something in the sea to serve as a snack with beer. He said he has an idea, and asked me to come back in the evening.
When Nimiru see what I find, we realize it is huge old fish skeleton. Master say that many years ago there was deep sea where city is now. I not know that this happens.
Underwater World
I dig new tunnel and find big white thing. But it not stone. I go to Nimiru and Master of Papyrus Mill for help, to find out what I find.
Recently, I bought a kemenche from the merchants - a stringed musical instrument from my homeland. I love to sit with it on the shore by night and drift into memories of my former life.
Underwater World

I finally found some time to be alone in the evening. I haven't seen my beloved for several years now. She disappeared the day my city was attacked by those sea monsters. I remember the melody I used to love playing to her in the evenings.
The Farmer had a pile of bits and pieces for his garden in his shed. After I dug around a while, I found some strong wire and fashioned it into several excellent hooks.
From the Depths
It's high time to go fishing, but I have no tackle at all. I'm going to need strong wire for a hook. I'll go see if the Farmer or Tradeswoman have anything.
On this raft, I can sail far from the shore and get an even bigger catch. Soon, I'll be able to build other rafts and teach anyone who wants to learn how to sail one.
Underwater World
My Lord, I have suffered much at the hands of the sea and the creatures hiding in its depths. I tried to keep away from it for a long time, but it seems I am firmly tied to it.
The monster tried to ruin our plan more than once. If it weren't for the power of the totem, we wouldn't have been able to reinforce the bank.
A Voracious Enemy
I saw the size of this underwater monster - the KRA-KEN - from the cliff. We have to secure the bank at once and erect barriers. We should also obtain the totem's support.

We managed to beat the kraken using pots filled with tar placed in a fishing net. When the beast grabbed hold of the bait, my warriors shot burning arrows at it. The pots exploded and covered the kraken in burning tar.
A Voracious Enemy
The kraken's already taken a few hits thanks to our totem. I thought of a great idea to help us get the better of him once and for all. I'm going to need help from the Potter and Mariner.

The people on the bank started picking up the relics that fell out of it. I took a few trinkets myself too. I'll trade them for something later. Nimiru said that I got a heart-shaped vessel and something like a magical staff.
A Voracious Enemy
I had to make several boats so that the citizens could go out to the sea and pull the dead kraken onto the bank. They dressed the carcass and found much of interest in its stomach.

Who would have thought that kraken meat would sell so well? Rumors spread in the city that this meat bestows strength and courage, and in no time at all, the Warrior had bought almost half of it for the Barracks!
A Voracious Enemy
The meat from the dead sea monster turned out to be perfectly edible. The Chief asked me to summon more soldiers to carve the carcass into pieces and send it to the market.

I traded the heart-shaped container to the Beekeeper for an entire barrel of honey. He said that storing honey in a container like that is very symbolic. As for the staff, I gave it to a young traveler by the name of Mentuhotep. The boy was willing to give me all the money he had left, but I couldn't take it…
A Voracious Enemy
I'm going to try selling the items from the kraken's belly. A customer can be found for any item!
The stone depicts the mother cobra – the patroness of fertility. I thought this stele would blend in perfectly among the Farmer's plots and bring us more crops.
A Voracious Enemy
When I came to the bank to see the dead monster, I saw people picking up the things it had swallowed. No one but me paid any attention to the old carven stone.

The Farmer gave me a small stone with a scorpion on it. I've heard that such stones used to serve as amulets for children against poisonous insects. I immediately took it to Sheriti, the Tradeswoman's daughter.
A Voracious Enemy
The Farmer offered to meet me in the Brewery. He said he has something for me as thanks for the Isis stele. Since he put it in the Field, his crops have been healthier than ever.
This is a statue of the Goddess Mehet-Weret, mother to the God Ra and mistress of the endless sea of the sky. No doubt it brings the Mariner good luck. He was very happy when I told him about this.
A Voracious Enemy
On entering the port, I saw that the Mariner's ship has an interesting cow-shaped statue tied to its prow. I remember reading about this symbol in scrolls belonging to the Master of the Papyrus Mill.

I thought for a long time and constructed a formula which allows me to calculate the calendar and understand how to use the numbers to predict the future. It's as if someone placed this knowledge in my head.
Thoth's Wisdom

Since I drank from the strange vessel in the Brewery, odd things have been happening to me. It's as if I know the answers to any questions I ask. I'm working on a formula now, and I think it'll be ready today.
Judging by the maps, this city is well located next to a vast river. The Nomad says there are many settlements upstream. My ships could help us form a good connection to them.
From the Depths
I've decided to learn about the lands these people live on, and about their closest neighbors. I think I should look at some old maps and speak with the Nomad – he's been everywhere and seen it all.

While I waited for Nimiru, I had time to write a formula. It allows you to find treasure using the heavenly bodies. Nimiru already knew why I called her here. She told me that the ancient God Thoth is speaking through me.
Thoth's Wisdom
I agreed to meet Nimiru in the Sepat. It seems as if someone else's will controls me, and I'm constantly making strange discoveries. Something is struggling out of my head again even now.
I believe we can uncover Thoth's secret using the formula the Master wrote and the Miner's skills. I hope it's something useful to our city and helps us fight Amrun and his army.
Thoth's Wisdom

It seems Thoth wants to tell us something. It's no coincidence that he gave such wisdom to our Master. It is written in the scrolls of the Papyrus Mill that Thoth hid his most mysterious wisdom and secrets in the land itself. We need to read them again, and then go see the Miner.
Judging by what I've discovered, the city will soon be threatened by some sort of danger. Our citizens should start stocking up on food in case a famine strikes.
Thoth's Wisdom
I decided to use Thoth's first formula to find out something interesting about the future. It's amazing how much numbers can tell us.

When the Master and I went down into one of the caves, he said we need to wait a little. After a short time, a ray of moonlight appeared in the cave, lighting up an item as it refracted - an old ring.
Thoth's Wisdom

I had a terrible dream in which I saw a foreboding shadow hovering above the Mariner. I went to the Master to tell him about the danger. The Master said that he already knows about it, and brought me to the Mine to find some kind of artifact.
Directly underneath the Beekeeper's house, we dug into a brick cell with a giant gold chest inside. We needed six soldiers to pull it out.
Thoth's Wisdom

I worked with the second formula for a long time, and finally, I discovered where Thoth's main treasure is hidden. Along with Nimiru and the Miner, I went down into the Mine and we searched for the right path for a long time. It appears we'll have to dig underneath the Apiary…

When the Master and I managed to open the chest, we found a huge number of scrolls inside and started reading them at once. They speak of an ancient civilization which ruled the world before the coming of man. Thoth belonged to this civilization and possessed great wisdom.
Thoth's Wisdom
Thoth's gold chest emanates great strength and bright light. I feel it - great knowledge is hidden inside. We must open it at once. This chest has awaited its hour for too long.
I decided to give the pendant to the first girl I found. It just so happened that I found Sheriti - the Tradeswoman's daughter from the Market. She was very grateful for my gift.
Love and Fear
After the attack on my city, I found a pendant in the street which I once gave to my beloved. I can keep it no longer - I cannot stand it. Let it bring joy to someone else.

I'll remember this day for a long time! Today, the Chief expressed his gratitude to me and presented me with a gift as an honored commander before all the citizens. I'm grateful, of course, but I was only doing my duty.
Love and Fear

One of the Chief's messengers came to me and asked me to go to the Sepat today. I'm very tired after my last campaign, but I didn't object - what the Chief wants, the Chief gets. There'll be time to sleep later.
I offered to help the Mariner build more solid ships. If I transfer some of my soldiers to these ships, our city will have a military fleet, something that will significantly bolster our strength.
Love and Fear
Inspired by the Chief and the people's respect to me, I decided to make some improvements to the army. This is going to take some work.

I think I drank too much at the Brewery. When I went to the Port, I staggered and fell into the sea. Imagine my surprise when a beautiful creature appeared from the water and carried me onto shore, saving me.
Love and Fear
I find myself again tortured by thoughts of my beloved. I'm going to visit the Brewery and down a mug of beer, then I'll sit on the shore and pluck the strings of my kemenche.

The Tradeswoman said they don't have anything like that to sell me, but her daughter Sheriti led me to the heap they throw all the market waste on each evening. I found a few pieces of reed there that I could use to make an excellent float.
From the Depths
On my last fishing trip, I managed to hook a giant fish. But the beast broke away and escaped into the sea, dragging my tackle off behind it. I still have hooks and lines, but that was my last float…
The Master of the Papyrus Mill told me that before people came to this world, there lived creatures that called themselves Atlanteans. They rode on the backs of HIPPO-CAMP-I. How wonderful!
Love and Fear

Nimiru told me tha the creature that saved me is called a HIPPO-CAMP-US – a water horse. It comes to visit me often, now. I'm going to go read about it in the scrolls, and then I'll catch some fish for it.

Last night, the Brewer saw something in a dream: the Mariner drowning in seawater. The Master of the Papyrus Mill said that he has read the portents using Thoth's first formula. They say the following: "The marten will kill the python." What could it mean…?
Love and Fear

I slept very badly last night. I sensed some kind of disaster, and decided to go and speak to my friends. Newly endowed with special powers as they are, I am sure the Master and the Brewer also felt something last night.
The entire bank is covered in starfish from the sea. I remember how my beloved and I used to pick them up and throw them back into the sea. We liked saving them.
Love and Fear

Today, my water horse got spooked by something and fled to the depths. It's never behaved like that before. The weather is behaving strangely too. A storm is brewing. I'm going to go take a walk on the bank.

After obtaining the totem's support, I wore the ring the Master recently gave me for luck. I whistled to my sea horse, mounted, and headed straight for the monster, and in the light of the moon, I struck it through its head…
Love and Fear

A storm broke out last night and a giant snake emerged from the sea and attacked my apprentice sailors. There was no one to protect them, and it was then that I knew that I have feared the sea for too long. The time has come to defeat my fear.
We managed to find an ancient amulet for the Mariner, created by the kinsmen of Thoth himself. Only one with the courage to stare fear in the eye can possess it.
Love and Fear
Since that terrible skirmish between the Mariner and the LE-VIA-THAN last night, our hero has been recovering in the Sepat. The Master and I want to find him a protective amulet as a gift.
Mom and I bought a Saluki cub for the Mariner. This type of dog is bred in his homeland. The Mariner was really grateful for his new friend and promised to take him along to sea.
Love and Fear
Uncle Mariner saved our city from the terrible sea monster. And he gave me a beautiful butterfly pendant! He's the bravest man ever, so mom and I decided to give him a gift.

The birds singing were lovebirds. I watched them and realized that I was like one of them now, like they are when they lose their beloved. But I won't die. I can be useful to other people – that's why I'm here. And my true love and I will meet again…
Love and Fear
I slowly came to after my insane battle with that terrible sea monster. I heard the birds singing beautifully outside my window and opened it to hear them better.
I lured one of them closer to feed it a small fish I got from the Mariner. These birds are so beautiful they could live in gardens. It's a shame we don't have any yet…
Love and Fear
I noticed that beautiful long-necked birds have begun to gather in our city since the Port was built. I need to see them more closely at night, when they're at their boldest.

At first I thought the Nomad's new pet panther had attacked the birds, but he denies it. Then I went to the Warrior to find out if his soldiers did it, but he said that most are out on a campaign and the rest are on guard duty. What beast could have done this…?
Love and Fear
When I came to look at the flamingos again, they were gone from their usual spot. Then I noticed blood and feathers on the grass… Who could have done this? I have to find out.

I noticed a lot of small animal tracks where the flamingos used to be, and the grass was all trodden down, like after a fight. At the Market, I saw a giant python corpse. The Tradeswoman said that people saw a small furry animal bite the snake to death.
Love and Fear
I decided to take another walk to the Port today and look for the flamingos again, in case any of them came back. Afterwards, I planned to go to the Market to buy a few ingredients to meet my needs.

The Mariner created some special baskets for us. If we put hot coals in them, then at night, the light will draw the fish closer to the bank, and we can catch them in large numbers using nets. It's a good idea.
From the Depths

Each day, more and more people come to the city, and they have to be fed. Apart from that, we send a lot of food to the neighboring villages. I'll ask the Mariner to think of a way for us to catch more fish.

I found the creature I was looking for. It was a marten. It was sitting on the bank and looking out to sea. It reminded me of the brave Mariner. Now I understand the prophecy uncovered by the Master of the Papyrus Mill.
Love and Fear
I went to look at where the snake was killed and saw that the flamingos had returned to the banks of the river again. I wanted to know what creature saved them, and I went to look for it.

Thank you, my Lord. These boys are fast and agile, they've taken to the job like… well, like fish to water. I made special fishing equipment for each of them. With time, I'll teach them to hunt hippos.
From the Depths

My Lord, if I had assistants, I could bring even more fish into the city. I need ten agile boys I can arm with harpoons and put to work catching fish in the shallows. Can I have your permission to spread the word in the Sepat?
When my people brought the Mariner's morning catch to the Market, I was amazed at how many fish there were. We won't want for food again, and we can help our neighbors too!
From the Depths
Well, the Mariner lived up to my hopes. He asked me to send several carts to the Port to pick up the morning catch for the Market. It seems we have a new source of food.

I handle my sharp sickles as well in the water as I do on land. I've said it to the chief many times: life would be a lot harder in the city without me. By the way, I heard that river weeds can be used in cooking. I'll take them to the Market.
From the Depths
Our new citizen, the Mariner, came to see me and asked for my help. He said the bank is overgrowing with weeds. They get tangled up in his nets and make it difficult to get them out of the water.
The monster on the bank turned out to be a gigantic jellyfish! It came from the depths of the sea and was enormous in size. It's lucky I brought people with me and asked the totem for aid!
From the Depths
I hear the frightened cries of citizens! They say there's a giant monster on the bank stinging people with its tentacles. I'll take a few of my boys and deal with the beast!
When the waters of the Nile rise, the port's walkway disappears underwater. We must figure out a way to extend it further onto the shoreline.
Traders are taking advantage of the port, but they need somewhere to store their cargo before it goes to market. I need some storage, quickly!
The Chief is worried that the enemy could attack the port and hamstring our supply chain. He wants the buildings reinforced immediately!
Because we have the most secure port in the region, more traders are using it. We must add more cargo storage to accommodate them.
While it's great to have larger boats coming into port, they could easily damage our wooden pier. We must reinforce it with stone.
Workers are coming from across the region to find jobs in the city. It would be nice to have somewhere for them to stay at the port while they find employment.
The fishermen who utilize the port each day would like vendor stalls from which to sell their catch. What do you think?
Excellent! This stone you added is sturdy, and should withstand the Nile's waves for many years.
Perfect! Now the city's fishermen can launch their boats no matter what mood the Nile's waters may be in.
The new addition is perfect for storing cargo, and it beats having to sleep on it.
The port appears much stronger, now. I'm sure the Chief will be pleased with your efforts.
With this new space, we can organize the trader's cargo by type. Our economy is booming!
Perfect! Now, if one of those big boats taps the pier, we won't be out of business!
The extra living quarters you built will be a huge help in growing the city. Thank you!
Those stalls are just what the fishermen were hoping for! Those who want to buy fresh fish will know right where to get it!
A Good Berth
The waters of the Nile will rot away the pier's timbers with time. We must reinforce the dock as soon as possible.
Праздник гончаров
Ура, вот наш победитель! Ты собрал больше всех глины! Поздравляю, ты действительно самый ловкий!
Сегодня праздник гончарного круга, попробуй добыть больше всех глины, и ты получишь приз.
Excellent! Now we can move on!
The pyramid is full of hidden hallways, vaults, and tombs. However, we'll need find keys order to open them!
Each rune collected is a step toward unlocking the mystery of the gate!
This pyramid is home to the fabled Golden Runes. We'll need to collect them to unlock the gate's full power.
We've found the keys! Now we can proceed.
We'll need to find keys in order to unlock the pyramid's next area.
It's hard to not disturb the ancient artifacts in the temple. Perhaps we can explore them another time.
Ignore the artifacts, and watch for Golden Runes. That's why we're here.
Stay alert! You never know what we may encounter inside the ancient pyramid.
There are new discoveries to be made within the pyramid. We should gather our people and head inside.
Let us see what is hidden in the next chamber.
There's a large chamber just beyond this one, but we can't reach it without the proper keys.
Excellent! We've recovered additional runes!
With each step we get closer to activating the gate. The Golden Runes will tell us how!
I believe that soon, the mysteries will be uncovered, and our questions answered.
Our city is home to a great many mysteries. This pyramid is another example.
We've opened the passage! I can't help but wonder what we might find inside.
The ancient maps I found indicate there is a secret passage nearby, but we can't hope to access it without the correct number of keys.
I'll add these runes to our collection immediately!
It's easy to get distracted inside the pyramid, but we must recover as many Golden Runes as possible.
Surely our ancestors wanted us to discover this pyramid.
This pyramid must have been built thousands of years ago! Have you ever seen something so ancient?
You found more keys! Let us continue exploring the pyramid.
There are so many unexplored rooms in this pyramid. We need keys to open them all!
Don't worry, we'll see the truth with our own eyes soon enough.
According to the historical texts, Golden Runes are a source of great energy. You can understand why they're so important.
I hope when we finally open the gate, we will leave our own mark on the city's history texts!
Our ancestors built such a majestic temple. Can you believe what they accomplished?
Stay steadfast! Our journey is hard, but I believe it will all be worth it.
We're so close to collecting all the Golden Runes we need to activate the gate! Can you believe it?
Our adventure through the pyramid has been long, but I feel the road is almost at its end.
We must keep going! The pyramid will soon reveal its secrets.
I'm working long hours and it's difficult to make it home in the evenings. Would you have time to help me build a better living quarters?
I'm having trouble processing all the materials we're excavating. Some extra storage would go a long way to help us.
A chunk of iron ore broke free from the pulley and crashed through the side of my home! I think it's time to build some stronger walls…
One of my workers said the mine shaft is in danger of collapsing! If we don't reinforce it, we could lose everything!
We're excavating much heavier materials now. I worry that the mine's wooden supports may buckle beneath the weight!
Mining more robust materials means we'll need more workers. However, I have nowhere to put them! Perhaps an expansion is in order…
The Chief wants to use the port to export our raw materials around the region. But first we'll need to find a way to bring in wagons.
Much better! Now it feels like home sweet home.
Oh, thank you! This will make things so much easier. I was having to store chunks of granite underneath my bed!
Hopefully we'll have no more accidents, but now I feel like my quarters can withstand a knick or two.
With the mine shaft reinforced, it should keep its integrity for years!
The stone supports you've added are just as strong as anything we mine. Good work!
Thank you! With the additional space, I can house at least a dozen more workers.
Perhaps the Chief was right! Now we have a clear path from the mine to the port!
Thanks for helping us make the game better!
Collaboration
Enter your feedback.
Please rate the game and share your feedback because we want to make the game more exciting for you!
Don't worry that we have little water! This water supply will last us long time.
Our energy has been restored! This supply should last some time, but if we need more, we can always visit the shop.
Buy a Drop of Water.
Desert Gold
To collect resources we must constantly expend energy. Luckily, there are ways to restore that energy.
To get resources, you have to constantly expend [1]energy[1]. Let me show you how [2]to restore[2] it.
I see you're feeling better now! Let's go, my friend! Great things await!
Use the drop of water.
Desert Gold
The sun is very hot. You're thirsty? Luckily, we have water supplies. I'll show you where.
Starting each level expends [1]energy[1], but I can show you how to [2]restore[2] it.
[1]Open your Inventory[1] to use the elixir.
I've always wanted to run my own salon, and now that the city has recovered, I think it's time to start my business!
It's as beautiful as I imagined! I can't wait to get started.
The salon is little more than walls and a door. It needs some style… some personality!
My customers want to be pampered in every meaning of the word. I wish I had some additional space to serve them.
I love the salon, but it needs a woman's touch. It's clearly been designed by a man's hand. I've written down some ideas…
The desert sand is wearing away the paint on the side of the salon! Do you have time to help me with some touch ups?
You know what the salon needs now? More color! Do you think you can help?
My customers say that as soon as they leave the salone, the wind blows their hair and sand gets in their makeup. We need to find a way to stop such madness!
I want my customers to be as comfortable as possible in the salon. Perhaps we can add some new decorations?
Let's add something grand to the salon… something the city has never seen before!
The lounge area on the second floor is perfect! Thanks for taking my ideas into consideration.
Ah, the grand staircase to the rooftop deck will surely have my customers enjoying the lounge area.
You took my suggestions! The new additions to the building are adorable!
Someone swapped the blue paint with pink… who could have done such a thing? Wait, why are you giving me a suspicious look?
You're a miracle worker!
These new awnings will surely protect my customers from the weather.
It's perfect, and the customers adore the new look.
A swimming pool? Amazing! You've really outdone yourself this time!
This Sepat may not be a mansion, but it will provide the children with a safe place to rest their heads.
The Gift of Giving
The Lady is a very beautiful… er… kind soul who cares for the city's homeless children. Now, I have enough clay to rebuild the Sepat for her!
Праздник города
